loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is 36 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Lorena works very hard to provide for them.

Lorena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, beverages, home product care and other groceries.

Lorena has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, condiments, biscuits, junk foods and other groceries. 

In the future, Lorena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, beverages, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Roselli

texts.en:
Roselli is 48 years old, married with four children.

Roselli works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell like milk, coffee, drinks, canned goods, noodles, spices and other personal care products.

Roselli has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from buying and selling vinegar.

Roselli aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell like milk, coffee, drinks, canned goods, noodles, spices and other personal care products

loans.name: Maria Ofelia

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 47 años de edad, es una mujer soltera, echada para adelante, emprendedora, creatividad, triunfadora, tiene un negocio de distribución de bebidas y productos naturales que están muy de moda hoy en día, muchas personas que venden ambulantemente viene y surten donde María, por ello su negocio es muy importante y con este está soportando los gastos de su hogar y mejora mucho la calidad de vida en su hogar.
Su sueño es tener un hogar propio para vivir junto con sus tres hijos y con su negocio busca cumplir está meta por ello necesita vender mucho más, aumentar sus clientes para que este sueño pueda volverse Realidad.
María Solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de cuidado de la salud en grandes cantidades pues cabe recordar que ella es distribuidora autorizada de la marca.
texts.en:
María is a 47 year old single mother. She is moving forward, enterprising, creative, a winner. She has a business of distributing drinks and natural products that are in fashion these days. Many people who sell them itinerantly come and stock up from María. Her business is very important for her and with it she supports the household expenses and has improved the family's quality of living greatly.

Her dream is to have her own house to live in together with her 3 children and with her business she is looking to achieve this goal. So she needs to sell a lot more and increase her clients for this dream to become reality. María s requesting a loan to buy an assortment of health care products in large quantities as it is worth keeping in mind that she is the authorized distributor of the brand.

loans.use: to buy health care products in large quantities.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace, at the age of 27, is a charismatic and helpful woman who works in her own small farm that she began due to the need to generate income to support her family. In spite of all the obstacles, she had the strength and the determination to pick herself up and keep on going, and now she's been farming for the past seven years. She works every day for 10 hours by herself. Grace is seeking a loan to construct a dairy shed. This will provide shelter for her favorite animal. The thing she enjoys most about dairy farming is selling milk. However, in order for a dairy cow to be more productive, the farmer needs to be good at dairy management. Your loan will help Grace construct a cowshed that will help very much with dairy management. The shelter will enable her to prepare feed rations and feed the cow. The shed will also ensure the cow is always in a clean and hygienic environment. She is projecting a significant increase in milk production. The extra money will go to loan repayment and to her children’s education. Her dream is for her children to live a better life with fulfilled basic needs.

loans.use: To construct a modern dairy shed

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is grateful that she was granted a 20,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase materials needed in her doormat-making business.  Her earnings helped send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses. 

She would now like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy cloth, fabrics, thread, and other materials needed to make her doormats. Her income from her business is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Lilia hopes to maintain her current business and look for other types of business to improve her income. She desires that all her children will earn a college education to allow them better opportunities in life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, cloth, thread, and other materials for her doormat-making business.

loans.name: Zacarias

texts.en:
Zacarias is 56 years old and comes from the community of San Miguel, Bohol. He is married with one adult son. 

For many years now, Zacarias has been growing rice to earn a living. He also operates a sari-sari store business. He would like to expand his business and improve his inventory. 

He is asking for a loan to buy cigarettes, liquor, rice, and canned goods. This will attract more customers in his neighborhood. 

In the future, he would like to have a bigger farm and store for a better income so he can save for old age too.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, liquor, rice, and canned goods.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a 41-year-old married woman with six children, four of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Marilyn has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Marilyn has been in this business for 12 years. 

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en:
Mabel is 46 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Mabel is borrowing PHP 5000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Mabel has been in this business for 4 years and also earns additional income from rice vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Gladys, 26 years of age, a very hardworking, honest, and dedicated farmer who lives in Chebole, a remote village in Bomet. She is happily married and is blessed with three adorable children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last sixteen years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs and varieties of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in another small personal business. The Bomet area is very populated and demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” 

Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand, which is really high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. 

Being a woman, accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and that she will be able to buy more poultry. Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market and this will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. 

Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and increase her poultry market to other markets and this will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used in fully repaying back the loan and permanently changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going child.

loans.use: To buy poultry to meet local demand and improve her living conditions

loans.name: Alaa' Al-Deen

texts.en:
Alaa' Al-Deen is a 20-year-old single man from Nablus City. He lives with his family in a small, humble house. His father is a worker, where he gets low and unstable income. 

Alaa' is a student in a local university, where he studies information technology. He took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to pay university fees for this semester. This will help him complete his studies and find a suitable job in the future. 

Alaa' appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay university fees for this semester

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for planting

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 25 years old and married with one child. Mary Ann works very hard to provide for her family.

Mary Ann runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, junk foods, and other groceries.

Mary Ann has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as beverages, biscuits, noodles, shampoo, and other groceries. 

In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, junk foods, and other groceries

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is 55 years old and married with four children.

Luz works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, personal product care and other groceries.

Luz has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from rice vending.

Luz aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, personal product care and other groceries

loans.name: Genavie

texts.en:
Genavie works hard to support her family. Genavie is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to purchase more ingredients like rice, sugar, milk, etc.

Genavie has been in this business for 5 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients like rice, sugar, milk, etc

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 44 years old and married with three children.

Marilou works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal product care, beverages, home product care and other groceries.

Marilou has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Marilou aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal product care, beverages, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.en:
Genoveva is 66 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Genoveva has been in this business for 19 years.

In the future Genoveva would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
Gregorio, tiene 54 años está casado la esposa tiene 52 años viven con sus nietos en casa propia en la comunidad e Tocagon que pertenece a la parroquia de San Rafael de la ciudad de Otavalo, el sector es una zona de producción de esteras y también elaboran otros tipos de productos con el material Totoras que son bien reconocidos por la zona y además por el sector producen las frutillas que las comercializa dentro u fuera de la provincia.
Gregorio elabora y comercializa esteras en diferentes zonas de la provincia esta actividad lo viene realizando desde hace 30 años atrás actividad que aprendió de los padres, estas costumbres son herencias familiares que vienen ejerciendo de generación en generación y es por eso que él aprendió a manejar la actividad que hoy en día es su negocio familiar y también le da ingresos para solventar todas las necesidades que viene cada mes, el realiza ventas de esteras ambulantemente en zonas rurales y urbanas en esta actividad están involucrados los dos tanto él y la esposa no tiene transporte para movilizar los productos y lo realizan cargando en la espalda para poder ofrecer en estos sectores.
Con el crédito van a comprar más esteras para ofrecer en otras partes de la provincia incrementar lo que son esteras medianas que se están vendiendo en mayor cantidad.
texts.en:
Gregorio is 54 years old and married. His wife is 52 years old. They live with their grandchildren in their own home in the community of Tocagon, which is part of the parish of San Rafael in the city of Otavalo. The area produces reed mats and other products made made from “totora” [a large reed], which are known throughout the region. The area also produces strawberries, which are sold within the province and beyond.

Gregorio produces and sells reed mats in different parts of the province. He has been doing this for thirty years after learning it from his parents.  These customs are family heritage that is passed from generation to generation. This is why he learned the craft that is now his family business and provides him with an income to cover his monthly expenses. He sells his reed mats traveling among rural and urban areas. 

He and his wife are both involved in this activity. Neither he nor his wife have a way to transport the products, so they carry them on their backs in order to offer them throughout the region. 

With the loan they will buy more reed mats to offer in other parts of the province, including more mid-sized mats, which are selling in greater numbers.

loans.use: to buy medium sized reed mats and be able to offer them outside of the province.

loans.name: Stella Irene

texts.es:
Ella es Stella es una mujer de 47 años de edad, ella es separada, es cabeza de familia y tiene dos hijos, ella tiene un salón de belleza, gracias a este negocio puede generar los recursos para su familia y mejorar las condiciones de vida en su casa.
Stella sueña con tener un negocio amplio, que sus clientes sienta gusto de ir a su salón de belleza, que tenga una experiencia, que le comente a personas cercanas y hacer crecer por montones su amado negocio.
Stella trabaja con una herramienta hace varios años, con la ayuda de un préstamo podría comprar instrumentos más modernos, como planchas para el pelo más efectiva, secadores, mejores shampo, tratamientos y pinturas que de agilizaran su trabajo un 50%, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de estos instrumentos que de seguro harán un gran aporte en el trabajo diario de Stella.
texts.en:
Stella is a 47 year old woman. She is separated and is head of the household and has two children. She has a beauty salon. Thanks to this business she can generate income for her family and improve the living conditions in her home.

Stella dreams of expanding her business, of her customers being happy to come to the beauty salon, of having an experience and telling close by people in order to grow her beloved business by heaps.

Stella has been working with equipment for several years. With the help of a loan she could buy more modern implements such as more effective hair irons, hairdryers, better shampoo, treatments and hair dye to speed up her work some 50%. So she is asking for a loan in order to buy these tools that will make a great contribution to her daily work.

loans.use: buy more modern implements such as more effective hair irons, hairdryers, better shampoo, treatments and hair dye to speed up her work

loans.name: Mayra

texts.es: Doña Mayra nació en la ciudad de Matagalpa en el año de 1975 , a la edad de 7 años empezó a estudiar su primaria y luego se dedico a ayudarle a su madre en labores del hogar. Actualmente es viuda y tiene 3 hijos , Ella  se dedica a labores de agricultura y ganadería y ha tenido la oportunidad de comprar una propiedad fuera de Matagalpa donde actualmente vive con sus hijos y trabaja con ellos cosechando café, los tres hijos están estudiando el hijo mayor está terminando su carrera de agronomía los otros dos están terminando su secundaria comenta doña Mayra que apoyara bastante a sus hijos para que sean alguien en la vida. En el lugar donde vive doña Mayra no hay luz eléctrica y se tiene que estar alumbrando con candela y foco por eso ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de un sistema solar y así poder ya alumbrarse con luz producida por el panel solar y sus hijos se podrán alumbrar para realizar las tareas que le dejan de clase, ella estaría agradecida si le brindan la oportunidad de este préstamo para comprar el panel solar que será instalado en la casa de habitación.
texts.en: Mayra was born in the city of Matagalpa in 1975.  At the age of 7, she began her primary education and then she worked helping her mother with household labors.  Currently, she is a widow and has 3 children.  She works in agriculture and cattle and has had the opportunity to purchase a property outside of Matagalpa where she currently lives with her children and works with them harvesting coffee.  Her three children are studying; her oldest is finishing his degree in agriculture and the other two are finishing high school.  Mayra comments that she supports her children so that they will "be somebody in life".  In the place where she lives, Mayra doesn't have electricity and has to use candles and fire for light sources, so for that reason, she is requesting a loan to purchase a solar power system so she can use the light produced by the solar panel and her children can have light to complete their homework. She would be grateful for the opportunity of this loan to purchase the solar panel that will be installed in her home.

loans.use: to purchase a solar power system.

loans.name: Irenea

texts.en:
Her name is Irenea, 56, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. Married to Ignacio, her business partner, she manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal and household needs 

Irenea operates a small vegetable stand. She buys various kinds of veggies from a wholesaler from a farm and sells them by the kilo. Veggies are a staple in Filipino household, they are always part of ingredients to make their dish more nutritious and delicious. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of Php 800 a day. 

To help her continue operations of her vegetable stand she is requesting a Php 20000 loan which she will use to buy different kinds of veggies such as potatoes, cabbage, lettuce, ginger, onions, garlic, squash, and sweet potato tops. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. Her earnings is their source to support their daily sustenance. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Irenea aims to sustain her business and prays that God will continue to prosper her store. She hopes to be able to save for her old age. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for various kinds of vegetables to sell at her stand.

loans.name: Merlene

texts.en:
Merlene is 27 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Merlene works very hard to provide for them.

Merlene runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Merlene has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as condiments, beverages, snack foods, coffee, and other groceries. 

In the future, Merlene would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is 47 years old and married with six children.

Narcisa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, beverages, and other groceries.

Narcisa has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from food vending.

Narcisa aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, beverages, and other groceries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa is 43 years old and married with two children. With her children in school, Nimfa works very hard to provide for them.

Nimfa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal product care and other groceries.

Nimfa has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as bananas, carrots, straw, condiments and other groceries. 

In the future, Nimfa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Pacencia

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of two children, Pacencia works hard to support her family.

She has a egg vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Pacencia is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy more eggs to sell for her egg vending business.

Pacencia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more eggs to sell

loans.name: Libardo De Jesus

texts.es:
Libardo, a sus 53 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja.
Debido a la falta de oportunidades laborales se ve obligado a buscar opciones para salir adelante y desea montar su propio negocio, iniciara una venta de ganado bovino.
Por esta razón se motiva para solicitar el crédito, que invertirá en la compra de algunas cabezas de ganado para poder arrancar con esta actividad.

De esta forma, Libardo espera poder recibir los recursos necesarios para salir adelante al lado de su familia y poder ofrecer a su familia una mejor condición de vida, además esto servirá como impulso para avanzar hacia el cumplimiento de su principal sueño que es tener la sostenibilidad necesaria para conocer el mundo.
texts.en: Libardo is 53 years old and lives with his partner.  Due to the lack of job opportunities he's forced to look for options to get ahead and wishes to start his own business selling cattle.  This motivates him to request a loan which he will use to buy a few heads of cattle so he can start with this activity.  In this way Libardo will have the necessary resources to get ahead with his family and offer them a better quality of life.  In addition to that it will serve as motivation to move forward his main dream which is to be self-sufficient so he can travel the world.

loans.use: to buy a few heads of cattle so he can start with this activity.

loans.name: Sophal's Group

texts.en:
A 39-year-old mother of three children, living in Kampong Cham province, Sophal has been a rice and cassava farmer for twenty one years. She could earn about 34,900KHR per day. 

Due to lack of funds, she is now leading a group to take a new Kiva loan via VisionFund to buy seeds and pay for plowing fees. She hopes that this loan will help her to gain more yield and stabilize her current business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay for plowing fees

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase jembes and fertilizers for farming so as to get better harvest for sale and family use.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare motorcycle parts, pay for servicing for better operations, and gain more income.

loans.name: Rosalía

texts.es:
Rosalía es una mujer de 39 años de edad, es casada tiene una linda familia de dos hijos de las edades entre 11 y 15 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Rosalía con el afán de generar sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica  a la venta de banano, esta labor lo realiza ella desde hace ocho años.
Rosalía ahora se encuentra muy preocupada porque hasta ahora ella no cuenta con una estufa donde pueda preparar los alimentos de una forma más rápida, por tal razón solicita un préstamo para poder comprarlo y así ahorrar un poco más en la compra de leña que ahora se encuentra muy caro.
Rosalía sueña con que sus hijos sean grandes profesionales para poder tener mejores oportunidades.
texts.en:
Rosalía is a 39-year-old woman.  She is married and has a lovely family with two children, ages 11 and 15.  This humble family lives in the community of Sololá.

With the goal of generating some income and getting her family ahead, Rosalía works selling bananas.  She has been doing this work for eight years.

Right now, Rosalía is quite worried because up until this point in time, she hasn’t had a stove where she can make food more quickly.  Because of this, she is asking for a loan to be able to buy one and, in this way, save a little more money in the purchase of firewood, which is currently very expensive.

Rosalía dreams that her children will be great professionals so that they can have better opportunities.

loans.use: to buy a stove

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Rosalie works hard to support her family.

She has a buy & sell scrap business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from videoke rentals. Rosalie is borrowing PHP 50000 through NWTF to buy scrap like plastic, etc. to sell for her business for her buy & sell scrap business.

Rosalie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy scrap like plastic etc. to sell for her business

loans.name: Srin's Group

texts.en:
A 47-year-old mother of five children, living in Kampong Cham province, Srin is a cassava and rice farmer for twenty nine years. Through these businesses, she could earn about 39,800KHR per day to support her family. 

Now she lacks funds to buy seeds and pay for renting farmland so she is leading a group to fulfill her needs. She hopes to improve her family’s living condition and ability to renovate her old house.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay for renting farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva lenders! Meet Josephine, a 45-year-old mother who is so humble, honest and a very hardworking mother on this planet Earth. Josephine really adores her family and will always do anything good so that they never go to bed with hungry stomachs. Josephine hails from the Kapsowar area of Kenya. Josephine never got the opportunity to advance her education and get a white collar job but this did not kill her dream of wanting to succeed in life. Josephine started farming and has been doing farming for the past six years. Throughout those years, she has gathered so much experience and all the farming techniques are at her fingertips. 

Josephine practices mixed farming on her farm and through the profits.  She has managed to take care of her family's needs and give her children a good education because she believes that education is the only “key to success”. Josephine is a mother who is very enterprising. 

She is seeking a loan of KES 50,000 to start horticulture farming on her farm. Because of favorable weather patterns, a good road network in her village, good soil and a ready market for horticulture products, Josephine wants to take advantage of that and reap more profits. Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva to help aspiring women like Josephine to make their farming dreams come to reality through training and loan financing. 

Josephine hopes that through the loan, she will improve her living conditions. Josephine's dreams and projections are that by the end of the first year, she will not only be selling in the local market but will also be selling in international markets through exporting fruits and vegetables. Through this, she will be able to assure her children a secure future and uninterrupted learning because she will be able to pay tuition fees on time. Josephine is not a selfish woman and will also want to impact positively on society. That is why she will employ people to work for her on her horticulture farm, thus having an impact on society.

loans.use: To start horticulture farming which will create jobs locally

loans.name: El Eucalipto Group

texts.es:
El grupo “ El Eucalipto”, conformado por 2 mujeres y 1 varón dedicados a diferentes negocios, pero con una sola razón, seguir creciendo y ayudando a sus familias. Coordinado por Jonathan, de 22 años, casado, inicio su negocio de compra-venta de leña y cosechas, con la ayuda de su suegro, en el mercado municipal desde hace 6 años. Y su préstamo actual lo utilizara para comprar leña, tamarindo, aguacate y mamón. 
Las otras integrantes son; Keylin de 20 años. Esta joven se dedica a la venta de legumbres, e invertirá en cebollas, papa, chiltoma, tomates. Marlene de 51 años, prepara y vende tamales pisques en el mercado de Masaya e invertirá en la compra de leña y maíz.
texts.en:
The “El Eucalipto” group is made up of two women and one man who work in various businesses, but with one purpose: to keep growing and helping their families.  The group is coordinated by Jonathan, age 22, who is married.  With the help of his father-in-law, he began his business buying and selling firewood and produce in the city market six years ago.  He will use his current loan to buy firewood, tamarind, avocado, and mamón [a local fruit].

The other group members include Kaylin, age 20.  This young woman works selling vegetables, and will invest in onions, potatoes, peppers, and tomatoes.  Marlene, age 51, prepares and sells tamales filled with bean paste in the Masaya market.  She will invest in the purchase of firewood and corn.

loans.use: to buy firewood, tamarind, avocado, and mamón (a local fruit)

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 51 years old, married, and has six children to provide for. She is engaged in rice production business in her little rice farm. To help her husband she wants to earn income and able to provide for her children's needs. Her husband is also a farmer, helping Victoria in their rice field. She aims for a good production and that's why she borrowed a loan to buy fertilizer for her rice farm.

Victoria wants to save money out of her business to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for the rice farm.

loans.name: Clara Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Clara es una mujer muy emprendedora y creativa, desde hace mucho tiempo ha querido ser independiente y tener su propio negocio de producción de detergentes.

Actualmente puede materializar su sueño gracias su gran capacidad de trabajo, al apoyo que recibe de la Corporación Interactuar y de las personas que deseen que ella salga adelante con su negocio.

De este negocio dependerá su sostenimiento.

Solicita un apoyo económico para comprar los insumos necesarios para la elaboración de estos productos como aromatizantes, glicerina, cloro, entre otros.

Con un préstamo podrás a poyar a una mujer llena de vida y empuje para su familia!
texts.en:
Clara is very business-savvy and creative. She has wanted for a long time to be independent and have her own detergent-production business.
This loan and her strong determination to work very hard will make her dream come true. She is grateful for the support of Interactuar and of the people who want to see her succeed.
Her business will be her sole source of income.
She asks for financial support in order to buy the ingredients needed to make detergent: aromas, glycerine, chlorine, etc.
This loan will help a lively woman who supports her family!

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make detergent to sell.

loans.name: Jose Denis De Jesus

texts.es:
José, un hombre de 56 años, vive en el municipio de Bello, una pequeña ciudad donde las oportunidades de salir adelante son difíciles y la competencia comercial es bastante dura.

Este hombre de mente emprendedora y grandes deseos de salir adelante tiene el proyecto de iniciar con un negocio de comidas rápidas en el parque principal del municipio.

Con la ayuda de un préstamo, José podrá cumplir su sueño de ser independiente y poder generar sus propios ingresos, con los que sostendrá a su familia.

El dinero será invertido en la compra de un asador de pollos, una vitrina y un carro de comidas.

Colabora a un Hombre emprendedor, de mente creativa y grandes sueños!
texts.en:
José, 59, lives in Bello, a small town where opportunities are scarce and competition among businesses ruthless.
This business-savvy man looks to the future and want to improve his lot in life. He wants to start selling food to go in the central park.
Thanks to this loan, José will make his dream of becoming independent and generating his own income come true. The business will support his family.
José will use the loan to buy a chicken roaster, a display case and a food cart.
This loan will help an enterprising man who is very creative and has great dreams!

loans.use: to buy supplies to set up a food cart.

loans.name: Blanca Lucia

texts.es:
Blanca nació en la parroquia Toacaso del cantón Latacunga perteneciente a la provincia de Cotopaxi de la República del Ecuador tiene 38 años de edad, está casada, tienen cuatro hijos los mismos que son menores de edad, actualmente viven en casa propia, la misma que fue construida con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación  en un barrio llamado La Calera este sector es muy reconocido porque su gente se dedica a la ganadería y a la agricultura. Blanca ha demostrado ser una mujer luchadora y emprendedora, con el esfuerzo y sacrifico de sus padres pudo terminar la secundaria, ya que desde que terminó el colegio tuvo que trabajar.
María tuvo muchos obstáculos en su vida y en su matrimonio pero con la ayuda de sus hijos y de sus padres salieron adelante.
Por la falta de recursos económico en un inicio Blanca tuvo que buscar la manera de solventar y ayudar a su esposo en los gastos, y empezó a criar animales, esto era ya una gran ayuda para su familia, después Blanca descubrió un don y decido ponerse un criadero de animales como cerdos de raza. Por el momento solicita un crédito para realizar los tramites de escritura de su casa.
Hoy Blanca quiere extender un sincero agradecimiento y felicitación a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Blanca, 38, was born in Toacaso, Latacunga district, Cotopaxi province, Republic of Ecuador. She is married and has four children, all minors, who live with her. She has a house of her own which she built thanks to her efforts and dedication. The house is located in a neighbourhood called La Calera, famous for its vegetable and animal farms. Blanca has proved herself as a very enterprising and hard-working woman. Thanks to her parents' efforts and sacrifices, she was able to finish secondary education. After that, she started to work.
Blanca's life and marriage were not without hardships, but thanks to her parents' and children's help the family managed to keep going.
Blanca started her business because she had no choice: her husband's income was not enough and she contributed to household expenses by raising animals, which proved a great help to her family. As she turned out to be really good at raising animals, Blanca then decided to start an official prize-pig raising farm. She is asking for a loan to cover notary expenses for formally registering her house.
Blanca is grateful and happy for Ecuador's Fundación Alternativa's and Kiva's help. They made it possible for her to grow as a person and as a professional.

loans.use: to formally register her house and keep expanding her business.

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru: Саодат женщина в возрасте 38 лет. Она проживает в сельской местности. Сама Саодат с детства занимается животноводством. Благодаря этому бизнесу она смогла оплачивать свое обучение и получить высшее образование. Сейчас Саодат работает бухгалтером в организации но свой бизнес она так и не бросила, она продолжает его расширять. Ведь ее бизнес это основной источник ее доходов. На данный момент Саодат решила сделать ремонт дома и утеплить его. Но из за строительства у нее не хватило денег на утепление дома и с данной проблемой она решила обратиться в "АРВАНД" за поддержкой. На полученные деньги она хочет купить и установить пластиковые окна и утеплить стены и потолок.
texts.en: Saodat is a 38-year-old woman. She lives in a rural area. Saodat has reared animals ever since her childhood. Thanks to this business she was able to pay for her studies and get a higher education. Now Saodat works as an accountant in an organisation, but she never gave up her own business and continues to expand it. Indeed her business is her main source of income. At the present time Saodat has decided to renovate her house and insulate it. But because of the renovation work she does not have sufficient money to insulate the house and so she has decided to apply to Arvand with this problem for support. She wants to buy and install vinyl windows and insulate the walls and ceiling with the money.

loans.use: to insulate her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve her business activity so as to raise more income and improve family living standards.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so she can sell more milk and increase her income.

loans.name: Jared

texts.en:
Jared is 28 years old, married to Rose, and he supports six family members. 

He has been a tailor for the last seven years and the business earns him a monthly income of KES 12,000. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya, which he plans to use to purchase stock of cloth for making clothes and also a sewing machine so as to meet the demand of his clients. 

He plans to use earned profit to repay the loan and expand his business. 

His hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase stock of cloth for making clothes and also a sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for planting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow for more milk production and supply to meet his customers` demand and earn more income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve her business through preparing more varied foods and drinks for her customers.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, 55 years old, supports a family of five members. She has been practicing small-scale farming for the last 20 years, earning an income of KES 13,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy fertilizers and seedlings for planting.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her children. 

Elizabeth's hope is to lead a stable life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings for planting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials like cement and bricks to construct her family house.

loans.name: Horn's Group

texts.en: Horn is 39 years old, a mother of four children, living in Battambang province. The source of her family’s income is from rice farming for five years and she earns about 28,100 KHR per day to support her family’s needs. In order to earn more income to support her family, she decided to expand her current business. Due to lack of funds, she is now leading a group of two to take a loan via VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, to buy seeds and fertilizer, and pay for plowing fee. She hopes to earn more income and successfully expand her business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer, and pay for plowing fee.

loans.name: Yeferson

texts.es:
El señor Yeferson es un mecánico de motos y carros muy experimentado. Ha adquirido muchas habilidades a través de pequeños estudios en diferentes academias y otra parte la ha aprendido empíricamente.

Adicional a su labor como mecánico también tiene un pequeño almacén de venta de repuestos automotrices en el cual ofrece distintos tipos de repuestos en diferentes marcas.

Es un hombre muy trabajador y honrado que conoce el significado que tienen los automóviles para sus dueños y es por esto que siempre trata de ofrecer un excelente servicio, de buena calidad y de una manera eficiente.

El solicita un préstamo para comprar herramientas de mano que le hacen falta y así cambiar las que tiene viejas y en mal estado, pues esto permitirá que su trabajo sea más eficiente y de mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Yeferson is a very experienced motorcycle and car mechanic. He learned his trade by attending several short courses at various schools and the rest he picked up by himself.
To supplement his income, he also has a small shop where he sells car parts of many types and brands.
Yeferson is a very hard-working and honest man. He knows how much cars mean to their owners and thus tries to always provide excellent service and high-quality work in an efficient manner.
He asks for a loan to buy tools he needs to replace the ones that are old and broken. This will enable him to work more efficiently and perform quality repairs.

loans.use: to replace tools he needs for his work.

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es:
Fabiola es una madre muy responsable de 3 hijos, ha tenido que pasar por muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para salir adelante y continuar progresando con su familia. 

Hace un tiempo montó su venta de huevos, para lo cual tiene una cantidad de gallinas que le permiten tener ciertas ventas. 

Sueña con ver su negocio crecer y sabe que con la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar y de las personas que apoyen su oficio podrá lograrlo.

Es por esto que busca un préstamo que le permita comprar materiales para arreglar el galpón donde alberga sus pollos y gallinas.

De esta manera su trabajo se hará mucho mas productivo considerablemente, además de que su negocio resurgirá y podrá salir adelante. 

Fabiola también desea tener un gran negocio donde pueda utilizar toda la capacidad que pueda para sacarlo adelante y así ofrecerles a sus hijos un futuro económico estable.
texts.en:
Fabiola, a very responsible mother of three, suffered many a hardship. She still managed to find the strength to forge ahead and keep improving her family's lot in life. 
She started her own business selling eggs a while ago, for which she keeps a certain quantity of hens, which produce enough eggs to have respectable sales. 
She dreams of expanding her business and knows that she will able to achieve this goal thanks to Interactuar's and lenders' help.
She needs a loan to buy materials to repair the henhouse.
She will thus be able to increase productivity to keep her business afloat and even improve it. 
Fabiola would also like to have a big shop where her products could be sold more efficiently so as to give her children a stable economic future.

loans.use: to buy materials to repair the henhouse.

loans.name: Blanca Nelly

texts.es: Blanca de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella se dedica  a la venta de tortillas y también a la venta de cereales, posee 14 años de experiencia  en las ventas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia, y tiene muchos clientes, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por mayor y cal y así poder continuar con sus ventas para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Blanca is 47 years old. She owns a house where she lives with her husband and son. She sells tortillas and cereals at home. She has a 14-year experience in sales. She has many customers and manages to cover some of the home expenses with what she earns.

Blanca is requesting a loan to buy corn in bulk and lime in order to continue selling and improving her income.

loans.use: to buy corn in bulk and lime to make tortillas.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 29 años de edad y vivir de zona de alto riesgo, ella se dedica a la crianza de pollos posee 5 años de experiencia en ese rubro, comercializa su productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, la joven vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hijo, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas pollos por mayor y así tener mejor ingreso económico.
texts.en:
This young woman’s face has been blurred because she is 29 years old and lives in a risky area. She has been selling chickens for five years at different local markets. She owns a house where she lives with her life partner and her son.

She is requesting a loan to buy more chickens in bulk and in this way improve her income.

loans.use: to buy more chickens in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coconuts in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To lease more land to expand his farming activity.

loans.name: Benita

texts.en: Benita, aged 50, is married to a farmer and they're blessed with three children. She has owned and managed a retail store in their village for almost two years and earns a net income of PHP 5,000 a month. Due to insufficient funding for her business she would like to request a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase soy sauce, vinegar, fish sauce, sugar, coffee, canned goods, and breads to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase soy sauce, vinegar, fish sauce, sugar, coffee, canned goods, and breads to sell.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes, 41 years old, is married to Nicholas and supports a family of 5 members. She has been practicing small scale farming for the last 15 years earning an income of KES 14,000 per month. She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to improve her farming through adoption of modern farming technology and raise more income to meet family needs. She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her children. Her hope is to better her life.

loans.use: to improve her farming through adoption of modern farming technology to raise more income to meet family needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve her farming by upgrading to the greenhouse method

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy another motorbike to assist in timely delivery of products to the market

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret used the previous loan to buy salt to sell. She is a 42-year-old single mother of four children, living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been mining and selling salt for many years. Her hardships are seasonal weather and lack  of protective gear that affects her health. 

Margret's personal goals are educating her children and building a permanent house for her children. Her business goals are buying land to grow crops and taking her business to greater heights by exploring new markets. Margret is requesting a loan facility to buy more salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy more salt to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings for planting

loans.name: Bashorat

texts.ru: Башорат женщина 55 лет, замужем, мать троих детей. Она родилась в семье рабочих в селе. В 18 лет Башорат вышла замуж и переехала жить в город. Башорат закончила университет, но первые 10 лет работать не смогла, так как она растила маленьких детей. Сейчас Башорат работает в ЗАГСЕ. У нее маленькая зарплата, поэтому она также работает швеёй на дому. Её муж таксист. Башорат понимает, что в нынешнее время работать и зарабатывать деньги очень сложно. Она хочет обеспечить своих детей светлым будущим. Башорат обратилась в МДО Арванд за получением кредита для приобретения пластиковых дверей для утепления своего дома. Зима в этом году была очень холодной. Из-за этого почти вся семья болела всю зиму. Поэтому Башорат решила приобрести пластиковые окна и двери,чтоб защитить свою семью от холода. Но у нее нет полной суммы для этого. Башорат надеется, что МДО Арванд поддержит ее и выделит нужную ей сумму. Она благодарит за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en: Bashorat is a 55-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She was born in a working class family in a village. At the age of 18 Bashorat got married and moved to live in a town. Bashorat graduated from university, but for the first ten years she was unable to work because she was raising small children. Now Bashorat works in a Civil Registry Office. She has a small salary, so she also works at home as a seamstress. Her husband is a taxi driver. Bashorat understands that working and earning money is very difficult at the present time. She wants to provide a bright future for her children. Bashorat has applied to MDO Arvand to get a loan to buy vinyl doors to insulate her house. The winter this year was very cold. Because of this almost all the family was ill all winter. So Bashorat decided to buy vinyl windows and doors to protect her family from the cold. But she does not have all the money for this. Bashorat hopes that MDO Arvand will support her and provide the required sum. She is grateful for its support and trust.

loans.use: to buy vinyl windows and doors.

loans.name: Sany

texts.en:
Sany, 31, is a married mother of three children who are all in school. She is a rural villager, living in the province of Kampong Cham. Nowadays, her family’s living depends on growing cassava and cashew nut trees, as it has for thirteen years. She can earn about 37,200 KHR per day. 

Due to lack of funds to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing and labor fees, she is now leading a group to take a new Kiva loan via VisionFund. She hopes to be able to buy more farmland to expand her farming area and keep sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing and labor fees

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 38 years old, married with six children, living in Kasese, Uganda. Patrick operates a retail shop selling general merchandise since 2009 and also practices fishing and farming to get additional income. 

Patrick has a dream of constructing a commercial building. However, he is faced with the challenge of seasonality. Patrick intends to use the loan to buy soap, rice, sugar, and other general merchandise for selling.

loans.use: to buy soap, rice, sugar, and other general merchandise for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more timbers for use in his business for more income earning.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials such as meats, seafood, vegetables, fruits, chickens, soft drinks, among other ingredients.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 52 years old, married. and supports seven family members. He operates a motorcycle transportation business, which he has been doing for six years. He earns 9,000 KES per month.

David requested his first loan from VisionFund Kenya for 25,000 KES, which he will use to buy a dairy cow to supply milk. His continued motorcycle business will provide additional income. He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate his children. He hopes to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Meet Purity, a 33-year-old smallholder Kenyan farmer, who comes from Igoji village in the remote area of Nkubu. She is happily married to a handsome man who has so far given her two children.

 Purity started farming eight years ago.  She is seeking a loan to purchase dairy goats. The breed she is going for is more productive than the predominant traditional breeds. The dairy goat will produce milk for sale and for home consumption. The returns she makes from this investment will go towards farm-related costs that keep piling up. 

These dairy goats will help Purity's business break even sooner. Her family will also enjoy a better life as a result of the increased income of their breadwinner.

loans.use: To buy additional dairy goats

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is the responsible mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 12 years. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family. He needs to do maintenance on his taxi, because its current condition is not good and it requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. 

Due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to do the maintenance on his taxi. Therefore Nusrat has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Nusrat's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily. And provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Nusrat  also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.

Nusrat is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to assist her husband's needs to repair his taxi

loans.name: Dolores Inoa

texts.es: Dolores de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella tiene un puesto ubicado en el mercado municipal de venta de ropa, también tiene una tienda en su casa que es atendida por sus dos hijos, con las ventas que realiza de su trabajo y las ganancias de la tienda es como ha podido sacar adelante  su familia, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa para damas y caballeros por mayor y ai poder continuar con su trabajo y generar mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Dolores is 46 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and their two children. She has a stall located in the municipal market where she sells clothing. Dolores also operates a store in her house that is tended to by her two children.

With the sales she achieves through her efforts and the earnings of her store, Dolores has been able to advance her family.

Dolores is requesting a loan to purchase more clothing for ladies and gentlemen at wholesale, and to be able to continue her work and generate better economic income.

loans.use: buy more clothes for women and gentlemen at wholesale to sell.

loans.name: Josue 1.9 Group

texts.es:
Ana María es coordinadora del grupo “Josué 1.9”, tiene 48 años de edad, ella es una mujer luchadora y trabajadora, ejemplo de superación ya que desde 25 años se dedica a la venta perecederos y verduras. Por tercera vez solicita crédito con ADIM, para la compra de productos como papas, chiltomas, tomates, zanahorias, yuca. Con los ingresos obtenidos, comprara cuero para la realización de bolsos, ya que tiene otro negocio en su hogar. 
Sus compañeras, Yanora, de 19 años comercializa verduras, desea comprar productos como yuca, chayote y zanahorias. Josefa, de 40 años, comercializa frutas.
texts.en:
Ana Maria, 48, leads the "Joshua 1:9" community bank.  She has operated a fruits and vegetables business for 25 years and overcome all obstacles with hard work and perseverance.  This is her third ADIM loan and she will use it to stock her business with potatoes, chiltomas, tomatoes, carrots, yucca, etc.  She will use her earnings to buy leather for another business: making leather bags.  
The other members in the photo are Yanora, 19, who has a vegetables sales business and Josefa, 40, who has a fruit sales business.

loans.use: to stock her fruits & vegetables business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to lease more land to expand her farming activity for more income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To lease more to expand her farming activity for more income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting

loans.name: Amid

texts.en:
Amid is a 28-year-old farmer. He is married and has a daughter. His wife is a housekeeper. Amid has been working as a farmer for 6 years and has good experience in this area. He raises seasonal fruits and sells them at the local bazaar. His monthly income is 300 AZN.

Raising and selling fruits is much expanded in Azerbaijan. People sell seasonal fruits at local bazaar, and buyers use fruits to make delicious kinds of jam, pies, cakes, and juice. They also use dried fruits because they're very useful for health. 

Amid’s situation is very hard. He needs to raise fruits and care for them, but the lack of water in his region makes problems for him. Because of this problem, the productivity of his trees has fallen and he can’t cover his family’s needs. He applied for a 1200 AZN loan in order to be able to supply water for his garden every week. This will increase his productivity again and his family’s income will rise.

loans.use: to supply weekly water for his garden

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To maintain and service his motorcycle to be fit for business.

loans.name: Saven's Group

texts.en:
Saven, 38, is a villager living in Kampong Cham province and a mother of three children, and two of them are in school while the other one is too young to attend school. Growing cassava and working for other farms have been the sources of her family’s income for about twenty years, and it earns her around 30,000 KHR per day. 

Now she is leading a group to apply for a new loan to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing and labor fees. She hopes this loan will help to successfully expand her current business and her ability to support her children’s studies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and paying for plow and labor fees

loans.name: Thea

texts.en:
Thea, 34, is a villager living in the Kampong Cham province and a mother of five children. Growing cassava, fishing and working for other farm have been the sources of her family’s income for sixteen years. She can earn about 48,100 KHR per day. 

Now she is applying for a loan via VisionFund to buy a water pumping machine to use for her family. She hopes to improve her family’s lifestyle through having enough clean water to use and a suitable house in which to stay.

loans.use: to buy a water pumping machine

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase retail household goods to resell at a profit

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is a smallholder farmer from Karingani village in the Chuka region of Kenya. Caroline started mixed farming in 2001 and so far she has one dairy cow and poultry. She is seeking a loan of 20,000 KES to buy pigs. Caroline is planning to spend the loan amount to purchase pigs to produce a viable quantity of pork and other by-products. Caroline's family will benefit from this investment in numerous ways, including higher family income, better diet, more product offerings, and diversity.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Yesica Banesa

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 25 años y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 3 años, vende una variedad de productos a buen precio por esa razón posee muchos clientes, la joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de  sopas, gaseosas, jugos, agua, azúcar, granos básicos, leche, entre otros todo por mayor y asi poder mejores ganancias para una mejor estabilidad de vida.
texts.en:
The young woman whose face is pixelated is 25 years old and lives in a high risk area.  She has had a store at the place where she lives for three years.  She sells a variety of products for a good price.  That is why she has a lot of customers.  She lives in her own house with her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy soups, soft drinks, juices, water, sugar, basic grains, and milk, among other items.  She will buy everything in bulk.  This way she will be able to have better earnings in order to have better stability in her life.

loans.use: to buy soups, soft drinks, juices, water, sugar, basic grains, and milk, among other items in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow to increase the milk supply for clients.

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en:
Chantha is 54 years old and a mother of seven children living in the Kampong Cham province. She has been a cassava and rubber plant farmer for more than ten years, and she earns about 66,700 KHR per day. 

Due to lack of funds, she is now leading a group to take a new Kiva loan via VisionFund to buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay plowing fees. She hopes to earn more income and expand her current business through this loan.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay plowing fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as to meet the demand of clients and his family.

loans.name: Senghak's Group

texts.en:
Senghak is originally living in the Kampong Cham province. She is 23 years old and a mother of a small child who is too young to get in school. Growing rice and cassava are the sources of her family’s income for five years, and she can earn about 37,200 KHR per day. 

Due to lack of funds, she is now leading a small group of two to take a new loan via VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, to pay for labor and plowing fees. Through this loan, she hopes to earn more income and increase her ability to buy more farmland to expand her farming area.

loans.use: to pay for labor and plowing fees

loans.name: Khujakul

texts.ru: Хужакул женат и имеет детей. У него  прекрасная семья.  Хужакул сильный  и трудолюбивый человек. Он занимается земледелием в родном районе. Хужакул занят этой деятельностью  уже более 15 лет. Он с молодостью занимается земледелием. Хужакул продвигает деятельность брата. Ему сейчас надо готовить почву земли, для посева урожая. Он обратился за кредитом, чтобы купить минеральные удобрения для обработки земли. Хужакул хочет, чтобы люди купили здоровый урожай. Он в будущем планирует расширить земельный участок для бизнеса.
texts.en: Khujakul is married and has children. He has a wonderful family. Khujakul is a strong and hard-working person. He grows farm crops in his native region. Khujakul has been engaged in farmwork for over 15 years, since his youth. Khujakul is continuing his brother’s business. At present he needs to treat his soil before the planting season. He has applied for a loan in order to buy mineral fertilizers to treat his soil. Khujakul would like people to buy his wholesome produce. In the future, he plands to expand his farmland.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Esmira

texts.en: Esmira is 44 years old, married and has two children. She lives with her family in the Sabirabad region. Esmira has run a business selling clothes for eight years with help from her husband. She also earns income from raising livestock. This loan is important for her to purchase a new stock of summer clothing to cover her customers' orders. Her products are on display at her home and she also works as a street vendor on an order basis. Esmira s monthly income from this business is 200 AZN .This is going to be her third loan .Please support  Esmira .

loans.use: to purchase a new stock of summer clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy equipment and supplies for his food sales business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy certified seeds for high production to earn more income.

loans.name: St Marys Kasanzi Group

texts.en:
Dolisa is 47 years old, married and has 10 children, eight in school. Dolisa is a member of St Marys Kasanzi Group and lives in Kasese, Uganda. She has a produce business selling dry beans, peas, ground nuts, maize and other items. She has a dream of being the best produce seller in her area. However, she is faced with a challenge of inadequate capital. Dolisa intends to use the loan to buy beans, ground.nuts and maize for selling. She is a member of a village bank where members guarantee one another to get a loan.
The babies in the photo came with their mothers who had no one to watch them at their homes.

loans.use: to buy beans, ground nuts and maize for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy stock for the business like sugar, cooking oil, and salt to sell.

loans.name: Munifa

texts.en:
Munifa is a 56-year-old lady residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of six children, and her husband has been doing his own business of cattle farming for the past ten years. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family and to manage the household.

Munifa's husband wants to purchase more animals for his business purposes, but due to financial constraints her husband is unable to purchase these cattle.

Therefore Munifa has requested a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy these cattle to fulfill the needs of his business; this will also be good for him to earn the maximum profitable income that can be derived from his business.

For this financial assistance, Munifa is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: her husband wanted to increase his cattle business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow so as to supply milk and earn more income.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is 29 years old, married with two children, living in Kasese, Uganda. Isaac is a salt miner who also gets income from a ladies' salon operated by his wife. After their death, his parents left him with a salt pan where he has managed to earn a living. However, he is faced with a challenge where the government has not intervened to give them mining protective gear. 

Isaac is requesting a loan to buy cosmetics like sprays, hair food, and others to use in the ladies' salon.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics like sprays, hair food and others to use in the ladies' salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To construct a shade at her site to attract more customers, to earn more income.

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es: Maria vive en casa propia  con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace 3 años con ese trabajo es como logra pagar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia, y tiene muchos clientes especialmente sus vecinos, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal  y así tener mejor ingreso económico para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria lives with her family in a house that they own.  She has operated a business making and selling tortillas for 3 year.  Her income from the business helps to support the family.  She operates the business from a space in her house and has many customers, most of whom are neighbors.  Maria is applying for a loan that she will use to buy wholesale supplies of maize and other supplies for carrying on her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food sales business.

loans.name: Gulnar

texts.en:
Gulnar is 31 years old and, as a married mother of two children, she works hard to support her family and improve their economy. 

To provide the primary income for her family, Gulnar is involved in animal husbandry and farming, having started this business in 2010 with 80 manat. Thanks to Gulnar's hard work, today her farm contains four sheep. She also grows potatoes and corn for sale on her own land. 

In order to further develop her business, she requested a loan in the amount of 700 from the Aqroinvest to buy potato seeds and mineral fertilizer in order to grow ecologically-clean and delicious vegetables. 

She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further expanding her business because she wants to save money for her children's education and upbringing.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: De Monchita Group

texts.es: Este grupo mixto conformado por 3 comerciantes,  solicitan un préstamo a ADIM, para engrandecer y ofrecer más productos a sus clientes. Su coordinador es Sergio de 56 años, casado, responsable de  6 hijos que oscilan en edades de 9 a 19 años. Se dedica a la compra-venta de pescados mareños, con el crédito comprara pescados, como corvina, pargo rojo, chuletas y más. Con las ganancias obtenidas desea seguir mejorando el negocio e invertirlo en la educación de sus hijos. Sus compañeras de grupo son, Josefa, 44  años se dedica a la venta de productos varios como arroz, trigo y carbón. María, 42 años,vende Gaspar,sábalo y carbón.
texts.en:
This group is made up of 3 business people.  They are requesting a loan to ADIM to grow their product offering for their clients.  The group's coordinator is Sergio who is 56 years old, married, and responsible for 6 kids between the ages of 9 and 19 years.  He works buying and selling fish.  
With the loan he will buy fish like croaker, red snapper, pork chops and others.  With the profits obtained he will keep improving his business and will invest in his children's education.  
His fellow group members are Josefa, 44 years old, who sells products like rice, wheat, and coal. Maria, 42 years old, sells tropical gar, tarpon, and coal.

loans.use: to buy fish like croaker, red snapper, pork chops and others.

loans.name: Lisbeth Alexandra

texts.es:
Lisbeth tiene 19 años a su corta edad tiene un hijo, ella vive en unión libre con su esposo de 21 años su hijo y sus suegros. Vive en casa de sus suegros que está ubicada en el sector de Gangotena de Atuntaqui.
En el sector donde ella vive las personas se dedican a la elaboración de muebles para el hogar y además a la crianza de animales.
Lisbeth desde que vive con su esposo empezó como iniciática propia con la crianza de animales como conejos, cuyes, chanchos y gallinas una vez que los animales ya estén listos para la venta ella los vende en las ferias de la localidad los días miércoles y sábados, de esta forma ella aporta económicamente en el hogar y al mismo tiempo puede ocuparse de su hijo, y ofrecerle una buena educación con la ayuda de su esposo que trabaja como albañil.
El crédito lo necesita para incrementar su capital de trabajo con la compra de más animales de esta forma Lisbeth podrá mejorar sus ventas y por ende su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Lisbeth, 19, lives with her husband, 21, her son, and her in-laws.  They live in her in-laws' house in the Gangotena region of Atuntaqui.  Furniture making and animal rearing are common ways to make a living here.  Lisbeth decided to start her own animal sales business after she and her husband began living together.  She raises pigs, rabbits, chickens and guinea pigs and sells them when they are ready for market.  The business allows her to take care of her son and still help with family expenses.  She and her husband, a construction worker, want to provide their child with a good education.  Lisbeth is applying for a loan that she will use to buy more animals for her animal sales business.

loans.use: to buy animals for her animal sales business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings for planting

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda and deals in cocoa growing and selling to raise income for family support. 

His clients are mainly cocoa companies. He gets additional income from timber trading, but his main challenge is limited capital to maintain all his businesses to required standards. He hopes to improve his cocoa business in the future, and he wants to build a permanent house and also educate his five children.  

He has asked for a loan of one million (1,000,000 UGX) to pay for labor for his cocoa gardens.

loans.use: to pay for labor for his cocoa gardens

loans.name: Naira

texts.en:
Naira is 59 years old. She lives in Rustavi district with her daughter and her husband. Naira has recently opened a shop and needs additional money to purchase inventory of home products. 

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 1,000 USD. With the received credit she will purchase some home products, which are highly demanded in this region. The Start Up program will help her to sell more products and increase her profit. Naira awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase inventory of home products for her new shop

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 36 años de edad, vive junto a sus cinco hijos en una comunidad de Suchitepéquez.
María para sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la compra y venta de chocolate, ella tiene ocho años de realizar esta labor.
María elabora de uno de los mejores chocolates, es por ello que ahora solicita un préstamo para poder comprar sus materiales como leña, cacao y otros para seguir elaborado sus chocolates, y mejorar sus ingresos familiares.
El gran sueño de María es poder  comprar otro molino para moler el cacao y obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
María is a 36 year old woman who lives with her 5 children in the community of Suchitepéquez. To get ahead her family she's been buying and selling chocolate for 8 years.  
Maria makes one of the best chocolates in the area so she's requesting a loan to buy firewood, cocoa, and other materials to keep making her chocolates and thus improve her family income. Her dream is to buy another cocoa grinder and with that help to obtain more income.

loans.use: to buy firewood and cocoa to make chocolates.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en: Zahida is a 38-year-old married woman and the mother of five children. Her husband (also shown in the photo), some time ago started a truck driving business. Her husband owns one truck and needs some financial help. He will use the loan to pay for repair and maintenance costs of the truck. Therefore, Zahida has availed a Murabaha loan of 25,000 PKR for her husband. She is hopeful that her husband’s business will prosper and their living standards will improve with the help of this loan.

loans.use: to pay for repair and maintenance costs of the truck

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is 35 years old, married with 8 children, three of whom go to school. He lives in Bundibugyo Uganda. Robert is a retailer and he has been in that business since 2013 to earn a living. He grows and sells cocoa to supplement income from his general store shop. Robert dreams of expanding his business, however he  is limited by inadequate capital. Robert has asked for a loan to buy merchandise like sugar, soap and cocoa for sell.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like sugar, soap and cocoa for sell.

loans.name: Madiha

texts.en:
Madiha is a 24-year-old married woman. The man shown in the picture is her brother-in-law. Six years ago she started a business selling cloth in her locality. She purchases cloth of different varieties at low prices from the city market and sells the cloth in her own town. She has a strong customer base. 

Currently, Madiha has requested a Murabaha loan of 35,000 PKR. She wants to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for the summer season. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for the summer season

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.en:
Gulnara is 37 years old. She is not married and lives with her parents in Sabirabad region. 

Gulnara and her family are farmers. They own a greenhouse where different vegetables are cultivated. She is a very enthusiastic woman willing to improve her family’s condition. 

This requested loan of 1500 AZN will help her to renovate the greenhouse and purchase seeds and fertilizer to fight against diseases. 

As this is Gulnara's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Aqroinvest CU. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who haven’t had access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history. 

Gulnara will be very grateful if lenders support her agribusiness.

loans.use: to renovate the greenhouse and purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Ilqar

texts.en:
Ilqar is 37 year old, married and has 3 kids. Ilqar  lives with his family in Sabirabad region. He is independent, careful, responsible, and hard-working. He works as a taxi driver, work that he's been doing for the past  2 years. However, his salary from this business is not enough to cover his family's needs. 

His dream is to see the construction of his house completed. It is for these reasons that Ilqar is applying for a loan 1200 azn for the installation of potable water in the kitchen, bathroom and laundry room of his house (for the well-being of his family). Please support him.

loans.use: to install potable water in the kitchen, bathroom and laundry room of his house

loans.name: Susana Del  Carmen

texts.es:
Susana siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una mujer responsable y emprendedora, desde joven ha trabajado para aportar económicamente a su hogar. Gracias  a la ayuda de su esposo, inició una pulpería para no descuidar a su familia y trabajar desde su casa.
