loans.use: to purchase necessary farm supplies for steam amaranth leaf cultivation.

loans.name: Nigora

texts.ru:
Нигоре 29 лет. Она мать двоих маленьких прекрасных детей и проживает на районе под названием Н.Хусрав вместе мужем, свекровью и детьми. Нигора занимается земледелием больше 3 года. Для нее данная деятельность является единственным источником дохода. Она каждый сезон одна сажает урожай. Работать на земле тяжело, но Нигора несмотря ни на что продолжат работать в этом направлении. 
  Нигора имеет участок земли, где осуществят посев урожая. Она просит кредит для покупки минеральных удобрений для обработки земли. Нигора надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Nigora, 29, is a mother of two beautiful little children. She lives with her husband, children and mother-in-law in Nosiri Khusrav. In the past three years Nigora has cultivated land. It is hard but she is persistent. This work is her only source of income. Every season Nigora plants crops on her plot of land. She is requesting a loan to buy mineral fertilizers, and she hopes that you will be able to help her.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 25 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pijamas juveniles y para niños posee 9 años de experiencia, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia, y posee muchos clientes, el joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de variedad de telas, hilo, elásticos, etc. por mayor ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo e  ingresos
texts.en:
This young man, who's face has been blurred as he is aged 25 and living in a high-risk area, makes and sells pajamas for children and adolescents, which he has been doing for nine years. He runs his business from home, and has many customers. 

The young man lives in his own home with his family group. 

He is requesting a loan to buy a variety of fabrics, threads, elastic etc. wholesale, as that is his only source of work and income.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fabrics, threads, elastic etc. wholesale

loans.name: Franklin

texts.es: Don Franklin tiene casa propia, con su esfuerzo ha mejorado las condiciones de la misma , Sin embargo necesita renovar  el piso por completo, para lo cual solicita un crédito de $250 para comprar los materiales necesarios y realizar este trabajo.
texts.en: Franklin has his own house and, through his efforts, he has improved conditions in his home. However, he needs to completely replace the floor so he is asking for a loan of $250 to buy the necessary materials and carry out this work.

loans.use: to buy materials to repair the floor of his house

loans.name: Khaithol

texts.ru:
Хаитхол 61 летняя жительница района Кубадиен. Хаитхол проживает здесь давно. Она мать двоих сыновей. Сыновьям 41 и 29 лет. Они на районе занимаются мастером по ремонте домов. Ее муж занимается земледелием. Хаитхол и ее семья сильные и трудолюбивые люди. 
    Хаитхол в  родном районе занимается земледелием. Этой деятельностью она занята уже 15 лет. В этой работе ей нравится, то что она может заработать своим честно нажитым трудом.
   Сейчас Хаитгул закончила посев и ей необходимо обработать землю минеральными удобрениями, чтобы получить богатый и качественный урожай. Но для купли достаточного количества минеральных удобрений ей не хватает не большой суммы денег, и по той причине она обратилась за кредитом. Хаитгул заранее выражает свою благодарность.
texts.en: Khaithol, 61, has lived in Qubadiyon for a long time. She is a mother of two sons - 41 and 29 - who earn their living by renovating homes and cultivating land. Khaithol and her family are strong, hardworking people. In her home region, Khaithol also cultivates land. She has been doing it for 15 years. She likes this kind of work because she thinks of it as an honest way to earn money. Khaithol has now finished sowing and needs mineral fertilizers in order to get a high quality crop. She is applying for a loan because she does not have enough money for buying a sufficient amount of fertilizers. She is grateful for the support.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Reabetswe

texts.en:
Reabetswe is applying for a loan to support her studies for a year at Maharishi Ezemvelo Rural University (MERU). This is her story: 

1. What do you study at Maharishi Institute? Which classes you enjoy most?
I am studying towards a bachelor of business administration. I enjoy human resource management and marketing class, I actually fell in love with those two classes.  It must have been because I got to understand what was taught in them. They are my best classes so far.

2. What are your goals after graduating from the Institute? Please be specific: In which sector do you expect to work? In which city would you like to work? Would you like to travel?
After graduating I would love to work in the marketing department or human resource department within a company. I would love to work in Johannesburg, which is near my family and also the business city of South Africa. I do not like travelling but I could always make an exception when my job requires me to.

3. Tell us about your background. Where were you born? Do you have brothers and sisters? What do your parents do for work? Are you married? Do you have children?
I was born in a village called Tlagameng at the North West province of South Africa. Both my parents are unemployed. I am the first-born and have a younger sister. I am currently staying with my two aunts who do not have a steady job. We live from the rent of my older aunt’s house. Therefore this means that for us to live or survive the occupants of the rented out house has to pay, and if they fail or delay to do so then it becomes a problem. My other aunt is also trying to make a living out of selling beauty products and income will depend on how many people bought the products.

4. What do you like to do in your spare time?
In my spare time I like reading novels.  I enjoy reading a lot. I also enjoy singing and dancing. At other times, I spend my time in the kitchen, trying out some new recipes.

5. How will a Kiva loan change your life? Describe how the loan will affect your studies and your lifestyle: will there be significant changes?
The Kiva loan will change my life in a positive way.  I will use the money for transport purpose. This will have a great impact in my studies. I will never miss a class because of not having transport money to come to school. The significant change will be that I will always be at school unlike before where I used to miss class due to lack of transport money.

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at Maharishi Ezemvelo Rural University (MERU).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts such as windscreens and motorcycle nozzles for repair and maintenance, to enable her to offer better and faster transportation services.

loans.name: Shachirani

texts.en:
Shachirani is a 36-year-old rural housewife from the village of Chuakhola in Falakata. She lives with her husband and two children (one son and one daughter). Though Shachirani is illiterate and can sign her name only, she is providing education to both her children.

Her husband is a farmer by profession. He cultivates seasonal crops and vegetables on his farmland and sells them to the local market and local people as well. Shachirani also assists her husband in cultivating work. They work tirelessly all day long, but the income is not satisfactory. They can hardly meet all the household expenses, and their children’s education expense seems to be an overburden to them.

As ladies finger (locally known as bhendi) is one of the popular vegetables in India, Shachirani decided to grow this crop on her farmland for additional income. In India it is grown in summer months and during the rainy season. So, Shachirani applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase good-quality ladies finger seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, and other farm supplies for cultivation.

She hopes the profit generated by her agribusiness will upgrade her family’s economic condition so that she can run a smooth life with her family. It will also enable her to give better education to her children. In the future, she dreams of building a concrete house for her family.

Shachirani is greatly obliged to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs for the cultivation of ladies finger (okra).

loans.name: Gafir

texts.ru: Гафир, 58 лет, женат, 7 детей. У Гафира- средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 35 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Гафира, в хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы, а на участке, мерою 0,72 ГА он выращивает клубнику и хлопок для реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гафир обратился в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма и реализации, покупки удобрений для полеводства. Доходы от кредита Гафир планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, чтобы иметь возможность улучшить материальное состояние семьи.
texts.en: Gafir, 58, is married and has seven children. He has vocational technical education. Thirty-five years ago Gafir started breeding livestock and cultivating land, and now this is his primary source of income. Through his hard work, Gafir owns two cows and a 0.72-ha plot of land where he grows strawberries and cotton for sale. Gafir is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank in order to buy sheep for fattening up and resale, and fertilizers for land cultivation. He plans to invest the profit in more livestock and to improve his family’s income.

loans.use: to buy some sheep and fertilizers for land cultivation

loans.name: Archana

texts.en:
Thirty-year-old Archana is living in Chuakhola village in Falakata. She stays with her two children (one son and one daughter) and her husband Satyen. Archana attended school until grade 8 and could not study further, as her parents could not afford her educational expenses. She understands the value of education in life, so she is providing education to her children, and they are in grade 4 and 7 respectively.

Her husband runs a firewood business. He purchases wood from the villagers and resells it to the retail customers. His income is not satisfactory to run a four-member family. Archana hopes to make some profit, as it is very crucial for their survival. She wants to expand the business, but the major problem is lack of capital.

To help her husband in continuing with his business, Archana has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner). She plans to utilize the loan to buy timber on a large scale from the villagers and sell it to her customers as firewood. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her family's living conditions. In the future, she plans to expand her business and start a sawmill for them.

Archana conveys her thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase timber for her husband's firewood business.

loans.name: Camilo

texts.es:
Camilo, está solicitando un nuevo crédito para invertir en la milpa y en la crianza de ganado y cerdos, comprara concentrado para ganado y cerdos, el resto lo utilizara para pagar los mozos que están trabajando con él en la próxima siembra.
El préstamo anterior le permitió mejorar la abundancia de sus cosechas y tener más cabezas de ganado, su estilo de vida está cambiando positivamente.
texts.en: Camilo is requesting a new loan to invest in his field and in the raising of cattle and pigs.  He will purchase concentrated feed for his cattle and pigs, and use the rest to pay hired laborers who will work with him during the next planting.  His previous loan allowed him to increase the abundance of his harvest and to have more heads of cattle.  His lifestyle is changing positively.

loans.use: to purchase concentrated feed for cattle and pigs, as well as to pay for hired laborers to work with him at the next planting.

loans.name: Tulsi

texts.en:
Tulsi is a 33-year-old lady who lives in a village of Alipurduar district of West Bengal, India. Tulsi lives there with her husband and three children (one son and two daughters) in a small mud hut. Her children go to a nearby village school.

Tulsi is a homemaker and manages her household activities. The main source of income for Tulsi's family is vegetable cultivation, which her husband has been running for years. He grows different vegetables on his farmland and sells them to the local market. Tulsi also assists her husband in field work. To diversify their business for future development, they have decided to cultivate maize, which is a profitable crop, on a large scale. So, they need some capital to invest in the business.

For the smooth running of their agribusiness, Tulsi has decided to take a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS to purchase necessary farm inputs, such as seeds, fertilizer, pesticides, etc., for cultivation of maize. She hopes this will help her to increase her income and help her to manage her family better than her present status. Tulsi hopes to give a better education to her children.

She is appreciative towards her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Manika

texts.en:
Twenty-six-year-old Manika lives in a remote village, College Para, in Alipurduar district. Her family comprises her husband and two daughters. Manika and her husband studied up to grade 7 and 5 respectively, and they are providing education to their daughter. One of her daughters reads in grade 3, and the other one is a toddler.

Manika's husband works in a saloon shop. Thus, his income is hardly sufficient for the family of four members.

To meet the educational expenses of her child, Manika has been rearing cattle for a few years. She rears dairy cows, and her primary source of income comes from selling milk. She started a dairy business because milk is in much demand in her region. She wants to purchase another dairy cow for the expansion of her business, so she has taken a loan from BJS.

With this other cow, she will get more milk and will be able sell more milk; thus earn more money for her family. She is really focused on her activities. Through the loan, she will be able to completely turn her life and realize more income to pay for her children's education. Her children are her first priority, and she wants to see them established with good education.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow to increase her milk supply business.

loans.name: Omar

texts.es: Omar, tiene la edad  de 60 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa, la cual su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle al cultivo de cafe y así que tenga un buen desarrollo, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo de su cosecha, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo del café. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Omar, aged 60, is married and lives with his wife, who is his highest priority. With his loan, he will buy fertilizer and other products for cultivating coffee, as well as pay for the labor needed to apply the products and to assist on the plantation during the harvest, in order to ensure success. 

He wants to take advantage of the local climate and soil, which are ideal for cultivating coffee, and also put his years of experience managing coffee to use. He will also be able to buy the best, highest quality products for his plantation, ensuring the healthy development of the plants, a good harvest, and the production of a sizeable crop in a short time. He will use the earnings that he hopes to make on the coffee harvest for his family's welfare and to meet some family goals, as well as to continue investing in the crops. 

This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has never had loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided the loan with better facilities and a much lower rate of interest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other products for cultivating coffee

loans.name: Claudia Berenice

texts.es: Claudia tiene 36 años y es madre soltera. Ella vive con su pequeño hijo de seis años. Claudia tiene un empleo administrativo en una empresa. Con el fin de tener mayores ingresos para darle las mejores condiciones de su vida a su hijo, ella inició un negocio hace dos años. Claudia tiene un salón de belleza y necesita comprar productos como tintes permanentes de cabello, shampoo, acondicionador y productos para el cuidado del cabello. Por eso está solicitando un préstamo de MXN 6,000. Siempre está buscando formas de salir adelante para tener mayores ingresos. A Claudia le gusta ayudar a la gente a sentirse bien por dentro y por fuera, por esa razón ella inició este negocio. Lo que más disfruta de su trabajo es contribuir a que las personas estén felices. El incremento en sus ingresos como resultado de este préstamo le permitirá incrementar su cartera de clientes y tener un negocio más estable, así como realizar pagos satisfactorios en su primer préstamo con Konfío.
texts.en: Claudia is 36 years old and a single mother. She lives with her youngest son of six years. Claudia has an administrative job in a company. In order to make more income to give the best life condition to her son, she started a business two years ago. Claudia has a beauty salon and needs to buy products such as permanent hair dye, shampoo, conditioner and products for hair care. That's why she is requesting a loan. She is always looking for ways to move forward to make more income. Claudia likes to help people feel good inside and out, which is why she started this business. What she enjoys most about her job is to help people be happy. The increase in income as a result of this loan will help increase her customer base and have a more stable business and make satisfactory payments on her first loan from Konfío.

loans.use: to buy products such as permanent hair dye, shampoo, conditioner and products for hair care.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy, 26 years old, is married to Douglas and supports a family of three members. 

She has been practicing small-scale farming for the last three years, earning an income of 9,000 Kenya Shillings (KES) per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of 25,000 KES from Vision Fund Kenya to buy fertilizers and seedlings for planting.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and to educate her children. Her hope is to better her life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings for planting

loans.name: Karlla Iliana

texts.es: Karlla tiene 31 años y desde hace un año está casada y planea iniciar una familia en un futuro cercano. Karlla ha sido una mujer emprendedora desde 2011, siempre fue su sueño ser una mujer de negocios. Por esa razón, posee un negocio de asesoría legal para trabajadores. Al final de este año, Karlla planea ser un establecimiento más formal gracias al incremento en sus ingresos. Con un préstamo de MXN 13,000, Karlla comprará nuevo equipo para sus oficinas, como escritorios y papelería, así como cubrir los salarios de los empleados. Además de su negocio, tiene un empleo como asistente de marketing en una compañía. Su mayor sueño es ser la compañía más reconocida en toda la región y tener otro negocio de marketing para lograr estabilidad financiera. Todo esto le permitirá tener su propia casa para dejarle un patrimonio seguro a sus hijos. Con este préstamo ella tendrá ingresos más altos, que le permitirán realizar pagos satisfactorios en su cuarto préstamo con Konfío.
texts.en: Karlla is 31, has been married for a year, and plans to start a family in the near future. Karlla was been an entrepreneur since 2011. It was always her dream to be a businesswoman. For that reason, she has a business giving legal advice to workers. At the end of this year, Karlla plans to be a more formal setting thanks to the increase in revenue. With a loan of MXN 13,000, Karlla plans to buy new equipment for her offices, desks and stationary, as well as cover the salaries of employees. In addition to her business, she has a job as a marketing assistant in a company. Her biggest dream is to be the most recognized company in the region and have another marketing business to achieve financial stability. All this will allow her to leave a secure legacy for her future children. With this loan she will have higher incomes, allowing her to make payments on her fourth successful loan Konfío.

loans.use: to buy desks and stationery as well as cover salary payments to her employees.

loans.name: Nomzamo

texts.en:
Nomzamo is applying for a loan to support her studies for a year at Maharishi Ezemvelo Rural University (MERU). This is her story:

1. What do you study at Maharishi Institute? Which classes do you enjoy most?

"I am doing a BA in Business. Classes that I enjoy the most are Marketing, Leadership, Statistics and Algebra. The reason why I enjoyed them most  is because I believe I was born as a leader, and when I did a leadership course, it really showed me a way forward. I enjoy marketing because I have confidence to speak in public and sell a product. I enjoy statistics and algebra because I have always loved math."

2. What are your goals after graduating from the Institute? Please be specific: In which sector do you expect to work? In which city would you like to work? Would you like to travel?

"My goals are to work and raise capital to start up my own business. I am looking into logistics and property investment. To start, I would like to work in a finance department. I have traveled my whole life, ever since I was a kid, so I would definitely like to travel. I adapt easily everywhere I go, and the cities I would like to work in are Johannesburg and Cape Town, but really anywhere would fit me perfectly."

3. Tell us about your background. Where were you born? Do you have brothers and sisters? What do your parents do for work? Are you married? Do you have children?

"I was born in the Eastern Cape in a town called Matatiele. I have two sisters; unfortunately, the second born passed away. My parents were married, but unfortunately my father also passed away before my sister. He was a breadwinner at home and my mother was a housewife. When my father passed away, life changed for us. We went from going to school wearing shoes and having something to eat to going barefoot and having absolutely nothing in the stomach. We are living on a social grant and there is no other income. I am not married."

4. What do you like to do in your spare time?

"Most of the time I spend is on books; I love writing and reading novels and my studies. These are the things that keep me away from the bad things that I see other people my age doing. I also enjoy traveling, dancing and watching movies once in a while. I also love spending time with my family and friends."

5. How will a Kiva loan change your life? Describe how the loan will affect your studies and your lifestyle: will there be significant changes?

"A Kiva loan will change my life in many ways. I will be able to pay the Maharishi fees and be able to maintain myself. I will buy books that will help build me forward, so that I can be just like anyone. It will help my studies and allow me to get anything that is helpful to finance my studies. Yes, there will be huge significant changes once I start receiving a Kiva loan."

loans.use: to pay for one year tuition fees and living expenses at Maharishi Ezemvelo Rural University (MERU).

loans.name: Jaqueline Mariana

texts.es:
Jaqueline es una joven mujer de 22 años de edad, soltera, tiene un hijo varón de 4 años, y su negocio es la venta de frutas.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, paciente, activa, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘Ceja’ de El Alto, área central situada al este de la ciudad, congrega a la mayoría de los edificios administrativos, comerciales y sedes de organizaciones sociales. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Jaqueline es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, viste de forma tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su abuelo que trabaja y con su hijo que aún no se encuentra en edad escolar, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de fruta de temporada, como; plátanos, naranjas, sandías, melones, mandarinas, papayas, etc., actividad que realiza en su puesto de venta fijo todos los días de la semana en horas del día, “inicié mi negocio con un capital mínimo ayudando a mi mamá y trabajando de forma ambulante…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con un puesto de venta fijo al cual acuden clientes continuos, la desventaja es la falta de un depósito de almacenamiento. Su sueño es vender por mayor y contar con un depósito, ella desea comprar fruta de temporada por mayor para ofertar a sus clientes y mejorar sus ventas. Esta es la 1 se3cuencia de préstamo s con la institución en 3 años que desarrolla esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Jaqueline solicita un préstamo para la compra de fruta de temporada para vender por mayor y con los beneficios comprar un depósito.
texts.en:
Jaqueline is a 22 year old young woman. She is single, with one 4 year old son, and has a business selling fruit. She is a good mother who is enterprising, patient, active, responsible and very hard working. 

She works in the Ceja zone of El Alto, which is a central area situated to the east of the city, where most of the administrative and commercial buildings and headquarters for social organisations are located. It has a cold, dry climate, with a daily temperature ranging between 0-12 degrees centigrade. 

Jaqueline has a dark complexion, brown eyes and long black hair that she wears in a braid, she is short and strongly built and wears the traditional hat, shawl and skirt. Her maternal language is Aymará which is spoken in the area, but she also speaks Spanish due to the general culture and for her work. 

She lives with her grandfather who works, and her son who is not yet school age; they live in their own home, built from brick and cement with a corrugated iron roof. The house is equipped with running water, electricity and a sewage system. 

She sells seasonal fruit, such as bananas, oranges, watermelons, melons, mandarins, papayas etc. which she does from a permanent stall during the day every day of the week. "I began my business with very little money, as a street seller helping my mother..." she says. The advantage of her business is that she has a permanent stall which continuously welcomes customers; the disadvantage is the lack of a storage space. 

Her dream is to sell wholesale, and to have some storage. She wishes to buy seasonal fruit wholesale for her customers and improve her sales. This is her first loan with the institution in the three years she has been working in this area.

This is why Jaqueline is requesting a loan to buy seasonal fruit to sell wholesale, and to buy storage space with the profits.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruit to sell wholesale, and to buy storage space with the profits.

loans.name: Carlos Martin

texts.es:
Carlos, vive junto a sus padres y su hermano mayor. Sus padres son personas ya muy mayores de edad y trabajan de manera muy eventual, para poder ayudar a Carlos a continuar estudiando. La única persona que está trabajando es su hermano mayor, pero los ingresos que gana son mínimos y no le permite cubrir las necesidades de la familia.

Él está cursando el primer año de la carrera de Mecánica de Producción, aún le falta 2 años y medios para concluir sus estudios. Le interesa muchísimo su carrera porque siente que es muy interesante, además un familiar se la recomendó. Por eso, siente que lo va a beneficiar en una buena economía, también al culminarla le permitirá obtener la certificación necesaria para poder conseguir un buen trabajo y así poder apoyar a su familia.

Debido a la difícil situación por la que está atravesando su familia, Carlos recurre al apoyo de KIVA para no dejar de estudiar y continuar esforzándose hasta convertirse en un excelente profesional. De no tener el acceso al Crédito Educativo, Carlos tendría que dejar de estudiar, truncando sus sueños de ser un gran profesional, porque se dedicaría a buscar trabajo para poder reunir dinero suficiente y retomar sus estudios, eso le ocasionaría un gran atraso en su vida profesional.

Él piensa especializarse más en su carrera y llegar a tener un negocio propio, el cual le permita generar ingresos suficientes para apoyar a su familia.

Carlos dice: "Estoy inmensamente agradecido con la oportunidad que me da KIVA para cumplir mis sueños de tener una carrera profesional. Gracias por el apoyo brindado."
texts.en:
Carlos lives with his parents and older brother.  His parents are already very elderly people and work very part time so that they can help Carlos continue studying. The only person who is working [full time] is his older brother, but the income he earns is minimal and doesn't allow him to cover all of the family's necessities.  

Carlos is studying his first year in Production Mechanics, and still has 2 and 1/2 years to complete his studies.  This career interests him because he feels like it is very interesting, and also a family member recommended it.  For this reason, he feels that this will benefit him economically, and also, when he completes [the program], it will allow him to obtain the necessary certification to be able to obtain a good job and thus support his family.  

Due to the difficult situation his family is experiencing, Carlos relies on the support of KIVA so that he doesn't have to stop his studies, and can continue striving to become an excellent professional.  Without having access to a student loan, Carlos would have to stop studying, truncating his dreams of becoming a great professional, because he would have to look for work to be able to earn enough money and resume his studies, which would greatly delay his professional life.  

He is considering specializing further in his field and eventually have his own business, which would allow him to generate sufficient income to support his family.  Carlos says: "I am immensely grateful for the opportunity that KIVA has given me to achieve my dreams of having a professional career.  Thank you for the support offered."

loans.use: to pay for the remainder of his tuition in Production Mechanics and continue his studies successfully

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Group

texts.es:
El comité está conformado por 20 mujeres inspiradas en una mejor y buena calidad de vida, todas ellas se dedican a la elaboración de artesanías, son mujeres muy trabajadoras y se esfuerzan por sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Sonia, que se encuentra contenta por formar parte del comité, es una mujer muy emprendedora, que hace todo tipo de artesanías para la venta. Quiere ir mejorando para poder dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas, hilos, bastidores y otros para poder seguir con la elaboración de sus artesanías, agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar y superarse cada día.
texts.en:
The committee is made up of 20 women inspired by a better and good quality of life. They all earn a living making crafts, they are very hardworking women who strive hard for their families.

One of the members is Sonia, who is happy to belong to the committee. She is a very entrepreneurial woman who makes all kinds of crafts for sale. She wishes to keep improving to be able to give her loved ones everything that she was not able to have. She is asking for this loan to be able to buy material, thread, stretcher frames and other items to be able to continue with the making of her crafts. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving to be able to improve and better herself each day.

loans.use: to buy material, thread, stretcher frames and other items to be able to continue with the making of her crafts.

loans.name: Katty Diana

texts.es:
Katty, es una joven que vive en el Distrito de San Juan de Lurigancho, uno de los más grandes de Lima. Vive junto a sus padres y hermano. Su padre trabaja como mototaxista para poder llevar dinero a casa, mientras que su mami trabaja de manera independiente, por lo que los ingresos que generan son mínimos, siendo un gran obstáculo para su continuidad en los estudios.

Ella está cursando el primer año de Administración Industrial, aún le faltan 2 años para poder culminarla. Le gusta mucho su carrera porque le permitirá desarrollarse profesionalmente y así beneficiar a su familia económicamente. Para ella es muy importante recibir el apoyo de KIVA porque quiere continuar estudiando, ser una excelente profesional y tener su propio negocio.

De no tener el acceso al Crédito Educativo, su familia tendría que ver la manera de conseguir un préstamo en un banco, lo cual los perjudicaría más, ya que los bancos cobran muy altos intereses y los ingresos que perciben ellos son mínimos.

Por eso, Katty les quiere decir:"Me siento muy contenta con el apoyo brindado por KIVA porque así podré terminar mis estudios y ayudar a mi familia. Gracias KIVA por todo el apoyo."
texts.en:
Katty is a young woman who lives in San Juan de Lurigancho, one of the largest districts in Lima. She lives with her parents and brother. Her father is a motorbike-taxi driver to bring money to the home, while her mother works independently, meaning that the household income is minimal, which is a significant obstacle for the continuation of her studying.

She is in her first year studying Industrial Management, and has two years until she completes the course. She very much enjoys her degree as it allows her to develop professionally, and so help her family economically. For Katty, receiving Kiva's help is important as she wants to continue studying, become a skilled professional, and have her own business.

Without access to a student loan, her family would have to look into taking out a bank loan, which would cause further problems, as the banks charge very high interest rates, and the incomes they receive are minimal.

And so, Katty wishes to say: "I am very happy for the help provided by Kiva because this way I will be able to continue my studies and help my family. Thank you Kiva for all the help."

loans.use: to continue her studies in Industrial Management

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase jembes and fertilizers for farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for use in her farm

loans.name: Yamileth

texts.es: Yamileth es propietaria de un restaurante. Es un proyecto familiar que ha iniciado recientemente. Necesita un préstamo de $2,100 para comprar equipo de línea blanca y mobiliario para el restaurante. Su objetivo es generar ingresos que les permita mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Yamileth is the owner of a restaurant. It is a family project that has been started recently. She needs a loan of $2,100 to buy white goods and furniture for the restaurant. Her aim is to generate an income that will allow them to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy white goods and furniture for her restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add retail inventory of home products and appliances.

loans.name: Mpigi Central School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Esita. She is the head teacher of Mpigi Central Primary School, a mixed school in the urban area of Mpigi with 500 students. Mpigi Central School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. 

The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 liter tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Mpigi Central School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Esita ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children who fall sick from water-borne diseases, as well as increasing the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and certified seeds for planting for better agricultural produce to meet family and client needs.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 28 years old and married to Everline. He supports a family of 5 family members. 

He has been a farmer for the last 3 years and the business earns him an income of KES 10,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase farm inputs for his farming activity so as to have a better harvest for sale in the market and to meet family and client needs. 
 
He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and expand his agricultural sector. 

His hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for his farming activity so as to have a better harvest for sale in the market and to meet family and client needs.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 52 years old. She supports a family of 5 members. 

She has been in a tea farming activity for the last 25 years, earning an income of KES 15,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to improve her farming activity so as to raise more income and improve her family's living standard. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and improve her family's health care. 

Her hope is to better her life.

loans.use: to improve her farming activity so as to raise more income and improve her family's living standard.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for milk production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spare parts for repair and maintenance of his motorcycle and provide better transport service to his customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy motorcycle spare parts for servicing his motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase farm implements and farm inputs such as fertilizer for a better harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm tools and farm inputs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Israel

texts.en:
Israel is applying for a loan to support his studies for a year at Maharishi Ezemvelo Rural University(MERU). This is his story: 

1.	What do you study at Maharishi Institute? Which classes do you enjoy most? 
I am currently studying for my BBA and I enjoy every class that I attended as I am interested in business.
2.	What are your goals after graduating from the Institute? Please be specific: In which sector do you expect to work? In which city would you like to work? Would you like to travel?
After I graduate with Maharishi Institute my goal is to work at JP Morgan in the investment department as they are our mentor in banking.
3.	Tell us about your background. Where were you born? Do you have brothers and sisters? What do your parents do for work? Are you married? Do you have children?
I am from a place called Taung in North West. At home, we are seven children and currently I am the only one who is at the university level. Getting a Kiva loan will help me because my mother is the only person working and her salary is not enough to cover all the basic needs of the family. 
4.	What do you like to do in your spare time?
In my spare time, I surf the internet and read about what is going on in the world. I also watch news and relax to prepare myself for the next day.
5.	How will a Kiva loan change your life? Describe how the loan will affect your studies and your lifestyle: Will there be significant changes?
Kiva will help me to finish my studies because my mother is the only person taking care of us and I am not the only one at home that is studying. Her salary is to cover our studies at the same time.

loans.use: to pay for one year tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Ezemvelo Rural University (MERU).

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is a widowed woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells cosmetics. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of cosmetics. Her business goal is to have a wholesale shop within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a great life. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to open a salon.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cosmetics.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a Business Management Student at the Maharishi Institute. Joseph is 22 years old and was asked the following questions by a staff member of the Institute:  This is his story: 
1.	What do you study at the Maharishi Institute? Which classes do you enjoy the most?
I’m currently doing my BBA in business administration. It would have to be my financial classes that I like the most. I love elementary algebra and human resource management because I love working with people.
2.	What are your goals after graduating from the Maharishi Institute? Please be specific: in which sector do you expect to work? In which city would you like to work? Would you like to travel?
I’m on the verge of starting my own business in construction. I’m really flexible, so I’m prepared to work anywhere because I’m so hungry for success. In terms of sector, I would prefer to work close to Johannesburg, but I believe in no limits so I can work in any city.
3.	Tell us about your background. Where were you born? Do you have brothers and sisters? What do your parents do for work? Are you married; do you have children?
I was born in the small town called Geluksdal in the East Rand, I have one sibling, my younger brother. My mother works as a pre-school teacher and my father is unemployed. I do not have any children and am not married. I’m the oldest and my younger brother is finishing high school next year. Although we are not rich, I was brought up on good morals and my parents believe in hard work and patience.
4.	What do you like to do in your spare time?
I do a lot of community work. I’m a church member and I have a passion for music. I sing in the church choir. I love reading, especially the business bulletin novels, which is how I practice my speech.
5.	How will a Kiva loan change your life? Describe how the loan will affect your studies and your lifestyle: will there be significant changes?
I use a lot of money for transport. This loan will help cover my transport and get to school on time because the transport I’m using now is not up to standard.  It will also be a weight lifted off my mother’s shoulder.

loans.use: to pay for one year tuition fees and living expenses at Maharishi Ezemvelo Rural University (MERU).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stock of stationery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Liz Metza

texts.es:
Liz es una joven estudiante que nació a los 7 meses, desde muy niña fue una luchadora. Ella vive junto a sus padres y 3 hermanos (2 hombres y 1 mujer). Su padre trabaja como albañil de manera eventual. Su madre es ama de casa y se dedica al cuidado de sus hermanos menores ya que ella es la mayor.

Ella está estudiando la carrera de Tecnología del Diseño y Desarrollo de Prendas de Vestir, aún le falta 2 años para poder culminarla. Le interesa mucho su carrera porque tiene un alto campo laboral y perciben buenos ingresos. La beneficiaría mucho porque podrá ayudar a sus padres con la crianza y los estudios de sus hermanos menores. Le gustaría especializarse como confeccionista de prendas de vestir.

Antes de recibir el dinero, ella reunía dinero de las propinas que le daban sus familiares y el trabajo de su padre para poder pagar sus mensualidades, las cuales son muy fuertes. Pero debido a la actual y difícil situación por la que está atravesando su familia, se ve en la necesidad de solicitar el apoyo a KIVA para poder continuar estudiando, de lo contrario vería sus sueños truncados.

Liz les quiere decir a las personas de KIVA: "Muchisimas gracias por el apoyo que brindan a jóvenes como yo que tienen deseo de superación y por problemas económicos no pueden cumplir sus sueños de superación personal. Muchas gracias KIVA por esta oportunidad".
texts.en:
Liz is a young student that was born after only seven months, proving that she has been a fighter since birth. She lives with her parents and three siblings (two brothers and one sister). Her father works sporadically as a bricklayer and her mother is a housewife that looks after her younger siblings, as she is the eldest.  

She is studying for a degree in Dressmaking and Design. She still has 2 years left until she finishes. She is very interested in her degree as it will lead her into a good job with the possibility of decent wages. For this reason, obtaining her degree would help her to a great extent as she would be able to help her parents with the raising and schooling of her younger siblings. She would like to specialise as a dressmaker. 

Before asking for this loan she used to collect money from the tips given to her by her relatives and from her father's job in order to pay monthly for her tuition fees, which amounted to large sums of money. However, due to fact that the family has been going through difficult times, she feels that in order to save her dreams from being shattered, it is necessary to ask KIVA for some support so that she can carry on with her studies. 

Liz wants to say to everyone at KIVA: "Thank you very much for the support that you provide youngsters like myself who want to move their lives forward but cannot accomplish their dreams due to financial difficulties. Thank you so much KIVA for this opportunity".

loans.use: to accomplish her dream of becoming a successful professional in Dressmaking and Design.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase water pumps for starting a car wash so as to meet client needs in cleaning motorcycles and vehicles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry feeds for more egg production and supply to meet her customers` demand and to earn more income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve her business and raise more income to meet family needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To acquire a greenhouse for growing crops such as tomatoes.

loans.name: Shaban

texts.en:
Shaban is 41 years old, married, with 9 children, living in Kasese Uganda. Shaban deals in produce selling dry agriculture products such as beans, peas, maize, ground nuts and millet to earn a living. He started the business in 2009 as he gets additional income from a motorcycle transport business. 

He has a dream of building a good house for his family despite being affected by floods that makes his service delivery difficult. Shaban has requested for a loan to buy agriculture produce like beans for selling.

loans.use: to buy agriculture produce like beans for selling.

loans.name: Kyasanku School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Charles. He is the Head teacher of Kyasanku Hill College School, a mixed school with 200 students in the rural area of Kyasanku in Mpigi. Kyasanku School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Kyasanku School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Charles ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Sheild Of Faith School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Kenneth. He is the Director of Shield of Faith Primary School, a mixed school with 150 students in the rural area of Mbagwa in Sheema. Shield of Faith School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Shield of Faith School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Kenneth ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children who fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a milling machine to make feeds.

loans.name: Aparna

texts.en:
Aparna is a 45-year-old rural woman from Falakata. She is a mother of two children (one son and one daughter). She is married to Jhantu, a 50-year-old farmer. They live in the small village of Harinathpur of Falakta in the district of Alipurduar. Their son works as an electrician, and their daughter is married.

As Aparna is a homemaker, her first priority is her family. She works dawn to dusk to fulfill their needs. After managing the household work, she assists her husband in agricultural work.

The source of income for their family is agribusiness, which her husband has been doing for many years. With much work and sacrifice, he mainly grows vegetables, which are in much demand in the region. To cope with the growing price of essential daily commodities, they need to cultivate more crops to generate more income. They have decided to cultivate cucumbers on their farmland, as the crop has a high demand in the present market. Due to the shortage of capital, they are unable to do this. So, Aparna is asking for financial help from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy fertilizers and herbicides to cultivate cucumbers on their farm.

Her goal is to strengthen her family’s economy. She hopes the loan will help her to grow her agribusiness, which will ultimately help in generating more income. She aspires to give her best to her son with her income.

Aparna expresses her gratitude to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies for cucumber cultivation.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is single, he does not have children and he lives at his parent's house.  Jose works as an electrician and he does not earn much money. That is why he is asking for another loan to purchase construction materials to build a room that his mother needs to rent.  

Jose wants to finish the construction of the room.  He would like to buy enough materials, but his economy is not good to pay for the construction work in one payment, so that is why he is doing it little by little

loans.use: to purchase construction materials and to build a room to rent out.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for milk production, so as to increase the number of litres of milk supplied to clients.

loans.name: Khusan

texts.ru:
На фотке снята Хусан. Он очень трудолюбивый человек. Хусан  25 лет своей жизни занят растениеводством. Он имеет земельный участок, где сажает клубнику. Хусан хороший дехкан и он хорошо ухаживает о растение. Он каждый сезон посева  урожай он обрабатывает землю минеральными удобрениями, чтобы получить богатый  и здоровый урожай. 
Хусан женат и отец двоих сыновей. Ему 55 года. Младший помогает Хусану на работе, а старший сын находится на заработках в Российской Федерации, по причине что он не нашел себе подходящую работу в стране.  
Хусан просит кредит для купли минеральных удобрений. Он будет очень рад на Вашей помощи.
texts.en:
The man in the picture is Khusan. He is very hard-working. For 25 years, he has been cultivating plants. Khusan has a land lot where he plants strawberries. He is a capable farmer and is good at looking after the plants. Every planting season he applies fertilizers on the land to get an abundant and healthy harvest. 

Khusan is married, a father of two sons. He is 55 years old. The younger son helps Khusan in the field while the older is working in Russia since he couldn’t find a suitable job at home. Khusan requested a loan to buy fertilizers. He will be happy to get your help!

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the land

loans.name: Mausumi

texts.en:
Mausumi is a 27-year-old lady. She is married and has two children (one son and one daughter). They are reading in grade 7 and 10, respectively. She lives with her family in the small village of Chuakhola in Alipurduar district. Mausumi studied until grade five. She is married to Narayan who is 40 years old.

Mausumi's husband is a farmer. His father taught him to work in agriculture at a young age. Now he grows different kinds of vegetables, mainly bottle gourds. Mausumi also helps him in his agricultural work. Now they want to concentrate on the cultivation of bottle gourds only, as it is in high demand among the villagers for its low price and nutritious value.  Also, it is a full summer season crop. So he wants to cultivate more in quantity.

So, Mausumi is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner).  She will invest this loan in buying seeds, fertilizers etc. to grow bottle gourds. One part of the loan will also be used to buy the inputs to take care of the crop until it bears fruit.

Mausumi plans to buy all the necessary school supplies so that her son and daughter won't have problems in their studies and can pass without any problems. Mausumi knows she can achieve this with the profit gained from their business. She also hopes through the profit from the business, she can overcome the hurdles and will be able to give the family a financial uplift.

She appreciates the financial help of her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies to grow bottle gourds.

loans.name: Taha

texts.en:
Taha is 24 years old and from Minia. He is married and has one son and one daughter. The only source of income is a spices shop. 

The income from the spices shop can't cover his family's monthly expenses, so he requested a 5000 EGP loan from TADE to buy more spices such as ginger, cinnamon, and pepper to expand his project and increase his income for his family.

loans.use: To buy more spices such as ginger, cinnamon, and pepper to improve the family income

loans.name: Prabhasini

texts.en:
Prabhasini is an energetic 43-year-old married lady. She is the mother of three children (one daughter and two sons). She stays with her family in a semi-concrete house in the village of Chuakhola in the district of Alipurduar. 

Her husband is a carpenter by occupation. But he has an irregular income. Prabhasini is a hardworking woman. To give financial support to her family she makes bamboo baskets and sells them in the local bazaar. There is a great demand for these baskets in rural areas. The materials required to make the baskets are expensive, so it was not possible for her to run the business effectively. 

Prabhasini decided to take a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy more bamboo sticks and other supplies for preparing more baskets. Since childhood, Prabhasini has been an expert in making handicraft items and that is why she plays the decent role of making the baskets in a good way. Her neighbors are also fond of their baskets, so Prabhasini got encouragement in making baskets. She hopes this will improve her financial status and enhance her business on a large scale. She also wants to employ labor in this work to assist her and to enlarge her business.

Prabhasini is very much thankful to BJS and Kiva for helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase bamboo sticks and other supplies for making baskets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Inocencio

texts.en:
Inocencio is 62 years old and he is married.  He lives with his wife and the couple has 2 kids.

Inocencio works as a driver  He has a minibus and he also is a mason. He needs a loan to fix the engine of his vehicle.

Inocencio would like to buy another vehicle in the future. He needs your help because his wife only takes care of the kids and Inocencio is the only person that supports the home

loans.use: to fix the engine of his vehicle

loans.name: Rahima

texts.ru: Рахима очень благодарно на Вашу поддержку. Она успешно погасила прыдедущий кредит. Сейча у Рахимы  25 летный опыт работы.  Очень мало встречаются дехканы  таким опытом. Рахима получила этот опыт от родителей, она очень благодарна им. Большую часть времени она отдает  работе, чтобы зарабатывать и прокормить свою семью. В этом году она посадила клубнику. Рахима хочет получить богатый урожай и старается всеми способами. Для этой цели она просит кредит для покупки минеральных удобрений.  Она верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Rahima is grateful for your help. She successfully repaid her previous loan. Currently, she has a 25-year work experience. Farmers with such experience are seldom to come across. She gained it from her parents and she is grateful to them for it. 

Most of the time Rahima spends working to make enough money to provide for her family. This year, she planted strawberries. Rahima strives to get an abundant harvest for which she is doing everything she can. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy mineral fertilizers. She has faith in you and hopes for your help!

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers for the land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow so as to increase the number of litres of milk supplied to customers and meet their demands in milk supply.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Norma Haydee

texts.es: Norma de 54 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella se dedica a la confección de ropa desde hace 13 años el cual inicio con capital propio, su taller de costura lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y posee muchos clientes por la calidad con que realiza la ropa, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de hilos, agujas, variedad de tela, botones, elásticos, etc. y así poder continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Norma is 54 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and son.  She has worked making clothing for 13 years and started her workshop with her own money.  Her workshop is located in her home and she has many customers due to the quality of clothing she makes.

She is requesting a loan to buy thread, needles, fabric, buttons, elastic, etc. so that she can continue her work and generate a good income.

loans.use: to buy thread, needles, fabric, buttons, elastic, etc.

loans.name: Kwefako Group

texts.en:
These pictured are members of the “Kwefako” group located in the city outskirts. The featured member is Aidah, who breeds small birds in the form of poultry. She breeds her birds and then sells them to customers who ask for them. She is a responsible and hardworking person and this enables her to support her family. 

She is seeking a loan to buy young birds and their feeds. The members are grateful to those who are helping them to achieve their dreams and guarantees that she will repay the loan within the set time.

loans.use: To buy chicks and poultry feeds which will help support her family

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Candelaria es una mujer de 53 años de edad, es soltera tiene una linda familia de nueve hijos de las edades entre 12 y 35 años, pero ya solo tres de sus hijos viven  con ella en una comunidad de Suchitepéquez.
Candelaria con el afán de generar sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia,  se dedica a lavar ropa ajena, esta labor lo realiza ella desde hace quince años,  pero para mejorar sus ingresos ella también cría potos.
Candelaria es una madre de familia que le preocupa su familia, es por ello que ahora ha considerado necesario construir su cocina, porque la cocina con la que ahora cuenta ya está en muy mal estado, pero una de las dificultades que ella tiene es que no cuenta con suficiente dinero para poder comprar materiales de construcción como; cemento, arena, block, y hierro.
El gran anhelo de Candelaria es poder darles a sus hijos una casa propia y que ellos tengan mejores oportunidades.
texts.en:
Candelaria is a fifty-three year-old woman, she is single and has a beautiful family of nine children between the ages of twelve and thirty-five, but now only three of her children still live with her in a village in Suchitepéquez.
Wanting to generate income and help out her family, Candelaria takes in laundry. She has been doing this work for fifteen years, but to increase her income she also raises ducks. 
Candelaria is a mother who is concerned for her family, and that is why she considers it necessary to build a new kitchen, because the kitchen she has now is in very poor condition. One of the problems she has is she does not have enough money to be able to buy construction materials such as cement, sand, blocks and steel. 
Candelaria's fondest wish is to be able to give her children their own house and to see them have better opportunities.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, blocks, and steel.

loans.name: Mujeres Xepecul Group

texts.es:
María (la primera del lado izquierdo de la fotografía de blusa roja) es una mujer de 44 años de edad, ella está profundamente agradecida por el crédito al que tuvo la oportunidad de poder acceder porque gracias a ello pudo invertir en su negocio de venta de ropa típica, y aumentaron sus ganancias. Ahora Maria junto a su grupo solicita un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en su negocio de venta de ropa típica porque ahora el mundo de la ropa cada vez está más de moda y ella necesita modernizar su mercadería como güipiles, cortes, fajas de diferentes colores, estilos y precios.
El gran sueño de Maria es poder ayudar a sus hijos para que se gradúen de la universidad, y construir una casa de block.
texts.en:
Maria is a 44-year-old woman (in the photograph, she is the first woman on the left who is wearing a red shirt). She is deeply grateful for the loan that she had the opportunity to receive because, thanks to this loan, she was able to invest in her traditional clothing sale business and to increase her earnings. 

Currently, Maria, together with her group, is requesting a new loan, which she will invest in her traditional clothing sale business because the world of traditional clothing is now becoming more and more fashionable. Therefore, she needs to modernize her merchandise by purchasing guipiles (traditional blouses), cortes (traditional skirts), and fajas (traditional sashes) of different colors, styles, and prices. 

Maria's greatest dream is to be able to support her children so that they can graduate from college and to build a brick house.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothing for sale.

loans.name: Pacanal 1B, 2 Group

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer de 34 años de edad, es soltera tiene una linda familia de dos hijas de las edades entre 9 y 19 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Nahuala.
Ana (es la primera del lado derecho de la fotografía de blusa negra)para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la venta de hojas de Maxan, ella realiza esta actividad desde hace 10 años.
Ana ahora se encuentra muy preocupada pues tiene unas cuerdas de hojas de Maxan que ya requieren de su mantenimiento, y ella no cuenta con suficiente capital para poder comprar sus fertilizantes y pagar la mano de obra, entonces para no perder su cultivo a organizado a un grupo de personas para poder juntos solicitar un préstamo y darle mantenimiento a su cultivo de Maxan.
El gran sueño de Ana es poder construir su casa de block, para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana, 34, is a single woman.  She has a beautiful family with two daughters between the ages of 9 and 19.  This modest family lives in a community in Nahuala.

Ana (the first one on the right in the photograph, in the black blouse) has worked selling maxan leaves [for wrapping food] for 10 years to earn a living and get her family ahead.  Ana's concerned now because she has a few cords of maxan leaves that require care, and she doesn't have enough capital to buy fertilizer and pay for labor.  She has organized a group of people to request a loan together so she can provide care for her maxan crop and not lose the crop. 

Ana's big dream is to be able to build a house of cinder blocks

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es un hombre de 35 años, él está muy agradecido por el crédito al que tuvo la oportunidad de acceder pues gracias a ello pudo darle el mantenimiento a su cultivo de banano y obtuvo muy buena cosecha y ganancia. Manuel nuevamente solicita un préstamo para poder comprar un terreno para seguir  incrementando su cultivo.
El gran sueño de Manuel es poder cultivar diez cuerdas de banano en este año.
texts.en: Manuel is a 35 year old man. He is very grateful for the loan he was able to get, because thanks to it he was able to maintain his banana crop and to obtain a good harvest and earnings. Once again, Manuel is requesting a loan to be able to buy land to keep on increasing his crop. Manuel's greatest dream is to be able to cultivate ten "cuerdas"(measure of area and length) of bananas this year.

loans.use: to cultivate ten "cuerdas"(measure of area and length) of bananas this year.

loans.name: Shuktara

texts.en:
Twenty-one-year-old Shuktara is a housewife from Falakata, who is pursuing her Bachelor's degree. She lives with her husband in Jogendrapur village, in Alipurduar district of West Bengal. Her husband always supports her continuous education.

They have a plot of land where her husband grows different vegetables and sells the produce in the market. He finds joy in harvesting his own cultivation for consumption and selling them for income generation. 

Shuktara is a multitasking woman. After managing her household and studies, she also helps her husband in agricultural work. They live in a small village where most of the inhabitants are engaged in cultivation. So, they have to face tough business competition. Now Shuktara and her husband aspire to do chili cultivation, which is commonly used in most of the Indian dishes. As such, they hope to obtain a good profit from this cultivation.  

Shuktara has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase good quality seeds, fertilizers and other necessary supplies for cultivation of chilies. She expresses her gratitude to her generous lenders.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies for chili cultivation.

loans.name: Malaina Group

texts.en:
Melenia is 55 years with nine children. She sells second hand clothes to people within her trading center. She does this business in order to provide food for her family and to reduce the levels of poverty in her household. 

Wanting to expand her business, she will use the loan to buy more bales of second hand clothes in order to increase the supply to the market.  Her main intention of getting the loans is to improve her living standards, by building a better house and owning a kraal of goats.  

The loans have helped her to be food sufficient and she is able to help her relatives.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes to become food sufficient and help her relatives

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 24 years old from Minia. He is married and has one son and one daughter. He works as a taxi motorcycle driver but the income from his job can't cover his family's monthly expenses. 

So Mohammad started a grocery store project to increase his monthly income and cover his family's increasing expenses. Mohammad wants to buy more products such as sugar, rice and oil to meet the demands of his customers specially in Ramadan and other feast seasons.

loans.use: To buy more products such as sugar, rice and oil.

loans.name: Shadya

texts.en:
Shadya is 22 years old from Minia. She is single and has a small clothing shop. She helps her father with the family income to cover the needs of her siblings. 

Shadya requested a 5000 EGP loan to buy more clothing to meet the demands of her customers, especially in the feast seasons and so increase her sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothing for her shop.

loans.name: Zebo

texts.ru:
Зебо занимается растениеводством уже более 10 лет. У нее есть участок земли, где она сажает и получает богатый урожай. Зебо всегда радуется, когда она собирает хороший и качественный урожай. Она сеет в основном помидоры.  
Зебо 43 года. Она прекрасная жена и мать четверых детей. Мужу 45 года. У нее 2 сыновья, и 2 дочери. Сыновьям 20 и 5 лет. Дочкам 15 и 12 лет. Старший сын настоящее время находится вдали от семьи. Зебо проживает в районе Турсунзаде со своей семьей. Зебо сейчас готовит почву для посадки нового урожая, по этой причине она обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить минеральные удобрения, семена помидоры. Это кредит поможет ей провести ранний посев и получить хороший урожай. Зебо надеется на Вашу отзывчивость. Вы можете поддержать ее сейчас!
texts.en:
Zebo has been cultivating plants for 10 years. She has a land lot where she plants seeds and gets a rich harvest. Zebo is always happy to gather a good quality harvest. Mostly she sows tomatoes. 

Zebo is 43 years old. She is a good wife and a mother of four kids. Her husband is 45 years old. They have two sons and two daughters. Sons are 20 and 5 years old, daughters – 15 and 12. The eldest son is far away from his family now. 

Zebo lives in the district of Tursun-zoda with her family. She is currently preparing the land to sow new seeds, which is why she requested a loan to buy mineral fertilizers and tomato seeds. This credit will help her sow early and gather a good harvest. Zebo is hoping for your sympathy. You can support her now!

loans.use: to buy tomato seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Gabriel Eduardo

texts.es:
Gabriel es un joven hombre de 24 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y estudia la carrera de historia.
Él es inteligente, feliz, soñador, optimista, emprendedor, responsable y muy trabajador. Sus estudios los realiza en la universidad pública situada en la ciudad sede de gobierno y capital político-administrativa del país, aquí conviven gente de todas las regiones, así como inmigrantes de otros lugares del mundo. La ciudad de noche es un espectáculo maravilloso, el cielo lleno de estrellas. De clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 1-17 grados centígrados.
Gabriel es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por las actividades que realiza. Su vida la realiza en casa de sus padres que trabajan y con su hermano mayor que trabaja, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Él estudia la carrera de historia y se encuentra en 2 año de 5 que dura la carrera, sus cualidades más destacables son, su gusto por la lectura, entusiasmo por los hechos ocurridos anteriormente, pasión por entender los hechos que marcaron épocas en la historia, “estudio y trabajo, reparto todo mi tiempo en ambas actividades y me siento contento con mis logros…” comenta. Paralelamente a sus estudios, él trabaja como camarógrafo realizando la filmación de eventos como, fiestas, cumpleaños, bautizos, etc., actividad que realiza mayormente los fines de semana por las noches, permitiéndole estudiar el resto del tiempo. La ventaja de sus actividades es que no se cruzan los horarios, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para la compra de una computadora portátil para ambas actividades. Su sueño es terminar sus estudios y ejercer su carrera profesional, el desea realizar la compra de una computadora portátil para realizar ambas actividades. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que trabaja y 2 años que estudia.
Es por esos motivos que Gabriel solicita un préstamo para comprar una computadora portátil para editar filmaciones y para terminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Gabriel is a 24 year old young man who is single, has no children, and who is majoring in history. He is intelligent, happy, a dreamer, optimistic, an entrepreneur, responsible, and a very hard worker. He studies at the public university located in the city that is the seat of the government and the political-administrative capital. People from all the regions, as well as immigrants from other places of the world live together here. The city at night is a marvelous sight with the sky full of stars. The climate is cold and dry with a temperature that varies between 1-17 degrees centigrade during the day.

Gabriel has a dark complexion, brown eyes, short black hair, short stature, and a medium physique. His mother tongue is Aymará which he speaks with his family. He speaks Spanish due to the general culture and for business. He lives in the home of his working parents and with his working older brother. They live in their own home built out of brick and cement with a corrugated iron roof, wood floor, and with access to drinking water, electricity, and a sewage system.

He is majoring in history and is in his 2nd year out of 5. His most notable qualities are his love of reading, enthusiasm for past events, and passion for understanding the events that shaped periods in history. He tells us "I study and work. I distribute my time between both occupations and I feel happy with my achievements." Parallel to his studies, he works as a cameraman filming events like parties, birthdays, baptisms, etc. He conducts this business mostly during the weekend in the evenings which allows him to study the rest of the time. The advantage of his two occupations is that the schedules do not conflict with one another, but the disadvantage is the lack of money to buy a laptop for both. His dream is to finish his studies and pursue his professional career. He wishes to purchase a laptop in order to accomplish both occupations. 

This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in the 5 years he has been working and the 2 years that he has been going to school. It is for these reasons that Gabriel is requesting a loan to buy a laptop to edit films and to finish his studies.

loans.use: to buy a laptop to edit films and finish his studies

loans.name: Jaide David

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SANTA ROSITA DE AYLLUPAMPA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
El socio Jaide David tiene 33 años de edad tiene 02 hijos es conviviente, el socio alterna sus actividades diarias  dedicándose  a ser mecánico, el socio repara diferentes tipos de carros parea sus clientes que le solicitan, el socio es una persona responsable y empeñosa, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para comprar herramientas como martillos,aceite de carros.
El socio se siente agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Jaide David belongs to the communal bank, "Santa Rosita de Ayllupampa".  The bank is located in the district of Uruamba in the province of Urubamba in the region of Cusco.  

Jaide David is 33 years old and has two children.  He lives with the children's mother.  He alternates his daily activities and works as a mechanic.  He repairs different types of cars for his clients.  

He is a responsible and diligent person.  He hopes to be able to continue working at this to continue supporting his family.  

He is asking for the loan to purchase tools such as hammers and motor oil.  He is thankful for the loan and promises to complete the payments of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase tools.

loans.name: Urpi Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “URPI”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra.
