Elizabeth Nery ella es casada y tiene 41 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de editorial de graficos,la socia realiza trabajos como tarjetas de cumpleñaos,carteles entre otros trbajos,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de ditorial de graficos. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tintas de colores ,cartulinas y papeles.


Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de restaurant, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de fotocopiadora.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank “URPI.”  The group is located in the district, province and department of Cusco. 

Group member Elizabeth Nery is 41 and married.  She runs a printing business and makes birthday cards and posters.  She has been in business for several years and it is going very well.

Her dream is to expand her activity, so she is requesting a loan to buy colored inks, construction paper and stationery.

The other members are involved in a restaurant, clothing sales, a grocery store and a photocopy business.

Elizabeth Nery is grateful to everyone taking part in her dream and she is committed to making the loan payments on time.

loans.use: To buy colored inks, construction paper and stationery.

loans.name: Sumac Maki Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SUMAC MAKI”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Aydee ella es casada y tiene 26 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de crianza de cuyes,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere que sus hijos terminen de estudiar y que todos sus hijos salgan profesionales, la socia los cuyes los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes mercados, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de cuyes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y alimentos para los cuyes.


Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de artesanía, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Sumac Maki communal bank group. This bank is located in Cusco district, which belongs to Cusco province and Cusco department.

The member Aydee is married, is 26 years old, and has 1 child. She works in her business raising guinea pigs. Through this work, she wants her children to finish their schooling and that all of her children become professionals. She fattens the guinea pigs and raises them and later sells them in the various markets. She has a number of years of experience in this business and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand the business selling guinea pigs. She asks for the loan to purchase guinea pigs and guinea pig feed. 

The other members work in a business selling clothing, a business selling crafts, a grocery store business, and a restaurant business.

The members are grateful to those who are part of this dream through this platform and commit to making the payments on the established schedule.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs and guinea pig feed.

loans.name: Llankasun De Lares Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LLANKASUN DE LARES”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Lares, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Josefina ella es soltera y tiene 42 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.
La socia que esta tapada con un circulo su rostro no pertenece al banco comunal Llancasun de Lares

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de agricultura, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Llankasun de Lares communal bank group. This bank is located in the district of Lares, part of Calca province and Cusco department.

The member is Josefina. She is single, is 42 years old and has 1 child. She works in her restaurant business. She makes different dishes such as baked chicken, soups, and fried meat. She works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm. She has been in this business for some years and it is going very well for her.  The member's dream is to have a restaurant. She asks for the loan to purchase cooking products such as rice, vegetables, and chicken.
The woman with a white circle on her face is not a member of Llankasun De Lares Group.

The other members work in a business selling animals, an agricultural business, a grocery store business, and a food sales business. 

The member is grateful to those who are part of this dream through this platform and promises to make the payments on the established schedule.

loans.use: to purchase cooking supplies such as rice, vegetables, and chicken.

loans.name: Juan Leonardo

texts.es:
El socio  Juan Leonardo  se dedica al negocio de transporte, el socio tiene un carro que hace servicio de taxi, el socio trabaja 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño del socio es comprarse un carro nuevo. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar llantas para su carro.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Juan Leonardo earns a living through his transport business, he has a car that is used as a taxi service. He has been working in this business for 5 years and it is going very well for him. His dream is to buy a new car. He is asking for the loan to buy tyres for his car.

He is very happy with the loan and promises to make the repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy tyres for his car.

loans.name: Jesus Pan De Vida Group

texts.es: Gladys tiene 44 años de edad es conviviente con un hijo dependiente.  Ella implemento un pequeño bazar en un puesto de mercado que le dio su suegra en donde vende ropa cosméticos y productos de belleza. Años atrás trabajaba como docente. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería ropa y  productos naturales. Su mayor deseo es ampliar su negocio. el grupo “JESUS PAN DE VIDA” agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Gladys es la primera del lado izquierdo.
texts.en:
Gladys is 44 years old, and she is in a relationship and has a dependent son. She started a small shop in a stand in the market, which her mother-in-law gave her and where she sells clothing, cosmetics, and beauty products. Years before, she worked as a teacher.

The loan will be invested in buying more merchandise, including clothing and natural products. Her biggest dream is to grow her business. 

The “Jesus Pan de Vida” group is thankful for the Kiva lenders for the loan offered. Gladys is the first person from the left.

loans.use: to buy more clothing and natural products.

loans.name: Las Margaritas Group

texts.en:
Nahualá is a sprawling town in the Western Highlands of Guatemala, where 99% of the population speak their native Mayan language of Ki’che. Local townspeople translate the name Nahualá roughly as "enchanted waters" or "water of the spirits." The principal industries of the area include agriculture, commerce, handicrafts and traditional textile production. The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Las Margaritas” proudly represents their town and was formed by seven women who are about to receive their very first loan from Friendship Bridge. The majority of the women will use their loans in their traditional textile businesses making elaborate blouses called “huipiles” and woven wrap skirts called “cortes.”

Elsa is the 31-year-old enthusiastic Secretary of the Trust Bank. She is married and has one son. Elsa has a traditional textile business and buys and sells the typical skirts or “cortes” and thread. She will use her loan to buy additional “cortes” and a wide variety of thread so that the needs of her customers can be met. She wants to be certain to keep up with the changing styles and to offer her customers the beautiful clothing they desire.

The ladies of “Las Margaritas” meet monthly. Besides transacting business on their loans, they participate in educational seminars on a wide variety of subjects from women’s rights, health, hygiene and nutrition, as well as effective business tools. Friendship Bridge calls the effective combination of education and loans “Microcredit Plus.”  Thank you, Kiva investors, for your kindness and generosity in funding these much-needed loans for the women of “Las Margaritas”!

loans.use: To buy additional “cortes” and a wide variety of thread so that the needs of her customers can be met

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia es una mujer de 46 años de edad, soltera, tiene un hijo varón de 14 años y una hija mujer de 12 años, y su negocio es la venta de masitas y jugos.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, amable, constante, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la localidad de ‘Sacaba’ un área beneficiada por la belleza natural del valle, posee características que cautivan por su clima y atractivos turísticos. Situada a 13 kilómetros de la ciudad, a una altura que varía entre los 2600 y 4500 metros sobre el nivel del mar.
Antonia es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado por detrás, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Quechua que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba eléctrica. Su negocio es la venta de masitas y jugos en un puesto fijo de venta de lunes a sábado en horarios del día. Recientemente las conexiones de agua potable llegaron al lugar, y la familia esta con muchos deseos de contar con este servicio público, ya que el agua de pozo llega sucia con tierra y no es buena para el consumo, “mis hijos sueñan con tener el servicio de agua potable, venimos tomando agua sucia de pozo durante años…” comenta. La ventaja de su vivienda es que ya cuenta con agua potable en la zona, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para realizar la conexión hasta su vivienda. Su sueño es contar con agua potable en su hogar para el beneficio de sus hijos, ella desea realizar la instalación de agua potable en su cocina, baño y lavandería. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que vive en esa casa.
Es por esos motivos que Antonia solicita un préstamo para la instalación de agua potable en su cocina, baño y lavandería para que sus hijos dejen de beber agua sucia de pozo.
texts.en:
Antonia, 46, single and has a son aged 14 and a daughter aged 12. She makes a living selling pastries and juice drinks.

She is a good mother who is also enterprising, friendly, reliable, responsible and very hard-working.

She runs her business in Sacaba, an area which boasts a beautiful valley, has a wonderful climate and attracts many tourists. It is located 13 km from the city, at a height which varies between 2,600 and 4,500 m above sea level.

Antonia is dark skinned, has dark eyes and dark long hair which she ties back. She is short and quite well-built. Her native tongue is Quechua which she speaks with her family, but she also speaks Spanish for cultural reasons and for business.

She shares her life with her children who study at school. They live in their own house, made of bricks and cement, with a corrugated metal roof and a concrete floor. They have got electricity and they take their water from a well using an electric pump.

She runs a business selling pastries and juice drinks from a fixed stall, working Monday to Saturday during the daytime.

Recently, a fresh water supply has been installed in the area and her family would like very much to be able to enjoy this public service. Especially because the water from the well is dirty and is not good for drinking. She tells us that her children dream of having clean drinking water as they have been drinking dirty water from the well for years.

The advantage they have is that there is a freshwater supply in the area. The only problem is they have not got enough money to be able to connect the supply to their home.

She dreams of having this water supply in her home for her children to enjoy. She would like to have access to the water from the kitchen, bathroom and washroom.

This is her first cycle of loans with this organisation in the six years she has been living in this house. For these reasons Antonia is asking for a loan so that she can install drinking water in her kitchen, bathroom and washroom so her children do not have to drink dirty water from the well any more.

loans.use: to install drinking water in her home so her children do not have to do use dirty water from the well.

loans.name: Rosa Delia

texts.es:
Rosa, está mejorando su negocio con la ayuda de créditos y la buena administración de las ganancias, cuenta con clientes satisfechos y mayores ventas, su núcleo familiar continúa siendo el mismo y no ha tenido dificultades para seguir vendiendo comida y atendiendo la tienda.
Está solicitando un nuevo crédito para comprar verduras, condimentos, bebidas, especias, huevos, detergentes, lejía, aceite, granos básicos, etc., tendrá materia prima para la venta de comida y surtirá la tienda para que sus clientes continúen estando satisfechos.
texts.en:
Rosa is improving her business with the help of loans and the good management of the profits. She has satisfied customers and greater sales. Her nuclear family remains the same, and she has not had any difficulties to continue to sell food and attend the shop.

She is asking for a new loan to buy vegetables, condiments, drinks, sprices, eggs, detergents, bleach, oil, basic grains etc. She will have the raw materials for her sales of food and will stock the shop so that her customers continue to be satisfied.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, condiments, drinks, sprices, eggs, detergents, bleach, oil, basic grains etc. so she will have the raw materials for her sales of food and will stock the shop.

loans.name: Hermidez

texts.es:
Hermidez es un hombre de 50 años de edad, se dedica a la venta al por mayor de arepas, la arepa es un producto muy tradicional de la región antioqueña y que las familiar consumen diariamente en su desayuno. Hermidez trabaja solo, el mismo  las hace en un fogón de carbón y las distribuye a tiendas de toda la verada.
Hermidez quiere solicitar un préstamo pensando en la estabilidad y el crecimiento de su negocio, el cual invertirá en la compra de maíz que es el insumo principal del que está hecho este producto, para realizar dos mil arepas que es el pedido que tiene por estos días.
texts.en:
Hermidez is a 50-year-old man who works selling wholesale arepas. An arepa is a very traditional product of the Antioquia Region, eaten by families every day during their breakfasts. Hermidez works alone, making the arepas in a coal-fired oven and distributing them to stores throughout the village.

Hermidez wants to request a loan, thinking about the stability and growth of his business. He will invest it in the purchase of corn—the main ingredient from which this product is made—in order to make two thousand arepas, which is the order that he has these days.

loans.use: to purchase large quantities of corn for making arepas.

loans.name: Raymundo

texts.en:
Raymundo is 39 years old and has a grocery store that he opened more than five years ago. He is single and focuses his time on working. 

He is asking for a loan to buy products for his store. Raymundo likes to invest in his store. He has two refrigerators. He says that the store provides him with financial stability and he has been able to save some money to buy a car.

loans.use: To buy products for his grocery store.

loans.name: Eddy

texts.en:
Eddy is a baker. He is single, and he doesn't have children.

Eddy learned how to make bread as a child. His expenses include rent and the cost to take care of his parents, both of whom are retired. 

Eddy needs capital. He is requesting a loan in order to buy more flour for his bakery, as well as other inputs such as salt. He hopes you can help him. 

Eddy would like to have his own house in the future.

loans.use: to buy more flour and supplies for his bakery.

loans.name: Mi Dios Es Mi Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal mi Dios es mi fortaleza está conformada por  ocho integrantes seis  mujeres y dos  hombre, casados con hijos bajo su responsabilidad, son originarios de  Malpaisillo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región. Se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable con ganas de salir adelante, todos tiene diferentes actividades económicas  el cual es su medio de subsistencia y la de sus familias.
Gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante  la coordinadora es  Matilde y tiene por actividad económica la venta de artesanía desde hace diez años, en un lugar específico de la localidad, además vende por encargos a clientes fijos y eventuales productos típicos nacionales como. Jarrones,  ceniceros, adornos de barros, adornos de cocina, manualidades, trajes típicos, floreros, alcancillas etc. El  objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Mi Dios es mi fortaleza agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos  y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The Mi Dios es Mi Fortaleza communal bank group is made up of eight members, six women and two men, married with children in their responsibility. They are from Malpaisillo, a place that is located in the northern zone of the region. They are characterized as being hard-working, responsible and with desires to get ahead. They all have different work which is their means of survival and that of their families.

Thanks to her desire to get ahead, the coordinator is Matilde and she has as her business the sale of crafts for the past ten years, in a specific place in the area. In addition, she sells traditional national productions to order to regular and occasional customers such as large vases, ash trays, clay decorations, kitchen decorations, handicrafts, traditional clothing, vases, piggy banks, etc. The objective of the loan is to invest in working capital and to stock her business so that in a not-so-distant future she can get more income. Mi Dios es Mi Fortaleza is grateful for the help that the Kiva investors offer to people of limited resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua to have a respectable means of work.

loans.use: to purchase crafts such as large vases, ash trays, clay decorations, kitchen decorations, handicrafts, traditional clothing, vases, piggy banks, etc.

loans.name: G.s La Plaza Group

texts.es:
La señora Doris es una mujer muy trabajadora y dedicada a su negocio, cuenta con una tienda de ropa en una plaza comercial de la ciudad donde reside, su negocio lo administra personalmente hace más de 2 años y este se ubica en un punto estratégico donde el tránsito de personas a diario es alto.
Doña Doris sus principales clientes son los vecinos de su comunidad y personas que visitan la ciudad de diferentes aldeas y comunidades, el producto que vende es de un valor comercial bajo, por tal razón cuenta con mucha clientela,  está solicitando el apoyo del credito para la compra de mercadería como ser: blúmeres, braseares, calzoncillos, sandalias, cosméticos, achinería, etc.
Doña Doris sueña con poder expandir su negocio, para obtener las ganancias que le permitan salir adelante con su familia, solicita el préstamo de forma grupal con las siguientes personas.
Doña Leyda se dedica a la venta de ropa interior hace mas de 1 año.
Doña Bessy se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva hace más de año y medio. 


Danli, Honduras -  Abril del  2015
texts.en:
Doris is a very hardworking woman who is dedicated to her business.  She has a clothing store in a commercial plaza in the city where she lives.  It is strategically located in an area where many people go by.  She has run her business herself for more than two years.

Her main customers are her neighbors from the community and people who visit the city from various villages and communities.  The products she sells are low-cost, so she has a lot of customers.  She is asking for the support of a loan to buy merchandise such as underwear, bras, stockings, sandals, cosmetics, knickknacks, etc.

Doris dreams of being able to expand her business.  In order to get the earnings that allow her to get her family ahead, she is asking for a group loan with the following people:
Leyda has worked selling underwear for more than one year.
Bessy has worked selling new clothing for more than a year and a half.

Danli, Honduras - April 2015

loans.use: to buy underwear, bras, stockings, sandals, cosmetics, knickknacks, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Karen Alexandra

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Grupo de Crédito Amigas Solidarias, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.
En este lugar vive la señora Karen, tiene 24 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo de 5años de edad el cual estudia en escuela, ella vive en casa de la mamá.
Doña Karen es una joven mujer muy trabajadora que le ha tocado trabajar duro para salir adelante, ella junto a su familia se dedican a la agricultura, ellos en toda época del año siembran cebolla perla, pimiento, arroz, melón y otras frutas y verduras. De esta forma ellos logran salir adelante y aunque el trabajo es duro tienen que hacerlo por el bien de su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar urea y varios insecticidas que necesitan los cultivos. Esta desde el inicio en el grupo de crédito y le gusta por las ayuda que siempre le dan con los créditos. Sus sueños es darle lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
In the Crucita parish of the Portoviejo canton, the partners of the credit group Amigas Solidarias meet.  This locality is known for the beautiful beaches that surround this pretty place and are frequently visited by national and international tourists.  It is known as "Crucita the Beautiful".
Karen lives in this place.  She is 24 years old and the single mother of a five-year-old son who studies in school.  She lives in her mother's house.
Karen is a industrious young woman who has had to work very hard to get ahead.  She along with her family make a living in agriculture.  All year, they harvest pearl onion, pepper, rice, melon, and other fruits and vegetables.  In this way, they are able to forge ahead and, although the work is hard, they have to do it for the good of the family.
This loan is for buying urea and various insecticides that the crops need.  She has been in the credit group from the beginning and she likes it because of the help they give her with the loans.  Her dream is to give the best to her son.

loans.use: to buy urea and various insecticides.

loans.name: Delia Luzmila

texts.es: Delia es una mujer humilde tiene 24 años es soltera vive con su hijo en Chimbo provincia de Bolivar, Ella se dedica al comercia de zapatos y solicita el crédito para comprar mercaderia para asi tener variedad para que las personas le compren y obtener mayores ingresos para asi mejorar su calidad de vida ya que es madre soltera y solventar los gastos de su hijo, en su tiempo libre le gusta salir a caminar.
texts.en:
Delia is a humble woman of 24 years old. She is single and lives with her son in Chimbo in the Province of Bolivar. She works in shoe sales. She is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise so that she can have more variety of goods from which people can buy, and she obtain more income. This way, she can improve the quality of her life as well as to cover the costs of her son, since she is a single mother.

In her free time, she likes to go out to take a walk.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more water for her clients and expand her sachet water business.

loans.name: Celinda

texts.es: Doña Celinda es propietaria de una tienda de abarrotes, actividad de la que ha dependido ella  y su familia desde hace mucho años. Solicta un  préstamo de $250 . Este dinero lo usará en la compra de  mercancía para surtir su negocio y ofrecer un mejor servicio a su clientela.
texts.en:
Celinda is the owner of a grocery store. For many years, she and her family have depended on this work. 

She is requesting a loan of $250. She will use this money to buy merchandise in order to stock her business so that she can offer her customers a better service.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Lila

texts.en:
Lila is a married woman of 43 years from Falakata. She was deprived of education in her childhood, as her parents had lacked resources; she is able to sign her name only. Now she is a housewife, and her family comprises five members including her husband and three sons. They live in their small hut at the village of Parengerpar in Falakata. Her sons are also engaged in different small businesses.

Lila's husband is a farmer. He is a hardworking man who works from dawn to dusk to grow varieties of crops according to the seasonal demand; they sell the crops in the local market to earn money for their livelihood. Lila assists her husband after managing her household chores.

Now they have decided to grow tomatoes on their land, as it is a beneficial crop and also is in great demand all over India throughout the year. But, due to lack of capital, Lila is unable to cultivate this nutritious crop on her farmland. Thus, Lila requests a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase good-quality tomato seeds, fertilizers, manure, etc. so that her husband can grow good-quality tomatoes on their land.

Lila's hopes and dreams are to expand their agribusiness to give good financial support to the family and build a concrete house for their living.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva for the funding.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies for tomato cultivation.

loans.name: Mamoni

texts.en:
Mamoni is a young and enterprising woman of 24 years from a small village, Baganbari, in the district of Alipurduar. She is married and a mother of two daughters; one of them is studying in grade 2, and the other is an infant. Her husband Ratan is a car driver by profession.

Mamoni has been engaged with a milk supply business to give sustenance to her family. She finds this business enjoyable and profitable. She has a dairy cow. She supplies milk from door to door in her neighborhood. She also sells cattle byproducts like cow dung for additional income.

In order to increase her business and satisfy her customers’ demand, she needs to purchase one more cow. But the biggest challenge she faces is limited funds.

Mamoni is seeking a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS to buy a dairy cow. It will produce enough milk to supply and satisfy her customers’ demand; thus, she hopes to earn more profit. She expects this loan will give a boost to her business. She is grateful to her lenders for this financial support.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for her milk supply business.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.pt:
A Sra. Cecilia, tem 35 anos de idade, solteira, mãe de 04 filhos que frenquentam o ensino secundário e primário. Nao sustenta mais ninguem.
Com o empréstimo de 35,000.00 meticais, pretende comprar cervejas de diversas marcas, amendoim, arroz, açúcar, feijão e outros produtos da mercearia para revender.
O seu  sonho é abrir mais estabelecimentos comerciais na sua comunidade, prosperando assim no seu negócio. Ela enfrenta dificuldade de transportar para sua mercadoria, sendo assim, a aquisição de uma viatura seria útil para o crescimento do seu negócio.
texts.en:
Cecilia is 35 years old and single. She has four children who attend secondary and primary school. She doesn't support anyone else.
With the loan for 35,000 meticais she intends to purchase various brands of beer, peanuts, rice, sugar, beans and other groceries for re-selling.
Her dream is to open more stores within her community, therefore succeeding in her business. She struggles to transport her merchandise, which is why acquiring a vehicle would be useful for expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase various brands of beer, peanuts, rice, sugar, beans and other groceries for re-selling.

loans.name: Casimero

texts.en:
Casimero is 45 years old, married, and a father of four children. He wants to help his wife make a living; that's why he is engaged in a transport business to earn a living. He earns an income of P 3,000 a month from this business; that helps a lot for his family needs. 

He decided again to take a loan to pay for motor registration and able to continue to cater more passengers. 

Casimero wants to expand his business in the future and to sustain the education of his children.

loans.use: to pay for motor registration.

loans.name: Fualau

texts.en:
Fualau is a 36-year-old woman who is married with three children. She runs a business selling clothes in her community. She has three years of experience with this business. 

Fualau has requested a loan to buy materials, a sewing machine, needles, threads, etc. She plans to use her profits to improve her business. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy materials, a sewing machine, needles, threads

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bundles of used clothing for re-selling.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina es una mujer de 51 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos independientes de 23, 25 y 29 años de edad, y su negocio es la pastelería.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, constante, activa, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur de la ciudad, caracterizada por el área protegida ESPEJILLOS, conocida por su belleza natural, diversidad de especies, y condiciones óptimas para la práctica de deportes extremos,  forma parte obligatoria de la ruta del Turista ecológico, de clima sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Cristina es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado por detrás, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y debido al comercio en la ciudad. Su vida la realiza junto a su pareja que trabaja como transportista, sus hijos son independientes y no viven con ella. Viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo no cuenta con alcantarillado. Su negocio es la elaboración y venta de tortas; ella se encarga de la compra de harina, huevo, levadura, esencia de vainilla y demás ingredientes para elaborar tortas a diario, posteriormente se encarga de ofertarlo de manera ambulante a diferentes clientes continuos y casuales. “inicié mi negocio horneando masitas, y las cambié por tortas que son familiares y son igualmente populares…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que existe la costumbre comer un pedazo de torta a cualquier momento del día acompañado de cualquier bebida fría o caliente, La desventaja es la escases de harina y el mal funcionamiento de su horno, que después del uso constante se ha malogrado. Su sueño es tener una pastelería dónde poder exhibir varios tipos de tortas, ella desea expandir su negocio realizando la compra de un horno industrial y harina por mayor. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que desarrolla esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Cristina solicita un préstamo para la compra de un horno industrial y harina por mayor para abrir una pastelería.
texts.en:
Cristina is a 51 year-old married woman with three independent children who are 23, 25 and 29 years of age. Her business is pastry-making. She is enterprising, independent, persevering, active, responsible and very hardworking. She does business in the southern part of the city, characterized by the protected "Espejillos" area, which is known for its natural beauty, diversity of species and optimal conditions for the practice of extreme sports and is a mandatory part of the ecological tourist route. The climate is subtropical with daytime temperatures between 21 and 35 degrees Celsius. 

Cristina is dark-complexioned with brown eyes and long black hair which she wears tied back. She is of short stature with a robust physique and her maternal language is Guaraní, which is spoken in the area. She speaks Spanish because of the general culture and due to commerce in the city. She lives her life with her partner who works as a hauler. Her children are independent and do not live with her. They live in their own house constructed of brick and cement with a tin roof, a cement floor, and electricity and well water, but no sewage. 

Her business is the production and sale of cakes. She buys flour, eggs, yeast, vanilla extract and other ingredients in order to produce cakes daily. She then sells them as a street vendor to different repeat and casual customers. She says "I began my business baking cookies, and switched to cakes, which are familiar and equally popular." An advantage of her business is that it's customary to eat a piece of cake anytime of day accompanied by any cold or hot beverage. The disadvantage is the shortage of flour and the malfunction of her oven, which after constant use, has broken. 

Her dream is to have a cake shop where she can exhibit various types of cakes. She wishes to expand her business with the purchase of an industrial oven and wholesale flour. This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in five years of doing this work. It is for these reasons that Cristina is requesting a loan to purchase an industrial oven and wholesale flour in order to open a bakery.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial oven and wholesale flour in order to open a bakery.

loans.name: Qurbonoy

texts.en: Qurbonoy is a capable woman. She was born in the beautiful mountainous country of Tajikistan in 1973. She lives in her district in a small village. She is married and has four children. They have a big family and live happily. For almost 21 year she has worked at a secondary school. She is a teacher and well-known among teachers. It is hard to find a good job in Tajikistan. That is why her husband works abroad. He is trying to work hard and earn money to feed his family. Qurbonoy wants to help her husband and has asked for a loan from Kiva and IMON to buy a ticket for her husband to flight abroad. He will find a job and earn money for his family. She awaits your kindness and hopes her husband will earn enough money to feed their family.

loans.use: to buy a plane ticket for her husband

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina runs a beauty parlor. She offers services like hair rebonding, hair coloring, and foot spa services. She has been engaged in that kind of business for more than 10 years.  She is a 47-year-old married woman with three children ages 10, 9 and 4 years old, respectively. In order to sustain her livelihood, she decided to take a loan.

She is asking for a loan to purchase beauty parlor supplies like medicines for hair rebonding, hair coloring and foot spa services. With these, she can now continue to offer a variety of services. Thus, it will cause her to improve her services and her earnings will also increase. She can now support the needs of her children and provide better shelter to live in. 

Gina hopes that her existing business will expand and be more sustainable in the coming future.

loans.use: to purchase beauty parlor supplies like medicines for hair rebonding, hair coloring and foot spa services

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
This is Josefina. She previously accessed a Php 42,000 loan that was utilized in her mineral water business and she faithfully repaid the loan. 

This time, she would like to apply for another 45,000 PHP loan that she will use to purchase additional computer units needed in her piso net business which is also another source of her income. Piso Net is basically a merge of PC rental and Arcade rental services wherein customers can pay for the services by inserting coins to the machine. There is more need, now than before, for services like these as customers’ demand increases. 

Her main patrons are students, who require her services for school requirements. She also has people who need to rent computers for business purposes like writing a resume, and any office documentation, as well as people who would just love to surf the net and any social network. Her earnings were a big help for their personal, household and business expenditures. 

This will surely result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional computer units for her piso net business.

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en:
Edelyn works hard to support her family. Edelyn is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Edelyn has been in this business for nine years now. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina is 54-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. Her oldest child is 22 and the youngest is 18. 

Rizalina is a dealer of MSE products (direct selling) such as shoes, bags and beauty products like soap, lotion and many others. She has been engaged in that kind of business for more than 10 years.

Rizalina is asking for a loan to buy more supplies of MSE products like lotion and bags. With these, she would be able to cater to the needs of her customers. In this way, her income will improve. She could start expanding her business and continue to send her children to school.

Rizalina would like to expand her existing business for the welfare of her growing children and for sustainable living.

loans.use: to buy more supplies of MSE products such as lotion and bags

loans.name: Petro

texts.en:
Petro is married and has three children. He has been working as a maintenance manager at school for 12 years. He is a responsible and hardworking person. 

Petro, his wife, and his children live together with his parents. He has been building his own house. Petro is asking for a loan of 10,000 UAH to do construction work inside of his new house. He wants to hold the wiring, insulate the walls, and fill the floor with sand and gravel. The loan will help to take a step forward to his dream.

loans.use: to do construction work inside of his new house.

loans.name: Gina

texts.pt:
A Sra Gina tem 33 anos de idade, casada, mae de cinco filhos dos quais tres frequentam o ensino escolar e os dois nao tem idade escolar.
Com o empréstimo de 35.000,00 meticais, pretende comprar produtos da 1a necessidade tais como: óleo da cozinha, frangos , palonny, peixe, açúcar, refescos, cerveja para revender.
O seu  sonho é prosperar no seu negócio e comprar bens para a sua casa assim como a melhorar a dieta alimentar. O desafio é reembolso de empréstimo sem entrar em moras.
texts.en:
Gina is 33 years old and married. She has five children, three of whom are in school and two of them are below school age.
With the loan for 35,000 meticais she intends to purchase products that are household staples such as cooking oil, chicken, bologna, fish, sugar, refreshments, and beer for re-selling.
Her dream is to succeed in her business, buy goods for her house and also improve her diet. Her challenge is repaying the loan without delinquency.

loans.use: to purchase products that are household staples such as cooking oil, chicken, bologna, fish, sugar, refreshments, and beer for re-selling.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is 33 years old. She is married with 7 children. Her youngest child is 1 year old while her eldest is 12. 

Together with her husband, Cheryl works hard at their fishing business in order to provide for their family. She helps with the selling of her husband's catch, and she also buy and sells shrimp from other fishermen. Her business started when she had her family. 

Cheryl is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP in order to buy a new engine. She hopes that with a new engine, they will be able to increase their catch and provide a better living for their family. 

Cheryl's income goes towards food, school fees, and reinvesting in their business.

loans.use: to buy an engine for their fishing boat.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
This is Erlinda. She sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan had enhanced her business. She was able to buy spare parts and accessories for their vehicle. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will let her borrow again an amount of 51,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional supplies of accessories and spare parts of their jeepney. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family if the unit is regularly maintained and in good condition.

Erlinda wants to buy two additional units of jeepney for her transportation service. She only dreams to give her children a good life by supporting their educational needs. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies of spare parts and accessories of her jeepney.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with seven children.

She runs a buy-and-sell nipa roofing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of nipa roofing to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like fishing.

Nenita dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of nipa roofing to sell.

loans.name: Sonel

texts.en:
Sonel is 32 years old and a father of two, ages 5 and 2. He and his family live in the southeastern part of the country, where he’s been doing animal husbandry and agriculture for a living.

In the photograph, Sonel is seen at the agricultural land that he owns. He plants and sells dried beans and fresh tomatoes in large quantities, and also has plum trees and sells their fruits.

The reason for applying for a loan from you is that he wants to buy very young dairy cows and baby calves to raise and then sell. Except practicing his own activity, he works for a pay of $195/month for a nearby water supplier.

loans.use: to buy some very young cows and calves to raise and then sell.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 25-year-old married man from Jenin city. Mohammad's family has an agricultural farm where all of them cooperate together in the work. They plant seasonal crops and sell it in the local market. Mohammad would like to be independent and start his own business in the same field.
Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to prepare a new piece of land for planting. This will help him to increase the family income and be independent.
Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more wheat and barley seeds for his land.

loans.name: Mesepa

texts.en: A loan amount of $3000 ST will help Mesepa to buy a sack of flour, vegetable oil, fry pan, gas stove, container, yeast, chicken, to help her run the business of baking buns, chicken,pancake at the market. Mesepa is a 66-year-old mother but still fit and strong to operate her business with the assistance of her five children. Mesepa will use her profit to build a bakery store in the near future. She joined SPBD in 2004.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, vegetable oil, fry pan, gas stove, container, yeast, and chicken

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.en: The member belongs to the "LAS MERCEDES DE KATAÑIRAY" communal bank. He works offering taxi service. He is a responsible and diligent person. He wants to continue to work and in this way continue to support his family. He is requesting the loan to have maintenance done on his car. He is grateful for the awarded loan and promises to comply with the established installments.

loans.use: to do maintenance on his vehicle.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en: Mario is 54 years old and married. He lives in Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur, with his family. For the past two decades, Mario has been a farmer. This is how he raised and sustained his family. Recently, Mario is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer and herbicides to have a good and higher crop yield on his rice farm. In the future, he hopes to expand and improve his business to sufficiently provide for his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and herbicides to have a good and higher crop yield on his rice farm.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La socia Julia se dedicaal negocio de venta de zapatos, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de zapatos. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar zapatos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Julia has a business selling shoes. Through this business she supports herself. She dreams of expanding her business. Julia seeks a loan to buy shoes. She is happy to receive the loan and promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Jaya Usaha Baluk Group

texts.en:
Managing two types of businesses, farms and pigs, has proven to provide more income for the families, particularly for Ni Nengah. She planted soybeans in an area of 60 acres. She also maintains four pigs. Gains on the sale of soybeans and pigs were used for working capital and savings. Ni Nengah is very grateful for the results she got. All members of the Jaya Usaha Baluk group also received satisfactory results, and they agreed to continue borrowing to increase the businesses.

Ni Nengah will use the loan to buy paddy and soybean seeds. Now she and her husband cultivate paddy as a new business. She hopes that all her efforts run well and bring prosperity for the entire family. One member of the group could not attend due to illness.

loans.use: to buy paddy and soybean seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chickens, pigs, feed, and wood for her business and support her husband with the carpentry.

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

She supplements this income with earnings from her general store and farming sugarcane.

Consolacion dreams that one day, she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 45 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Mary Jane has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Mary Jane is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feeds.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feeds

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 50 years old and married with six children, four of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional household goods to sell.

Corazon has been in this business for 11 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional household goods to sell

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is a hardworking mother from Oroquieta. She is 59 years old and a businesswoman who makes copra. She buys whole coconuts for this. 

Magdalena has signed her membership with the cooperative to gain access to insurance and credit. She applied for a loan to buy whole coconuts for making copra. Magdalena hopes to succeed in this business to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy whole coconuts to make copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production)

loans.name: Abraham

texts.es: Don Abraham es propietario de una Ferretería y venta de Materiales de construcción. Solicita un préstamo de $250 para  surtir su negocio y brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes e incrementar de esta manera sus ganancias.
texts.en: Abraham is the owner of a hardware store and he sells construction materials. He seeks a loan of $250 to stock his business and provide a good service to his customer, thus increasing his profits.

loans.use: to buy items to stock his hardware store.

loans.name: Raul Alexander

texts.es:
El socio Raul Alexander se dedica al negocio de farmacia,el socio vende medicamentos,el socio trabaja en la farmacia desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 3:00 p.m,el socio por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante y le va muy bien,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de farmacia.El socio solicita el credito para comprar medicamentos para la farmacia.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member Raul Alexander works in the pharmacy business. He sells medicines. He works in the pharmacy from 8 in the morning until 3 in the afternoon. He wants to get by with this business and it is going very well for him. His dream is to grow his pharmacy business. He is requesting a loan to buy medicines for the pharmacy. This member is happy for the loan and promises to make all of his payments.

loans.use: buy medicines for the pharmacy.

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza is married and she works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Annaliza is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy an additional storage box for her fish.

Annaliza has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF and more recently, through loans from Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy an additional storage box for her fish.

loans.name: Hadiye

texts.en:
Hadiye is married and the mother of two children. 

When her husband retired, they bought a garden in a village. At first they planned to grow vegetables just for themselves there. Then, on the advice of their friends, they went into a bee business. They began this work with limited options. Hadiye used her first loan from Maya to buy sugar and and honeycomb to get their bees through the winter. She’ll use the second loan to increase the number of hives. She’ll repay the loan with the money she makes selling honey to her neighbors. She wants to start a bee farm in the future.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff

Hadiye Hanım evli ve iki çocuk annesi. Eşi emekli olduktan sonra yaşadığı şehrin bir köyünden bahçe satın almışlar. Burada önce kendilerine sebze yetiştirmeyi düşünmüşler. Daha sonra bir arkadaşlarının tavsiyesiyle arıcılık işine girmişler. Kısıtlı imkânlarla bu işe başlamışlar. Hadiye Hanım Maya’dan kullandığı ilk kredisi ile kışın arıların aç kalmaması için şeker ve petek aldı. İkinci kredisi ile arı kovanlarının sayısını artırdı. Çevresine bal satışı yaparak kredisini ödüyor. Gelecekte arı çiftliği kurmak istiyor.

loans.use: to increase the number of hives.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 43 years old, married and has one child in school.

She is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Marlyn requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Marlyn has been raising pig for five years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.pt:
O Sr Manuel, tem 61 anos de idade, casado,  pai de quatro filhos maiores de idade. Destes, um é que está ainda sob sua responsabilidade.
Tem um estaleiro de venda de material de construção e barco de pesca e, com o empréstimo de 20.000,00 meticais, pretende comprar cimento, pedra, area para fabricar blocos para revenda, visto que na sua comunidade está em expansão e há muitas construções.
Tem uma mercearia já construida e sonha em investir nela, porém, não tem fundos monetários para arrancar e o seu desafio é trabalhar de modo a abrir a sua mercearia
texts.en:
Manuel is 61 years old and married. He has four adult children. One of his sons is still under his responsibility.
He owns a yard where he sells construction supplies and fishing boats. With the loan for 20,000 meticais he intends to purchase cement, rocks and sand in order to make bricks for re-selling. His community is expanding and there are a lot of construction sites.
He has already built his own grocery store and dreams of investing in it. However, he doesn't have start-up capital, and his challenge is working towards opening his grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase cement, rocks and sand in order to make bricks for re-selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase chicken, refreshments, tomatoes and onions to stock her business.

loans.name: Maria Jose

texts.es:
Maria es una joven mujer de 25 años de edad, casada, sin hijos, y estudia la carrera de contaduría general. 
Ella es inteligente, responsable, comprometida, constante, dulce, cariñosa, sensible y sincera. Sus estudios lo realiza en una de las casas de estudios superiores más prestigiosas del país, situada en el centro de la ciudad que alberga a edificios multifamiliares y de empresas públicas y privadas. De clima frio y seco, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Maria es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo peinado a la moda, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará el cual ya no habla porque estudia y vive en la ciudad. Su vida la realiza junto a su pareja que trabaja como comerciante, viven en un departamento alquilado construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con los servicios de energía eléctrica, agua potable y alcantarillado. Ella estudia la carrera de contabilidad general y se encuentra en 3 año de 5 años que dura la carrera. Ella se inclina a la crítica constructiva y la investigación científica y técnica, es hábil para analizar, sintetizar e innovar y para trabajar en equipo, disfruta ayudando a las personas, le gusta relacionarse con sus compañeros de trabajo, su carácter es de servicio. “trabajo como cajera en un banco conocido, para ascender de cargo necesito continuar estudiando…” comenta. Paralelamente a sus estudios ella trabaja como cajera de banco de lunes a sábado en horario de oficina. La ventaja de sus actividades es que no se cruzan los horarios, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para el pago de las cuotas de la universidad. Su sueño es ser profesional para conseguir un mejor cargo y formar una familia, ella desea pagar las cuotas de su carrera para continuar estudiando. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que se dedica al estudio profesional y trabajo. 
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para pagar las cuotas de sus estudios, terminar su carrera profesional y ascender de cargo en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Maria is a 25 year old young woman, married, no children, who is studying general accounting. She is intelligent, responsible, dedicated, reliable, sweet, caring, sensible and sincere. She studies in her country's most prestigious university, located in the center of a city that is home to many multifamily complexes and public and private businesses. This area has a cold and dry climate, with a temperature that varies during the day from 0-12 degrees centigrade. Maria has a dark complexion, brown eyes, long black stylish hair, short, thin, and her first language is Aymara, which she doesn't speak now because she studies and lives in the city.

Her husband work as a businessman. they live in a rented apartment made of brick and cement, with a laminate roof, wooden floor, and has electricity, potable water, and electricity. She is entering the 3rd year of her 5 year course of study. she enjoys constructive criticism and technical and scientific investigation. She has ability to analyze, synthesize, and innovate as well as work in a team. She enjoys helping others, and gets along with her work companions. "I work as a cashier in a well-known bank, and in order to obtain a job I need to keep studying...", she shares. Along with her studies she works as a teller in a bank Monday through Saturday during normal office hours. The advantage of this work is that the hours don't interfere with her studies. The disadvantage is the lack of money to pay her university bills.

Her dream is to be a professional in order to get a better job and have a family. She wishes to pay her university bills in order to continue studying. This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in 3 years that she has been studying and working. For these reasons Maria seeks a loan to pay her school tuition, finish her professional studies and get a job.

loans.use: to pay her school tuition, finish her professional studies and get a job.

loans.name: Daysi Marilu

texts.es:
Daysi, ha tenido mejores cosechas de maíz y pipían con la ayuda del crédito anterior, también dice continuar vendiendo verduras en el mercado, cuenta con estabilidad económica y está saludable para seguir trabajando.
Requiere de un nuevo crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas y pagar los costos de preparación de 2 manzanas de tierra para sembrar maíz, espera tener resultados positivos y resarcir su nueva deuda.
texts.en:
Daysi has had better corn and squash harvests with the help of her previous loan. She continues selling her vegetables at the market, and she counts on economic stability and good health in order to continue working.

She is requesting a new loan to buy agricultural supplies and to cover the costs of preparing two acres of land for planting corn. She hopes to have positive results and to repay her new loan.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to cover the costs of preparing two acres of land for planting corn.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.pt:
A Sra Ofélia tem 36 anos de idade, solteira, mãe de cinco filhos dos quais três estão na responsabilidade do seu pai e dois estão na sua responsabilidade.
Tem mercearia na sua casa e, com o empréstimo de 40.000,00 meticais, pretende comprar cerveja de diversas marcas, refrescos, arroz, peixe e outros produtos da mercearia.
Seu sonho é prosperar nos seus negócios e a dificuldade que enfrenta é de transportar a mercadoria devido a falta de transporte pessoal.
texts.en:
Ofélia is 36 years old and single. She has five children, three of whom are under their father's care and two are under her responsibility.
She owns a grocery store at her house. With the loan for 40,000 meticais she intends to purchase various brands of beer, refreshments, rice, fish and other groceries.
Her dream is to succeed in her business. The struggle she faces is transporting her merchandise, since she doesn't have a means of personal transportation.

loans.use: to purchase various brands of beer, refreshments, rice, fish and other groceries.

loans.name: Annan

texts.en: Annan is 43 years old and lives together with his wife. He is a fisherman by profession. Last season, Annan started cultivating rice on a land of four hectares. He made profits and wants to continue planting rice. With the profits, he could expand his areas. Annan wants to buy his own clip sack spraying machine to spray pesticides on time. For this, he needs a loan of SRD 2000.

loans.use: to buy a clip sack spraying machine.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.pt:
O sr Pedro tem 34 anos de idade, casado pai de uma filha menor de idade. Para além da sua filha que está na sua responsabilidade, sustenta também os seus pais e irmãos.
Com o empréstimo de 15.000,00 meticais, pretende comprar material de construção, tais como: pedra, varrões, blocos, barrotes para dar a continuidade da sua obra.
Seu sonho é concluir a sua casa para acomodar a sua familia e o desfio é reembolsar o empréstimo
texts.en:
Pedro is 34 years old and married. He has an underage daughter. Aside from his daughter who's under his care, he also supports his parents and siblings.
With the loan for 15,000 meticais he intends to purchase construction supplies such as rocks, rods and beams so he can continue his construction work.
His dream is to finish his house in order to provide comfort for his family. His challenge is repaying the loan.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies such as rocks, rods and beams so he can continue his construction work.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.pt:
Sra Sónia tem 32 anos de idade, solteira, mãe de três filhos que frequentam o ensino primário. Vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Tem uma mercearia no mercado perto da sua casa e com o empréstimo de 30.000,00 meticais, pretende comprar produtos da 1a necessidade tais como: óleo da cozinha, frangos, palonny, peixe, arroz, refrescos e outros para revender.
Seu sonho é ser empeendedora de renome e neste momento enfrenta dificuldades financeiras. O seu desafio é reembolsar o empréstimo sem entrar em moras
texts.en:
Sónia is 32 years old and single. She has three children who are in primary school. She lives in a house that she owns and doesn't support anyone else.
She owns a grocery store at the market near her home. With the loan for 30,000 meticais she intends to purchase household staples such as cooking oil, chicken, bologna, fish, rice, refreshments and other products for re-selling.
Her dream is to be a renowned entrepreneur. Right now she faces financial struggles. Her challenge is repaying the loan without delinquency.

loans.use: to purchase household staples such as cooking oil, chicken, bologna, fish, rice, refreshments and other products for re-selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, metal plates, planks, wire and sand so that he can continue building his house.

loans.name: Pramila

texts.en:
Pramila lives in a small village of Alipurduar. She is 36 years old and a hard-working mother of two children (one son and one daughter). One of them reads in grade 3, and the other one is in grade 1. She is a homemaker. Her husband's occupation is farming, and he works hard to meet the family needs. Pramila knows the value of education in life to overcome financial hurdles, so she wants to provide better education to her children.

Pramila's husband cultivates beans, gourds, cabbages, peas, and other seasonal vegetables to sustain his family. Pramila also helps her husband in cultivation during busy seasons. The crops he grows are sold in the market, which is the main source of income for the family. By doing this, he generates income that is spent in paying household and educational expenses. He plays an important role in meeting his family's needs.

Now he wants to grow teasel gourd, which is fully a summer crop. She wants to get a huge profit from the cultivation of this crop in the forthcoming summer season, so he wants to buy farm supplies. 

To help her husband in their family run agribusiness, she applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS. The loan money will be used to purchase necessary farm supplies for teasel gourd cultivation. 

She and her husband are thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: to pay for agricultural inputs for teasel gourd cultivation.

loans.name: It Is The Lord Group

texts.en:
Abena is 45 years of age. She is from Mankessim in the Mfantseman District of the Central Region of Ghana. She is a member of “It Is the Lord group”. She is married with three children. Their ages are 15, 23 and 25 years old. All the children are in school. Her husband is a businessman who also does rental services to support her financially. Abena is a trader who sells rice, groundnuts, soya beans and gallons of oil. She has 26 years trading experience. She started trading after an early exit from her first cycle of education. She has three employees.

Abena and her group have been with the field partner since 2009 with good repayment records for all their past 11 loan cycles. For the passion she has for the business, Abena wants to expand her business in the next five years and also provide better service to her customers. Trading has been good all the years for Abena and she was able to provide for the needs of the family. Abena wanted another microloan to enable her to buy more goods to restock her shop so that she can meet her customers' demands on time to increase her income. She planned to use the income to support her family. Abena thanks all her microlenders for their kind support.

loans.use: To restock her shop

loans.name: Belmiro

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Província de Gaza tem 32 anos de idade, vive maritalmente, pai de 2 filhos menores de idade, responsabiliza-se pelos seus pais que encontram-se em Manjacaze enviando lhes dinheiro mensalmente.
É proprietário de um estabelecimento comercial de venda de produtos da 1ª necessidade onde valor que ganha aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Solicitou o empréstimo para aumentar o volume do seu negócio adquirindo mercadoria como: açúcar, feijão e sal. Este é o seu 7º empréstimo na Hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende adquirir uma viatura. O seu maior desafio é manter o seu negócio para sustento de crédito.
texts.en:
Belmiro comes from the province of Gaza. He's 32 years old and married. He has two underage children and supports his parents who live in Manjacaze by sending them money on a monthly basis.
He owns a store where he sells household staples. He spends his earnings on household expenses.
He requested this loan in order to increase turnover in his business by purchasing merchandise such as sugar, beans and salt. This is his 7th loan with Hluvuku.
In the future he intends to acquire a vehicle. His biggest challenge is keeping his business afloat so he can repay the loan.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, beans and salt.

loans.name: Ana

texts.pt:
Nasceu na província de Maputo tem 46 anos de idade, solteira, mãe de 4 filhos maiores de idade, não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
É comerciante a mais de 5 anos onde com o valor que  ganha aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Solicita um empréstimo para aumentar o volume do seu negócio adquirindo fardos de roupa usada para venda no mercado informal. Este é o seu 7º empréstimo na Hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende erguer uma capoeira para a criação de frangos
texts.en:
Ana comes from the province of Maputo. She's 46 years old and single. She has four adult children and she isn't responsible for anyone.
She has been a vendor for over five years. She spends her earnings on household expenses. She requests a loan in order to increase turnover in her business by purchasing bundles of used clothing for selling in the informal market. This is her 7th loan with Hluvuku.
In the future she intends to set up a coop for breeding chickens.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of used clothing to sell in the informal market.

loans.name: Dinora Elizabeth

texts.es:
Dinora, está satisfecha por el impacto positivo que ha tenido al invertir el crédito anterior en su negocio, logro atraer nuevos clientes, tener mayores ventas y mejores ingresos.
Está decidida a solicitar otro crédito para comprar pantalones, trajes para niños/as, faldas, camisas, blusas y otras prendas de vestir, así mismo invertirá en artículos plásticos y granos básicos que le ayudaran a tener un negocio más surtido, espera seguir trabajando para salía adelante.
texts.en: Dinora is satisfied with the .positive impact she had investing the past loan in her business. She managed to attract new clients, have more sales and better income. She has decided to request another loan to buy pants, suits for children, skirts, shirts, blouses and other clothing and also invest in plastic goods and basic grains. This will help her have a better stocked business. She hopes to continue working to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy pants, suits for children, skirts, shirts, blouses and other clothing and also invest in plastic goods and basic grains.

loans.name: Sharathi

texts.en:
Sharathi is a 41-year-old lady who lives with her husband, Niranjan, and three school-going children (two sons and one daughter) in a small village of Alipurduar. Her husband is a rickshaw puller and works tirelessly to fulfill every need of her family members.

But in this era of price hikes, one individual’s income is not sufficient to fulfill all the needs of a family. So, Sharathi is also involved with a garment business to give financial support to her household. She buys varieties of garments like saris, salwar pieces, shirts, pants, scarves, etc., according to the seasonal demand from the wholesale market, and sells them door to door in her neighborhood. Now she needs to buy more stock of clothing to expand the business.

For that reason, Sharathi applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS to buy stock of varieties of clothing to meet her customers' demand. She hopes this loan will give a boost to her business. The profits generated from her business will help her to provide continuous education to her children and fulfill the needs of the family. 

Her dream is to build a shop of her own in the local market in order to expand the business because it is a very profitable business in their locality.

Sharathi is very much grateful to BJS and Kiva, as well.

loans.use: to buy stock of clothing to expand her existing business.

loans.name: Mampi

texts.en:
Mampi is a young entrepreneur of only 22 years and a mother of one toddler. She lives with her family in a small village, Sobhagunj in Alipurduar district.  Mampi’s husband, Tapan, is an auto driver. In spite of his tireless work, his income does not provide the family with a good lifestyle, and he is unable to cover all the household expenses. 

Mampi decided to start her own bag manufacturing business in order to serve her family better. She runs the business from her house. She buys fabrics and other materials from the market and stiches the bags and sells them in the local market, as well as in her neighborhood. Mampi stitches varieties of bags like market bags, school bags, ladies' bags, etc. 

Self-confident Mampi has successfully penetrated the male-dominated business world. There is a great demand for her products (bags) in the market. She is determined to succeed despite many challenges, and the greatest of them is capital. So, she has asked for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to overcome the problems. She wants to purchase more raw materials for her business, such as leather, cloth, gum, yarn, handles, buttons and other necessary items, with the loan for that purpose. She hopes the loan will enable her to reach her goal to build up a bag manufacturing factory in the future.

Mampi thanks her lenders (BJS and Kiva) for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her existing bag manufacturing business.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Província de Maputo, tem 40 anos de idade, vive maritalmente, mãe de 6 filhos que frequentam a escola, responsabiliza-se pelos seus pais que encontram-se em Chidenguele. 
É negociante há bastante tempo, proprietária de um estabelecimento comercial. Solicita o empréstimo para aumentar o volume do seu negócio de venda de produtos da 1ª necessidade adquirindo mercadoria como: amendoim, arroz, feijão e muito mais. Este é o seu 5º empréstimo na hluvuku, sendo que os últimos 3 foram aplicados para mesma actividade.
Futuramente pretende ampliar o seu negócio e adquirir uma viatura. O seu maior desáfio é manter o seu negócio sustentável.
texts.en:
Fatima comes from the province of Maputo. She's 40 years old and married. She has six children who are in school. She supports her parents who live in Chidenguele.
She has been a vendor for a long time and owns a store. She requests the loan in order to increase turnover in her business of selling products that are household staples. She'll purchase merchandise such as peanuts, rice, beans and much more. This is her 5th loan with Hluvuku, and the previous three loans were used in the same business.
In the future she intends to expand her business and acquire a vehicle. Her biggest challenge is keeping her business afloat.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts, rice, beans and much more.

loans.name: Gil

texts.pt:
Nasceu de Maputo tem 43 anos de idade, vive na casa própria com a sua família é pai de 2 filhos menores de idade que frequentam a escola, não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
É criador de frangos a mais de 6 anos, onde ganha um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Solicita o empréstimo para aumentar o volume do seu negócio de criação de frangos adquirindo pintos, ração e vitaminas. Este é o seu 5º empréstimo na Hluvuku, sendo que os últimos foram usados para a mesma finalidade. Futuramente pretende ampliar o volume do seu negócio e iniciar um outro de criação de gado bovino.
 O seu maior desafio é manter o seu negócio para conseguir pagar o seu empréstimo e sustentar a família.
texts.en:
Gil comes from Maputo. He's 43 years old and lives with his family in a house that he owns. He has two underage children who are in school. He's not responsible for anyone.
He has been a chicken farmer for over six years. He earns an income which he uses for household expenses. He requests the loan in order to increase turnover in his business by purchasing chicks, feed and vitamins. This is his 5th loan with Hluvuku, and the previous loans were used for the same purpose. In the future he intends to expand his business and start another one raising cattle.
His biggest challenge is keeping his business afloat so that he can repay the loan and support his family.

loans.use: to purchase chicks, feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Andrey

texts.en:
Andrey is married and has one daughter. He works as a security guard. Andrey is a sincere, hardworking and responsible young man. He wants to improve his family's living conditions. 

Andrey is asking for a loan of 40,000 UAH to do renovation in the bathroom. He plans to install a new bath, sink and plumbing system. Also, Andrey wants to change the doors in the bathroom and balcony.

loans.use: to do renovation in the bathroom

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is married and has one son. He sells men's shoes and clothes at the market. Alexander is an active and hardworking young man.

Alexander is asking for a loan of 30,000 UAH to renovate two rooms in his house. He wants to insulate the floor and walls. After that, Alexander plans to paint the walls and put parquet on the floor.

The loan will help to improve his family’s living conditions as well as save on heating due to good insulation.

loans.use: to renovate two rooms in his house.

loans.name: Rina

texts.en:
Rina is a 27-year-old lady. She lives with her husband and one daughter in the village of Sobhagunj in Alipurduar of West Bengal. Rina studied up to grade 10. She sends her daughter to school so that her daughter can lead a decent life with a good education. 

Rina's husband, Bhuben, is an auto driver. He offers transportation service in the village and nearby village using his three-wheeled auto rickshaw in order to make a living. He carries people from one place to another. He has been involved in this business for many years. Now the auto has been damaged in an accident and needs maintenance. He wants to repair it as soon as possible as it is the main income-generating source for their family.

As a responsible wife, Rina decided to help her husband and applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to cover the cost of repairing the auto rickshaw. Rita hopes that with the help of this loan, her husband can repair the auto and can provide better transport facilities to the village people, and thus, can earn a lucrative income. 

Rina and her husband are very much happy after getting the loan and are thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for the repair cost of her husband’s auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Helena

texts.pt:
Nasceu na província de Gaza tem 48 anos de idade, vive maritalmente, mãe de 1 filho maior de idade que frequenta a escola, responsabiliza-se pelos seus 3 netos que vivem em sua casa.
É proprietária de uma banca no mercado local onde vende produtos da 1ª necessidade, o valor que ganha aplica nas despesas da sua casa.  Solicita o empréstimo para aumentar o volume do seu negócio adquirindo mercadoria como: açúcar, feijão, amendoim e mais. Este é o seu 8º empréstimo na Hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende erguer uma obra para os seus netos e adquirir uma camioneta para escoamento dos seus produtos
texts.en:
Helena comes from the province of Gaza. She's 48 years old and married. She has an adult son who's in school. She's responsible for her three grandchildren who live with her.
She owns a booth at the local market where she sells products that are household staples. She spends her earnings on household expenses.
