She requests the loan in order to increase turnover in her business by purchasing merchandise such as sugar, beans, peanuts, etc. This is her 8th loan with Hluvuku.
In the future she intends to build a room for her grandchildren and buy a truck for carrying her merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, beans, peanuts, etc.

loans.name: Jochua

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Província de Inhambane tem 50 anos de idade, viúvo pai de 5 filhos maiores de idades, responsabiliza-se pelo seu sobrinho que vive em sua casa.
É avicultor a mais de 11 anos onde ganha um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Solicita o empréstimo para aumentar o volume do seu negócio de criação de frangos adquirindo pintos, ração e vitaminas. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo na Hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende expandir mais no seu negócio de criação de frangos para se tornar num grande avicultor ao nível do distrito.
texts.en:
Jochua comes from the province of Inhambane. He's 50 years old and a widower. He has five adult children and takes care of his nephew who lives with him.
He has been a poultry farmer for over 11 years. He earns an income which he spends on household expenses. He requests the loan in order to increase turnover in his chicken breeding business by purchasing chicks, feed and vitamins. This is his third loan with Hluvuku.
In the future he intends to further expand his chicken farm so that he can become a renowned poultry farmer within his district.

loans.use: to purchase chicks, feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Salome

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Xai-Xai Província de Gaza tem 50 anos de idade solteira mãe de 2 filhas maiores de idade, responsabiliza-se pelos seus 5 netos dos quais 3 vivem em sua casa.
Trabalha como jardineira a mais de 9 anos onde ganha um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Solicita um empréstimo para dar continuidade a sua obra de residência adquirindo material de construção como areia, cimento, chapas e barrotes. Este é o seu 11º empréstimo na Hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende garantir o ensino dos seus netos e expandir mais no seu negócio.
texts.en:
Salome comes from Xai-Xai, province of Gaza. She's 50 years old and single. She has two adult daughters and she's responsible for her five grandchildren, three of whom live with her.
She has worked as a gardener for over nine years. She earns an income which she spends on household expenses. She requests a loan so that she can continue building her house by purchasing construction supplies such as sand, cement, metal plates and beams. This is her 11th loan with Hluvuku.
In the future she intends to provide her grandchildren with an education and further expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, metal plates and beams.

loans.name: Adyenis Maricín

texts.es: Desde hace 15 años doña Adyenis se dedica a la cría, engorde y venta de pollos. De esta manera ha apoyado a su esposo e hijos para salir adelante. Con un préstamo de $500 comprará materiales para mejorar la estructura de la galera donde cria sus pollos, pretende  incrementar sus ventas y ganancias familiares.
texts.en:
Adyenis has been making a living raising and selling chickens for the last fifteen years. In this way she has supported her husband and children in their lives. 

With a loan of $500 Adyenis will buy materials to improve the chicken coop where she raises chickens, her goal is to increase her sales and thus the family earnings.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a chicken coop

loans.name: Sabino

texts.pt:
Nasceu na provincia de Maputo tem 23 anos de idade, vive maritalmente pai 2 filhos menores de idade, responsabiliza-se pelo seu irmão e sobrinha que vive em sua casa.
Trabalha como segurança a mais de 4 anos onde aufere um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Com o fundo próprio enfrentava varias dificuldades para dar continuidade com a sua obra de residência, pelo que solicita o empréstimo para adquirir material de construção como: areia, chapas, cimento. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo na Hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende garantir a formação da sua esposa e também dar continuidade com os seus estudos até ao nível superior.
texts.en:
Sabino comes from the province of Maputo. He's 23 years old and married. He has two underage children and he's responsible for his brother and niece who live with him.
He has worked as a security guard for over four years. He earns an income which he spends on household expenses. He was struggling to continue building his house on his own funds alone, which is why he requests the loan in order to purchase construction supplies such as sand, metal plates and cement. This is his first loan with Hluvuku.
In the future he intends to provide his wife with a professional degree and also continue his studies up to a higher education.

loans.use: to purchase sand, metal plates and cement.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha, tiene la edad  de 31 años, está soltera, vive con sus padres y hermanos, los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de una vaca con buenas condiciones para la producción de leche y que pueda tener terneros al destete con un buen desarrollo y con cualidades para el engorde. La idea es aprovechar el espacio que tiene de pasto y las buenas condiciones de terreno y clima para poder tener este animal y a la vez obtener leche y desarrollar terneros para en el futuro venderlos para carne. Con esta compra podrá desarrollar una actividad más, y a la vez tener un ahorro que le permitirá ir teniendo más animales e invertir más en la propiedad.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Martha is 31 years old, single, and lives with her parents and siblings, who are her highest priority. With her loan she hopes to buy a cow in good condition for milk production, one that could have calves after weaning, well developed and that could fatten up. The idea is to take advantage of the space she has for grazing and the good conditions of the land and climate to be able to have this animal and also get milk and raise calves to sell them for meat in the future. With this purchase she will be able to put into practice another activity and also have savings that will allow her to keep having more animals and invest more in the property. This is the first loan that she has received from FUDECOSUR. She hadn’t had another loan before from a state bank, but FUDECOSUR has provided her the loan more easily and the interest rate is much lower.

loans.use: buy a cow for milk

loans.name: Sector Las Cruces 1 Group

texts.es:
Juana (la primera del lado izquierdo de la fotografía de blusa celeste) es una mujer de 37 año de edad, es casada tiene cuatro hijos de las edades entre 1y 14 años, esta humilde familia vive en  una comunidad de Suchitepéquez.
Juana con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica  al cultivo de maíz, ella realiza esta labor desde hace cinco años.
Juana ahora se ve a la necesidad de remodelar el techo de su casa y el piso, pues ya se encuentra en muy mal estado, pero una de las dificultades que ella tiene es que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente, por tal razón solicita un préstamo junto a un grupo de señoras, para poder comprar laminas, clavos, cemento y pisos.
Juana sueña con construir un local donde pueda instalar una tienda de abarrotes y dejarles una buena herencia a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Juana (first one from the left in the picture wearing a light blue blouse) is 37 years old. She is married with four children, ages between 1 and 14. This humble family lives in the community of Suchitepéquez.
Hoping to have an income and support her family, Juana works in a cornfield. She's been in this line of work for five years.
At the moment, Juana needs to remodel the roof and floor of her home because they are in very poor condition. One of her obstacles is that she hasn't been able to save enough money. For this reason, she is asking for a loan, alongside a group of women, to buy metal sheets, nails, cement and flooring.
Juana dreams with building her own venue where she can set up a grocery store and leave a good inheritance to her children.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets, nails, cement and flooring.

loans.name: Nkwa Traders Group

texts.en:
Comfort is a 40-year-old trader. She comes from Assin Fosu in the Assin North District of the Central Region of Ghana. She is a member of “Nkwa Traders”. Comfort is married with four children, aged 6, 10, 15 and 18 years old, and they are all currently schooling. She lives with her family at Assin Fosu. She sells plantains, cassava, etc. and also operates a provisions store to supplement her income. Comfort has been doing this kind of business for 15 years with much experience. She is very positive about the future of her businesses and she predicts obtaining a higher income in the years to come.

Comfort, together with her group, has been with the field partner since 2011. They were faithful with the repayments of all their previous eight loan cycles. Comfort hopes to expand her existing business in order to have a wide customer base. Her main priority now is to support her husband to sustain the payment of the school fees of their children. Comfort needs microloan assistance to assist her to buy fish, plantains, peppers, tomatoes, onions, garden eggs and cassava for resale to her customers to increase sales and income. She is thankful to all her Kiva lenders for their kindness.

loans.use: to buy fish, plantains, peppers, tomatoes, onions, garden eggs and cassava for resale.

loans.name: Josefina Estela

texts.es: Doña Josefina tienen tres años de prestar servicios de levantado de texto y fotocopiado en su comunidad. Solicita un préstamo de $500 para dar mantenimiento a su fotocopiadora y comprar los accesorios necesarios para mejorar el servicio  a sus clientes .
texts.en: Josefina has been providing printing and copying services in her community for the last three years. She is asking for a loan for $500 for technical support for her printer/copy machine and to buy accessories needed to improve the service to her customers.

loans.use: to fix her printer and buy accessories.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Província de Gaza tem 35 anos de idade, vive maritalmente pai de 1 filha menor de idade, responsabiliza-se pela sua mãe, irmã e sobrinha que vivem em sua casa.
Trabalha no Clube como Assistente Administrativo a mais de 7 anos onde aufere um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Enfrentando dificuldades para dar continuidade com a sua obra de residência solicita o seu 6º empréstimo na Hluvuku para adquirir material de construção como: areia, cimento e pedras. 
Futuramente pretende erguer capoeiras para a criação de poedeiras, para a produção de ovo para venda
texts.en:
Sergio comes from the province of Gaza. He's 35 years old and married. He has an underage daughter and he's responsible for his mother, sister and niece who live with him.
He has worked as an administrative assistant for a club for over seven years. He earns an income which he spends on household expenses. He's struggling to continue building his house, so he requests his 6th loan with Hluvuku in order to purchase construction supplies such as sand, cement and rocks.
In the future he intends to build coops to breed laying hens so he can produce eggs for selling.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and rocks.

loans.name: Maria Lucia

texts.es: La tienda domiciliar con la que cuenta María desde hace 10 años le ha permitido sacar adelante a sus hijos también apoya de su esposo que es agricultor y le apoya económicamente, pero también con los productos que cultiva. Hace muchos años  María de 51 años de edad junto a su esposo compraron un terreno en el cual han logrado construir su vivienda en la que habitan junto a sus 5 hijos una joven de 23 años y 4 varones de 21, 18, 15 y 9 años de edad. María siempre busca la manera de ofrecer la mayor variedad de productos para que sus clientes se sientan satisfechos con su negocio, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cereales, granos básicos, lácteos, bebidas, pan dulce, detergentes, jabón entre otros productos para su tienda.
texts.en: Maria has managed a store out of her home for 10 years that has allowed her to provide for her children and help her husband, a farmer who supports the family not only financially, but also with the produce he obtains. Many years ago, María, 51, and her husband bought land where they were able to build the home where they live with their 5 children a 23-year-old young woman, and 4 boys, ages 21, 18, 15 and 9. María is always looking for ways to provide the largest variety of products to her customers so they can be pleased with her business. This is why she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy cereal, basic grain, dairy products, soft drinks, fruit cake, detergent, soap and other products for her store.

loans.use: to buy in cereal, basic grain, dairy products, soft drinks, fruit cake, detergent, soap and other products for her store.

loans.name: Mileydis

texts.es: Mileydis es una joven que habita en una comunidad donde el servicio de agua es escaso, por esta razón ella solicita un crédito de $ 500 para comprar un tanque para almacenar agua, lo que le permitirá solucionar el problema de abastecimiento de este líquido.
texts.en: Mileydis is a young woman who lives in a community where access to water is scarce and for this reason she is asking for a $500 loan to buy a tank to store water, which will allow her to solve her water supply problem.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Francisco Rolando

texts.es:
Francisco, vive junto a su familia, es soltero y no tiene hijos, como una manera de ayudar con los gastos que tienen sus padres en el hogar inicio su propio negocio que consiste en cultivar maíz, el oficio se lo enseño se papá, actualmente lo realiza solo y no representa dificultades en hacerlo.
Como está por llegar el invierno quiere tener todo listo para sembrar en el tiempo justo y obtener mejores cosechas, el financiamiento le servirá para comprar abono, plaguicidas y semilla de maíz mejorada, será de beneficio para sembrar de manera inmediata, el objetivo es tener nuevos clientes y suficiente producto para vender y así mejorar sus ingresos.
Sus sueños son mantener su negocio con vida para tener los recursos necesarios para apoyar a su familia y para culminar su carrera universitaria y de esa manera superarse.
texts.en:
Francisco lives with his family, is single, and does not have children.  As a way of helping with the expenses that his parents have at home, he began his own business that consists of cultivating corn.  His father taught him the trade.  Now he does it alone and does not have difficulty in doing so.  

As winter is coming, he wants to have everything ready to plant at the right time and to get better yields.  The loan will help him to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and improved corn seed, which will be beneficial to plant immediately.  The objective is to have new customers and sufficient product to sell and in this way to increase his profits.

His dreams are to keep his business alive in order to have the necessary resources to support his family and to complete his university degree, and in that way to better himself.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and improved corn seed, which will be beneficial to plant immediately.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to process and store palm oil products

loans.name: Otilia

texts.pt:
Senhora Otília tem 27 anos de idade, vive maritalmente, é mãe de 3 filhos frequentando ensino primário, é negociante, vive em casa própria com a sua família a qual sustenta com ajuda do seu esposo que é  professor.
O montante financiado será aplicado para a compra de aros de janelas, cimento, areia, pedra para dar continuidade a construção da casa onde mora visto que ainda esta em construção.
No futuro pretende terminar a construção da sua casa e a posterior construir mercearia visto que agora vende ao relento.
A exiguidade de fundos torna seus projectos muito lentos, assim sendo vai continuar fazer empréstimos como forma de tornar mais célere os seus projectos.
texts.en:
Otília is 27 years old and married. She has three children who are in primary school. She's a vendor and lives with her family in a house that she owns. Her husband is a teacher and he helps her support the family.
The amount of the loan will be used to purchase window frames, cement, sand and rocks. That way she'll be able to continue building her house which is still under construction.
In the future she intends to finish building her house and then build a grocery store, since she's currently a street vendor.
Her funds are low, which slows down her projects. Therefore she'll continue getting loans as a way of speeding up her projects.

loans.use: to purchase window frames, cement, sand and rocks so she can continue building her house.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 43 years old and is married. Alma works running a quarry business and she buys and sells sand and gravel in the local community. She has always dreamed of managing her own business to support her five children.

Alma is requesting a loan to buy more loads of sand and gravel to meet the increasing demands of her customers. She will use her profits to repay her loan.

loans.use: to pay for loads of sand and gravel

loans.name: Fatima

texts.pt:
Senhora Fátima tem 43 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 3 filhos dos quais 2 estudam frequentando ensino primário e secundário respectivamente  lavadeira, vive em casa própria com o seu esposo.
O dinheiro financiado será aplicado para a compra de varões, cimento, pedra para a construção de muro de vedação da sua casa.
No futuro pretende mudar a cobertura da sua casa e construir casa de banho de fora de casa.
O seu maior desafio é de liquidar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora de modo a garantir futuros financiamentos.
texts.en:
Fátima is 43 years old and married. She has three children, two of whom attend primary and secondary school respectively. She's a laundress and lives with her husband in a house that she owns.
The money from the loan will be used to purchase rods, cement and rocks to build a fence wall around her house.
In the future she intends to replace the roof over her house and build an outdoor bathroom.
Her biggest challenge is repaying the loan without delinquency as a way of ensuring future loans.

loans.use: to purchase rods, cement and rocks to build a fence wall around her house.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel, who works alongside her husband Gregor, is an artisan who specializes in alpaca accessories. She would like to invest in a bulk purchase of alpaca wool.

Raquel has been selling through NOVICA since 2006. This is her story:

Raquel and husband Gregor are dedicated to preserving Peruvian textile traditions. "What draws us to weaving is the opportunity to work with natural fibers by rescuing ancient Inca weaving techniques. We love to see the transformation of loose yarns into garments and accessories. We help an Andean community by employing weavers on traditional looms who then help us finish each piece by hand."

"I'd like to thank everyone who has played a role in providing us with this opportunity. My goal for this microcredit is to invest in the raw material we need to weave more pieces and build up our inventory."

Use the link below to view Raquel's alpaca accessories on the NOVICA site:

http://www.novica.com/kiva/5826

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of alpaca wool

loans.name: Pricilla

texts.en:
Pricilla is 33 years old and married with one child. She lives in a rural community near Honiara, the capital of the Solomon Islands. Pricilla has a small garden where she grows cabbage and other vegetables that she sells in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for four years. Pricilla has been a member of SPBD since 2014. She joined to gain access to financial services.

Pricilla is requesting a 6,800 SBD loan to buy roofing iron to improve her home. She hopes to meet her family’s weekly expenses with the profits she makes with her business.

loans.use: to buy roofing iron to improve her home

loans.name: Adofo Traders No.1 Group

texts.en:
Comfort is 57 years old. She comes from Assin Foso in the Assin North district of the Central Region of Ghana. She is a group member of “Adofo Traders No. 1”. She is married with three children. The ages of the children are 21, 23 and 35 years old. Out of the three children one is currently schooling. Comfort is a trader who sells cement and has been in the business for the past six years. In the next five years, she wants to see consistent business progress by having other branches to help her generate more income to care for the family.

The relationship between Comfort and her group and the field partner has been since 2011. This is their 11th loan cycle with the field partner. The entire group has been on time with their previous 10 loan cycle repayments. Comfort needs a loan for additional working capital to buy more cement for resale to her customers. Cement is of high demand within her community and she will be able to generate enough income to help her husband to pay the children's school fees. Comfort thanks all her microlenders for their generosity.

loans.use: To buy cement for resale

loans.name: Aivys Mercedes

texts.es: Aivys es una joven emprendedora con seis años de experiencia en la venta de joyería diversa. Con un préstamo de $500 comprará prendas a comercios mayoristas para venderlas posteriormente al detalle. Con esto pretende aumentar sus ingresos y apoyar a su esposo e hija en la economía familiar.
texts.en: Aivys is a young entrepreneur with six years of experience selling a variety of jewelry. With this $500 loan she will buy items wholesale to resell retail later on. Her goal is to increase her income and support her husband and daughter contributing to the household financials.

loans.use: to buy and sell steel jewelry.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.en: Juan Carlos is 49 years old, married and has three daughters ages 24, 14 and 3. The oldest goes to the university and Juan Carlos says that she would like to eventually go to graduate school. The middle one also goes to school. He describes his family as dynamic, a family that sets goals and works to achieve them. Juan Carlos is asking for a loan to buy uniforms for the back to school season. He says that he needs to prepare because sales increase substantially in this part of the year. Juan Carlos has been selling uniforms for more than 30 years. The business was started by his father and he has made it grow.

loans.use: To buy clothing (school uniforms) for the back to school season.

loans.name: Augusto

texts.pt: O Sr Armando é militar de profissão, casado e pai de 4 filhos tem um sobrinho na sua responsabilidad, todos vão a escola,o Sr Armando tem um agregado familiar grande e vive numa casa pequena,esta situação levou o a começar com uma obra de raiz e grande para garantir uma boa acomodação para sua familia, mas o salario não é suficiente para dar continuidade com as obras e sentiu uma necessidade de solicitar um emprestimo para compra de chapas de zinco,portas,janelas e material electrico. O seu maior sonho é adiquirir uma viatura para facilitar a mobilidade da sua famila e a falta deste é o seu maior desafio devido ao baixo salario que ganha
texts.en: Armando is a serviceman. He's married and has four children and a nephew under his responsibility. All of them are in school. Armando has a big family and lives in a small house, and because of this situation he started buildind a larger house from the ground up so he can provide better living conditions for his family. However, his salary is not enough to continue the construction work. He felt the need to apply for a loan in order to purchase zinc plates, doors, windows and electrical supplies. His biggest dream is acquiring a vehicle to facilitate his family's transportation. The lack of a vehicle is his biggest challenge due to his low income.

loans.use: to purchase zinc plates, doors, windows and electrical supplies.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José, está solicitando un nuevo financiamiento para continuar trabajando en la agricultura, comprara insecticidas y una bomba de chila para poder fumigar sus cultivos y protegerlo de las plagas, así podrá tener una cosecha de maíz abundante.
El crédito anterior fue de mucha ayuda para adquirir los materiales necesario para disponerse a realizar la siembra granos básicos, las circunstancias familiares siguen siendo las mismas y ha tenido dificultades económicas por tal razón está solicitando nuevamente ayuda con un préstamo.
texts.en:
José is requesting a new loan to continue working in agriculture and will buy insecticides and a backpack sprayer to be able to fumigate his crops and protect them from infestation.  Thus he will be able to have an abundant harvest of corn.

The previous loan was a big help in acquiring the necessary materials to enable him to grow basic staple foods.  His family circumstances are still the same and they have had economic difficulties; for that reason he is again requesting help with a loan.

loans.use: to buy insecticides and a backpack sprayer to fumigate his crops and protect them from infestation, thus obtaining an abundant crop of corn

loans.name: Griselda

texts.en: Griselda paid her first loan on time and now is asking for a second loan to do some refurbishing in her laundry. She wants to improve the place to get more customers and improve the service provided. She also wants to pay for license plates for a taxi that she acquired which provides her with an additional source of income.

loans.use: To repair a laundry machine and a dryer.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en: Leticia is a 43-year-old single mother whose daughter is 20 years old. She lives with her father and doesn't pay rent but helps with the home expenses. She has two food stalls where she sells tamales with the help of her father and daughter. She doesn't pay them any wage, but they all live from the same business. Leticia is asking for a loan to buy some materials to increase her food production. She says that her goal is helping her daughter go to college.

loans.use: to buy materials to make and sell tamales (mexican corn bread).

loans.name: Igor

texts.en:
Igor sells furniture at several markets. He brings it in his truck and sells right from there. Also Igor offers transportation services. He is an active and responsible person. He plans to buy a new truck for work in the future.

Igor is asking for a loan of 20,000 UAH to purchase furniture. He wants to increase the assortment of beds and sofas. The loan will help Igor to increase his income and save money for the new truck.

loans.use: to purchase beds and sofas to sell.

loans.name: Charyl

texts.en:
Charyl has a banana farm which is the primary source of income for her family. She makes a point of preparing her land well to generate maximum yield and income. To generate additional earnings, Charyl wants to plant bananas and guyabano. 

Charyl is requesting a loan from Paglaum MPC to pay for land clearing and preparation as well as digging and planning seedlings. In the future, she wishes to grow more produce to be able to supply agri-products in the market.

loans.use: to  pay for land clearing and preparation

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio signed up for his membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. He is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like him. Because of his good salesmanship, Rogelio is making good sales these days and he wants to take advantage of his good fortune. 

Rogelio is requesting a loan to restock his store with basic commodities such as canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, he hopes to buy farmland for his desired farming activities.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, oil, and soy sauce

location.town: Oroquieta-San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City Misamis

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a hardworking mother from Aloran. She is 55 years old and a businesswoman who makes copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production). She buys whole coconuts for this. 

Elsa has taken out her membership with the cooperative to gain access to insurance and credit. She applied for a loan to buy whole coconuts for making copra. Elsa hopes to succeed in this business to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy whole coconuts to make copra

loans.name: Pochol 1 D Group

texts.es:
Magdalena es una mujer de 46 años de edad, es casada vive junto a sus dos hijos de las edades entre 19 y 24 años en una comunidad de Nahuala.
Magdalena (la primera del lado izquierdo de la fotografía)  con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a sus hijos se dedica a la venta de café desde hace doce años en el lugar denominado Pochol.
Magdalena para poder darle mantenimiento a unas parcelas de café que desde hace algún tiempo ha cultivado necesita de una buena cantidad de dinero para poder adquirir sus fertilizantes y pagar la mano de obra, pero una de las dificultades que ella tiene es que no cuenta con suficiente capital por tal razón organizo a un grupo de mujeres para que juntas soliciten un prestamo y conforme a sus necesidades  invertirlo.
El gran sueño de magdalena es instalar una tienda de compra y venta de abarrotes en su casa para mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Magdalena is a 46-year-old woman, is married and lives together with her two children, aged 19 and 24 years, in a community of Nahuala.  

Magdalena (the first on the left side of the photograph), with the desire to earn income and provide for her children, has made a living selling coffee for the last 12 years in a place called Pochol.  

In order to maintain several coffee plots that she has cultivated for some time, Magdalena needs a good quantity of money in order to be able to acquire her fertilizers and pay for labor.  However, one of the difficulties that she has is that she does not have sufficient capital.  For this reason, she organized a group of women so that together they can request a loan and invest the money according to their needs.  

Magdalena's great dream is to set up a store selling groceries in her house in order to improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 62 years old and lives in Bunawan, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. Pacita has been engaged in a farming business for 10 years already. She earns approximately 8,000 PHP each month from this work; this amount is so helpful to meet her family's needs. 

She has requested a loan to purchase additional construction materials for finishing their ongoing house construction. Pacita became a member of PMPC just this year. In the future, she hopes to expand her farming business and buy goat and cow for additional income.

loans.use: to buy additional sand and gravel

loans.name: Villa

texts.en:
Villa is 56 years old and lives in Aloran, Philippines. She is married, with four adult children. She is good at her farming activities and has had this business for more than 20 years. 

Villa has requested a loan to buy bags of fertilizer and herbicides to get more produce from her crops. She has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Villa hopes to engage in a new business to have more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer and herbicides to get a better yield from her crops

loans.name: Jenie

texts.en: Jenie is 42 years old and lives in Mauswagon, Calamba, Philippines. She is married with 3 children. She has had a fruit-vending business for 5 years. She requested a loan to buy 2 piglets and 1 sack of feed to provide her with another source of income. Jenie has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for 1 year. In the future, Jenie hopes to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy 2 piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: Wily

texts.en: Wily makes good earnings from her gardening activities in Aloran. This is the primary source of her income, which covers their needs. She wants to increase her farm's yield. She approached Paglaum to borrow money to purchase fertilizer and compost for her vegetables and other crops on her farm. She has high hopes that she will have good produce next cropping season.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and compost for her vegetables and other crops on her farm

loans.name: Filomena

texts.pt: Sra Filomena é casada, mãe de 3 filhos  e todos vam a escola. Seu marido trabalha num projecto na zona norte do país e so vem para o sul de 3 em 3 meses e ela trabalha no centro de saude local ,as dificuldades da vida e longe do marido  a dona Filomena viu se obrigada a abrir um negocio num pequeno estabelecimento onde vendia bebidas alcoolicas e refrigerantes,o seu negocio foi crescendo os clientes lhe exigiam mais espaço para diversão,vendo a incapacidade financeira a dona Filomena viu se obrigada a solicitar o seu primeiro  emprestimo na Hluvuku para comprar um aparelho GBOX para complementar os seus serviços.O seu maior sonho é tornar se uma empresaria de sucesso e viver perto do seu marido. O seu maior desafio é concluir o ensino superior.
texts.en: Filomena is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. Her husband works on a project in the country's northern area and only comes down south every three months. She works at a local healthcare center. Because of life's struggles and being away from her husband, Filomena felt compelled to start a business. She opened a small place where she sold alcoholic beverages and soft drinks. Her business grew and her customers demanded more space for entertainment. Not having the financial means for that, Filomena felt compelled to request her first loan from Hluvuku so she can purchase a satellite receiver as an additional service. Her biggest dream is to become a successful entrepreneur and live close to her husband. Her biggest challenge is finishing college.

loans.use: to purchase a satellite receiver as an additional service.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is a widow and lives in Aloran, Philippines. She is a diligent and persevering mother who has always been known to provide the best for her family. She earns a living by making snacks and refreshments that she sells on consignment in shops and cafes. 

She decided to expand her business after learning that she could obtain financial assistance through PMPC. Consequently, she has requested a 9,000 PHP loan to buy additional ingredients to increase production. Her goal is to be able to display her snacks in every shop and place to eat in the area. With the help and support of her children, Esterlita smiles at the thought of having a healthy and comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for the snacks she makes and sells

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
Diosdada is a woman with ten children, four of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Diosdada is 44 years old.

Diosdada has a fruit and vegetable business in the Philippines. Diosdada requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell in the market.

Diosdada has been in this business for three years. In the future, Diosdada would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell in the market

loans.name: Ilda

texts.pt: A sra Ilda é casada, mãe de 5 filhos  onde somente 4 é que vão a escola, o marido é trabalhador mas o salario que ganha é pouco que não consegue sustentar a familia e sendo assim  a Sra Ilda  sentiu a necessidade de  fazer  negocio,tem uma banca na rua da sua casa onde vende frutas como laranjas e banana. Para rentabilizar mais o seu negocio iniciou com a criação de frangos de abate e como forma de  impulsionar mais este negocio solicitar o empréstimo  para compra de pintos,ração e vitaminas.O seu maior sonho é crescer no negocio tornar se a maior produtora de frangos na sua zona.O seu maior desafio  é incrementar os rendimentos para  satisfazer as necessidades da sua familia.
texts.en: Ilda is married and has five children, four of whom are in school. Her husband is in the workforce, but the salary he earns is low and he can't afford to support his family. That's why Ilda felt compelled to start a business. She owns a stall on her street where she sells fruit such as oranges and bananas. In order to maker her business more profitable she started breeding broiler chickens. As a way of propelling this business forward she requested a loan in order to purchase chicks, feed and vitamins. Her biggest dream is to succeed in the business and become the most important chicken farmer in her area. Her biggest challenge is increasing her profits so that she can provide her family with what they need.

loans.use: to purchase chicks, feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Lenny Jean

texts.en: Lenny Jean is married and has 2 children. She supports the family through her sari-sari store business. She opened a store through the help of Paglaum and she would like to expand by adding more inventories. She applied another loan to restock sari-sari store inventories like canned goods, milk, noodles and rice. In the future, Lenny Jean hopes to open a mini mart in neighboring town.

loans.use: to restock sari-sari store inventories like canned goods, milk, noodles and rice

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Rey

texts.en: Rey has considerably preparing for the next cropping season. He wants to have higher yield for more income. He approached Paglaum MPC for the needed capital. He loaned an amount to buy fertilizers and farm inputs. Rey deeply wishes to support the education of his 3 children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and farm inputs, to help pay for his children's education

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Bemarie

texts.en:
Bemarie is 22 years old and happily married with one infant. She lives in Calube, Aloran. She became a regular member of PMPC. Her husband is doing labor work and gets only a daily wage but has no permanent work. 

In order to generate income for their daily needs, she engages in snack vending. Bemarie borrowed money from PMPC to buy additional ingredients to increase production of her food snacks. She dreams of nothing more than to live a comfortable life and have adequate income from her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients to increase production of her food snacks

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 43 years old and lives in Gata, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with no dependents. Rosie earns a living from her salary as a house helper. She earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of business activity. Her husband earns wages as a laborer and from hauling coconuts during harvest with his cart and carabao. 

She has requested a loan to purchase construction materials for house repair. Rosie has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, she hopes to engage in a retailing business.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for house repair

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 48 years old and has ten children. Elena is a married woman.

Elena is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Elena requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock. Elena has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Elena would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is 50 years old and has five children. She is married and has three children who are in school.

Felisa is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Felisa has been in this business for four years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Felisa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Imelda is 46 years old and has two children who are in school.

Imelda has a fish vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy boxes of fish to sell.

Imelda has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Imelda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 49 years old and married with five children. With three children in school, Lilian works very hard to provide for them.

Lilian runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like condiments, home product care, and other groceries.

Lilian has been in this business for 3 years now. 

In the future, Lilian would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like condiments, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is married, 23 years old and has two children.

Mary Grace is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Mary Grace requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Mary Grace has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mary Grace would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is married, 56 years old and has three children. 

Teresita is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Teresita has been in this business for 30 years now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Sry

texts.en:
Sry, 33, lives in a community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of three children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 5.00 a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine for the health and safety of her family

loans.name: Sergio

texts.pt: O Sr Sérgio casado e pai de 4 filhos  e todos vão a escola , é comerciante e faz esse negocio ja a bastante tempo juntamente com a esposa num regime ambulatorio. Os seus clientes são comerciantes da zona baixa da cidade, vai sempre a Africa do Sul buscar a mercadoria e entregar nas lojas. É desta maneira que consegue sustentar sua familia porque não teve sorte de conseguir um emprego por falta de uma boa formação academica ,mas para satisfazer a procura dos seus serviços por parte da clientela o sr Sr Sergio pede o quarto emprestimo na hluvuku para compra de diversas bebidas alcoolicas e carnes.O seu maior sonho é estudar e concluir o ensino superior e seu maior desafio é garantir bons estudos para seus filhos.
texts.en: Sérgio is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. He's a traveling salesman and has been in this line of work alongside his wife for a long time. His customers are vendors from downtown, and he always travels to South Africa to get the merchandise and deliver it to stores. That's how he's able to support his family, since he wasn't lucky enough to find a job due to a lack of a good academic degree. However, in order to meet the demands of part of the customers who seek his services Sergio is requesting his fourth loan from Hluvuku. It's for purchasing alcoholic beverages of various brands and meat. His biggest dream is to study and finish college. His biggest challenge is ensuring that his children get a good education.

loans.use: to purchase alcoholic beverages of various brands and meat.

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia is married, 39 years old and has six children, two of which are in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Virgilia requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Virgilia has been in this business for 6 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Virgilia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Germocila

texts.en:
Germocila engages in providing home made meals like pansit (noodles), stewed vegetables, fried fish and many others. She is  47 year old, a married woman with 7 children. Her youngest child is 2 year old. Aside from from food vending, she also raises and sells hogs, as supplemental income.

She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients like vegetables, meat and to purchase piglets and feed. These ingredients will be used in preparing variety of meals to be sold to the locals in her community. With these, her daily earnings will improve and she will be able to handle her finances. Thus she could be able to provide her children with nutritious diets and a better living condition. 

Germocila would like to improve her business to grow and be productive enough to support the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like vegetables, meat, and purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en:
Jinky is 31 years old, married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Jinky has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. Jinky requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF to buy clothes like blouses, pants, towels and other ready-to-wear clothing.

Jinky has been in this business for five years. In the future, Jinky would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes like blouses, pants, towels and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She runs a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Merlita dreams that one day,  she will be able to save enough money to expand her business

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 29 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a general store in the Philippines for three years and also earns income from food vending.

Mary Ann requested a 13,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through NWTF in order to buy items to sell in her store, such as canned goods, personal care products, etc.

Mary Ann borrowed and repaid four previous loans from NWTF. She aspires to save money to expand her business and to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store, such as canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.pt:
A senhora Elisa e pensionista militar, tem 63 anos de idade, casada, mae de 07 filhos todos maiores de idade apenas 1 frequenta o ensino secundario sustenta 3 netos dos quais 2 vivem com ela na casa propria e a outra enviando lhe dinheiro.
Com o valor do emprestimo ira comprar chapas de zinco, barrotes, pregos, janelas para a construcao de sua quinta.
Para o futuro projecta a criacao de frangos e patos para revender reforcando a renda familiar adiquirir uma viatura para movimentar melhor o seu negocio. 
Diz comprometer se a pagar pontualmente de maneiras a puder solicitar mais emprestimos para concretizar o seu plano.
texts.en:
Elisa is a military pensioner. She's 63 years old and married. She has seven children, all of whom are adults and only one is in secondary school. She supports three grandchildren. Two of her grandchildren live with her in a house that she owns, and she supports the other granddaughter by sending her money.
With the amount of the loan she'll purchase zinc plates, beams, nails, and windows in order to build her farm.
In the future she plans to raise chickens and ducks for re-selling so she can improve her family's income. She also plans to buy a vehicle to improve her business.
She states that she pledges to repay the loan in a timely fashion so that she can apply for other loans and achieve her plan.

loans.use: to purchase zinc plates, beams, nails, and windows.

loans.name: Et

texts.en:
ET is a 42-year-old woman from a remote area of Kompong Cham Province. She is the mother of two children. She is a grocery seller and earns, on average, $5.00 a day.

She would like to improve her living standards by having clean energy for household use. Because of the lack of capital, she is asking for a loan to build a biogas digester under the project of NBP (National Biogas Program) in partnering with HKL. After an initial investment in this system, she hopes that she won’t spend much money on fuel and lessen the smoke from wood or charcoal. 

She is very happy and thankful because with this kind of loan product, HKL has offered a special interest rate better than its general loans. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to build a biogas digester.

loans.name: Sari Wangi Ternak Group

texts.en:
The Sari Wangi Ternak group has had success in paying off their loan on time. All the members have come to pay their own loan to the head of the group, Ni Kadek. Ni Kadek is a housewife and also a pig breeder. Her husband works as a farmer. From the last loan, she had success in maintaining her pigs. She sold the pigs for fattening. She earned a satisfactory profit, enough to fulfill her family's needs and also save. She’s very happy and says thank you for the support she had.

The Sari Wangi Ternak group has received their new loan and they are using it to support their pig business. Ni Kadek and her husband are hardworking, not only as a farmer, but as a pig breeder also. The loan will be used to purchase 2 piglets, each 500.000 IDR and the rest of the loan will be used for feed. Now the price for piglets and feed are very high. Ni Kadek will need to be very wise to manage the loan and run the business to get maximal profits in the end. She hopes during the loan period the pigs can grow fast and fat, free from diseases. Ni Kadek and the members of Sari Wangi Ternak also hope MUK will continue to support the group until they have enough capital to run their business by themselves.

loans.use: to buy 2 piglets and feed

loans.name: Chheang

texts.en: CHHEANG, 65, comes from Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province. She is a lovely mother of four married children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small piece of farmland which is located near her house. On her farmland, she grows rice and sells her agricultural products to the local dealers. So far, she has been in this type of business for thirty-five years. On average, she can earn USD 5.00 per day. In this farming season, she would like to hire some people to help her in the plowing process. That is why she would like a KIVA loan, to pay for hiring laborers. She would like to thank to all the lenders for their financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for hiring laborers

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Flordeliza is 38 years old and has three children who are in school.

Flordeliza has a food vending business in the Philippines. Flordeliza requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

She has been in this business for five years. In the future, Flordeliza would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Diosidilla

texts.en:
Diosidilla is married and works hard to support her family. For the past four years she has sold vegetables to earn an income in the Philippines.

Diosidilla has applied for a 14,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell in her produce stand. She is working to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her produce stand.

loans.name: Isidra

texts.en:
Isidra is 57 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Isidra has run a general store in the Philippines for four years. She sells a variety of items, such as canned goods, snack foods, noodles, candies, biscuits, detergent soap, etc. She requested a 20,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of these items to sell.

Isidra would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more canned goods, snack foods, noodles, candies, biscuits, detergent soap, etc., to sell in her store.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 43 years old and widowed with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Marites is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Marites has been raising pigs for 5 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Edralyn

texts.en:
Edralyn is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Edralyn is 27 years old and both of her children are in school.

Edralyn has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF in order to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Edralyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Mercilyn

texts.en:
Mercilyn is 45 years old, married, and has four children. Mercilyn wants to increase her income and help her husband to earn a living. 

Her husband is the one who drives their motorcycle to gain more income. Mercilyn wants to increase her income, so she borrowed a loan to buy a sidecar for the motorcycle so that it can cater to more passengers than a single motor.

For the future, Mercilyn wants to save money from her business.

loans.use: to buy sidecar for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Crizaldo

texts.pt:
O senhor Crizaldo de 37 anos é  casado, pai de 04 filhos todos a estudar não sustenta mais ninguém além dos seus filhos, vive na casa dos serviços. 
Com o valor do empréstimo diz que quer comprar varões, estribos, blocos e cimento para a sua obra tipo 2 na fase da viga geral.
O projecto para o futuro terminar a sua obra,mobilar e mudar se da casa do servico para sua casa, voltar a estudar, oficializar sua relacao, casando.
O seu maior desafio é a insuficiência de fundos mas diz que irá solicitar mais empréstimos para tal vai pagar pontualmente.
texts.en:
Crizaldo is 37 years old and married. He has four children, all of whom are in school. He doesn't support anyone else other than his children. He lives in company housing.
He states that with the amount of the loan he will purchase rods, stirrups, bricks and cement to build his two-bedroom house which is in its middle stages.
The project for the future is to finish the construction work, furnish the house, and move out of company housing and into his own home. He also plans to go back to school and get officially married.
His biggest challenge is the lack of funds, but he states that he'll apply for more loans and to that end he'll repay the loan in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to purchase rods, stirrups, bricks and cement.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 43 years old and has five children. Nenita is married and two of her children are in school.

Nenita is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines and requested a 9000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock. Nenita has been raising pigs for 3 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Nenita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle, 42, is married and has four children, three of whom are in school. For the past fifteen years she has worked hard selling fish to earn an income in the Philippines.

Annabelle has applied for a 13,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy more fish to sell. She is working to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia, 52, is married and has four children, one of whom is still in school. For the past three years she has worked diligently running her sari-sari, or small general store in the Philippines.

Antonia has applied for a 12,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy items to sell in her shop such as canned goods, beverages, snack foods, home care products and other groceries. She is working so as to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari, or general store.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie works hard to support four children. She is married and has a business fattening pigs business in the Philippines.

Rosie requested a PHP 6750 loan through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency.

Rosie is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.en:
Blanca is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Blanca is 52 years old and has one child in school.

Blanca has a fish vending business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy boxes of fish to sell.

Blanca has been in this business for 22 years. In the future, Blanca would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn works hard to support her family. She has a live-in partner and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Jenalyn has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Jenalyn has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Carina

texts.en:
Carina is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Carina is 51 years old now.

Carina has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

Carina has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, Carina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 59 years old and married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Teresita has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Teresita has been in this business for eight years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment

loans.name: Anelyn

texts.en:
Anelyn is a mother with a good heart who wants for her three children a good life. She also wants to help her husband in providing for their family. Her husband is a farmer who works in their corn farm, while Anelyn is focusing on their corn production business. 

She and her husband want to increase her income and to have this, they must have good production on their corn farm. So she decided to borrow a loan to purchase fertilizer and pesticides for the corn farm.

Anelyn wants for the future to save money to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticides for the corn farm.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 42 years old and married with three children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Elma has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 18 years. Elma requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other fishing supplies.

In the future, Elma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Josie works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling sea shells. Josie is borrowing PHP 21000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Josie has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Leopoldina

texts.pt:
A senhora Leopoldina tem 33  anos, operária agricola, mãe solteira de 03 filhos a estudarem, vive na casa da seu irmão.
Com o valor do empréstimo diz que vai comprar arros para as janelas e terminar a construção da casa de banho, comprando cimentos , blocos e areia .
O projecto para o futuro é  terminar asua casa, ampliando, fazer a instalação eléctrica.
O seu maior desafio e a insuficiência de fundos mas diz que ira solicitar mais empréstimos para tal vai pagar pontualmente.
texts.en:
Leopoldina is 33 years old. She's a farm worker and a single mother. She has three children who are in school, and she lives with her brother.
She states that with the amount of the loan she'll purchase frames for the windows. She'll also purchase cement, bricks and sand in order to finish building the bathroom.
Her project for the future is to finish her house, enlarge it and install electric wiring.
Her biggest challenge is insufficient funds. However, she states that she'll apply for more loans, and to that end she'll repay the loan in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to purchase frames for the windows and to purchase cement, bricks and sand to finish building the bathroom.

loans.name: Lesther Abdiel

texts.es: Lesther es un pequeño productor con siete años de experiencia en la ceba de cerdos. Con un préstamo de $500 podrá comprar cuatro crías de cerdos y alimentos para cebarlos. Considera así aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su esposa e hija.
texts.en: Lesther is a small producer with seven years of experience in raising pigs. With a $500 loan he will buy 4 piglets and food to fatten them. He believes that he will increase his earnings and improve the quality of life of his wife and daughter.

loans.use: To buy and fatten pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, sand and electrical supplies so she can continue the construction work.

loans.name: Julio Samuel

texts.es: Don Julio tiene cincuenta años trabajando en la construcción. Cuenta con un pequeño grupo de colaboradores y presta sus servicios en construcción de viviendas y locales. Con el préstamo de $250 que solicita pretende mejorar las condiciones del vehículo que utiliza para el traslado de personal y equipo. Con los ingresos que genera se sostiene a sí mismo y a su esposa.
texts.en: Don Julio has 50 years working in construction. He has a small group of helpers and offers his services building houses and businesses. With the $250 loan he is asking for, he intends to improve the condition of his vehicle which he utilizes to transport personnel and equipment. With the earnings he hopes to support himself and his wife.

loans.use: To fix his work vehicle.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 64 years old and married with three children.

Rosalinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like feeds, rice, detergent soap, diapers, candies, soft drinks, etc. to sell.

Rosalinda has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Rosalinda aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like feeds, rice, detergent soap, diapers, candies, soft drinks, etc., to sell

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Natividad es una mujer de 50 años de edad, viuda, tiene un hijo de 18 y una hija de 15 años, y su negocio es la venta de prendas de vestir de lana.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, optimista, activa, constante, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza de forma ambulante en distintas zonas de la ciudad como la ‘Ceja’ y la ‘feria 16 de julio’; que son áreas centrales situadas al este de la ciudad, reúne a gran parte de los edificios administrativos, comerciales y sedes de organizaciones sociales. De clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Natividad es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, estatura mediana, complexión física robusta, su forma de vestir es tradicional (pollera, manta y sombrero), su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con sus dos hijos; el mayor trabaja como chófer y la hija menor estudia en la escuela secundaria, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica, gas domiciliarios y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de lana como; guantes, gorros, ropa de bebe, chalinas, polainas (medias de lana), etc., actividad que realiza de forma ambulante visitando ferias y comercios de la zona, todos los días de la semana en horario del día, “inicié mi actividad cuando vivía mi esposo, por la necesidad de alimentar a mis hijos…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que debido al clima del lugar las ventas son contantes durante todo el año, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para aumentar las variedades de ofertas. Su sueño es producir la ropa que vende para que su hija tenga un negocio con el cual pueda vivir, ella desea realizar la compra de lana por mayor para tejer prendas como; chalinas y guantes. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Natividad solicita un préstamo para la compra de lana por mayor para tejer prendas de invierno y trabajar junto a su hija.
texts.en:
Natividad is a 50 year old widow,  who has an 18-year-old son and a 15-year-old daughter. She sells woolen clothing.

She is a good mother, enterprising, a fighter, optimistic, strong, determined, responsible and hard working. Her business includes ambulant sales in different areas of the city, such as the ’ceja de El Alto’ and the ‘feria 16 de julio’; both places are very popular and commercial, and it concentrates a great part of the administrative, commercial and social organizations. This location has a cold and dry climate, with a temperature which fluctuates between 0-12 degrees Celsius.

Natividad has a dark complexion, is of medium height, has long black braided hair, and wears typical dress (skirt, poncho and hat). Her mother tongue is aymara which she speaks at home; she speaks Spanish for commerce. She sells woolen clothing, such as gloves, hats and baby clothes.

She shares her life with her two children; the eldest works as a driver and the youngest daughter is in high school. They live in a rented house built out of brick and cement, with a corrugated metal roof and wooden floors. It has running water, electricity and, gas, and sewage. Her business is selling wool clothing such as gloves, hats, baby clothes, scarves, wool socks, etc. She sells these items on the street visiting fairs, and businesses around the area, everyday during the day. The advantage of her business is that, due to the cold climate, she has steady sales throughout the year. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to invest in a variety of products. Her dream is to have her daughter produce the clothing that they sell, so that her daughter can have her own business. She would like to buy wool wholesale to knit clothing such as scarves and gloves. This is the second loan with the institution in 5 years of working in this activity.  Thus, Natividad is requesting a loan to buy wool wholesale to knit winter clothing and work with her daughter.

loans.use: to buy wool at wholesale to weave winter clothing and work together with her daughter.

loans.name: Babi Rahayu Group

texts.en:
There is something encouraging to tell about the development of the Babi Rahayu group. After passing a couple of times a loan, all members of the group can pay off and some members can save their profit. In the period of the loan, they could sell the pigs with a satisfying price so that they could keep most of the advantages for working capital.

Ni Ketut sold eight pigs and earned a satisfactory profit. All profits were used to support the welfare of her family. The group will continue its borrowing with the remaining members. They said thank you for the help they have received. 

The Babi Rahayu group continues its loan; each received 1,500,000 IDR. The total loan is 21,000,000 IDR.

Ni Ketut will use the loan to buy two superior quality piglets and feed. Besides having a sow, she has three piglets to manage for fattening. She hopes this effort will be more advanced, and that she gets a satisfactory result so that she can be independent and continue the business with her own capital.

Two members couldn't attend the meeting due to a wedding ceremony.

loans.use: to buy two superior quality piglets and feed

loans.name: Fernando

texts.pt:
O senhor Fernando de 55 anos de idade, casado e pai de 7 filhos destes 3 ainda a estudar 2 ja maiores de idade e nas suas casas sustenta 2 netos que vivem com eles na casa propria.
Com o valor quer comprar cimento, ferro, barrote, pedra, areia, para dar continuidade  a ampliacao de sua casa.
Terminar a sua obra, electrificar, mobilar a casa e fazer uma loja para reforcar a sua renda familiar.
Diz que os seus principais desafios sao a insuficiencia de fundos e para ultrapassar-la faz depositos numa conta poupanca e que vai pagar pontualmente e voltar a solicitar mais emprestimos para concretizacao de seu projecto.
texts.en:
Fernando is 55 years old and married. He has seven children, three of whom are still in school and two are already adults and in their own homes. He supports two grandchildren who live with him in a house that he owns.
With this loan he wishes to purchase cement, iron, beams, rocks and sand in order to continue enlarging his house.
He will finish the construction work, furnish his house and set up a store as a way of improving his family's income.
He states that his biggest challenge is the lack of funds, and to overcome that he makes deposits into a savings account. He states that he'll repay the loan in a timely fashion and apply for more loans so he can achieve his project.

loans.use: to purchase cement, iron, beams, rocks and sand.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.pt:
A senhora Julieta tem 51 anos é comerciante, mãe de 06 filhos todos  já maiores de idade, divorciada sustenta 5 netos que vivem com ela na casa própria. 
Com o valor do empréstimo diz que vai comprar refrescos, cervejas, arroz,  bolachas, açúcar, feijão, massas para reforçar a sua banca.
Tem como projecto para o futuro crescer no negócio satisfazendo as necessidades de seus clientes, ter uma estabelecimento com melhores condições e contratar alguém para lhe ajudar no negócio.
O seu maior desafio é a insuficiência de fundos mas diz que irá solicitar mais empréstimos para tal vai honrar com o compromisso assumido aquando da assinatura do contrato com a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Julieta is 51 years old. She's a vendor and a mother of six adult children. She's divorced and supports five grandchildren who live with her in a house that she owns.
She states that with the amount of the loan she'll purchase refreshments, beer, rice, crackers, sugar, beans and noodles to stock her booth.
Her project for the future is to make her business grow by meeting her customers' needs. She also plans to own a store that's in better shape and hire someone to help her in the business.
Her biggest challenge is insufficient funds. However, she states that she'll apply for more loans, and to that end she'll honor the contract she committed to when she signed with Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase refreshments, beer, rice, crackers, sugar, beans and noodles.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 50 years old and married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Lolita has a general store business in the Philippines. Lolita requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

Lolita has been in this business for four years. In the future, Lolita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell

loans.name: Elinita

texts.en:
Elinita is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Elinita is 60 years old now.

Elinita has a mat weaving business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed for her business.

Elinita has been in this business for 40 years. In the future, Elinita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her business

loans.name: Antonio

texts.pt: O Senhor António vive numa casa própria com a esposa e um filho.  É militar, com o presente empréstimo vai adiquirir materiais de contrução tais como cimento, areia, ferros, pedra para dar continuidade a sua obra  onde reside. Tem sonho de abrir um estabelecimento comercial e comprar uma viatura de transporte de carga para melhorar a sua renda familiar. Tem como maior desafio ter meio de financiamento.
texts.en: António lives with his wife and a son in a house that he owns. He's a serviceman. With this loan he'll purchase construction supplies such as cement, sand, iron, and rocks in order to do construction work on his house. His dream is to open a store and buy a cargo-carrying vehicle as a way of improving his family's income. His biggest challenge is obtaining loans.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, iron and rocks to do construction work on his house.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha 54 años de edad es una mujer emprendedora que todos los días pone todo su esfuerzo y carisma para sacar adelante a su negocio de una tienda de productos básicos, la cual instalo en su vivienda desde hace 30 años, por lo que es muy reconocida sobre todo por contar con una gran cantidad de productos. Martha habita en vivienda de su propiedad desde hace muchos años junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos una jovencita de 19 años y dos varones de 17 y 13 años de edad que se encuentran estudiando con el apoyo de sus padres. Martha desea seguir dándose a conocer con sus clientes por contar con una gran variedad de productos y de esta manera continuar contando con sus clientes, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lácteos, embutidos, carnes, detergentes, jabón pan dulce, cereales y granos básicos para surtir su tienda.
texts.en:
54-year old Martha is a hardworking businesswoman who puts a great effort and heart every day into growing her business, a store selling basic necessities. The store has been located in her home for thirty years and is well known above all for the wide variety of goods to be found there. Martha has lived there for many years with her husband and three children, a 19-year old daughter and two sons aged 17 and 13 who are students and supported by their parents.

Martha wishes to continue providing her customers with the service and products for which she is well-known so she is seeking a loan from FUSAI to buy stock such as dairy products, cold cuts, meat, detergent, soap, sweet bread, cereals, and basic grains.

loans.use: Buy dairy products, cold cuts, meat, detergent, soap, sweet bread, cereals, and basic grains as stock for her store

loans.name: Bakaye's Group

texts.fr: Bakaye qui se trouve sur la photo tenant la pochette de n'gasene en main du cote droite de la photo, est membre d’un groupe de 9 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Kabe au sud de Bamako au Mali. Bakaye, âgé de 34 ans, est le père de 2 enfants âgés de 1 à 3 ans, dont aucun d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés.  L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'agriculture comme activité génératrice de revenu complétant son travail principal de , ont incité Bakaye à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 18 ans. Bakaye cultive le mais, le sorgho, le maraîchage sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériels agricoles et d'engrais de qualité. Bakaye entame sa deuxième année avec myAgro, et s'est réinscrit en raison du système de paiement et des semences de qualité, ainsi que des engrais de qualité.
